loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
This is Esmeralda, 61, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Nolasco, a driver, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, Esmeralda is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her child’s schooling. 

Esmeralda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Esmeralda dreams to grow her business in the coming years, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to get married and have their family some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose's group is comprised of 5 hard working ladies. Rose is 21 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more spear parts for resale, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly (pictured here), 31, and her husband, Sopheak, 31, live in a suburb approximately twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one young son.

Somaly stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business. He sells cosmetic and perfume and sprays. He buys them from Phnom Penh market and carries them in his own van to sell in other provinces away from his house. 

Somaly is asking for a loan of $1,000 to provide capital for her husband to buy additional cosmetics perfume and sprays to sell.

loans.use: To provide capital for her husband to buy additional cosmetics perfume and sprays to sell.

loans.name: Dolkhuu

texts.en: Dolkhuu is a 22-year-old single young man who lives with his parents and sister in Dornod, a province of Mongolia. This province is located far from the capital city Ulaanbaatar. He works at an on-call taxi service company. With his honesty and hard work, he has many loyal customers and his earnings are increasing rapidly. Therefore, he is managing to save for his future. Currently he needs to change his car tires to winter ones as the winter is slippery. It is very important to his and his passengers' safety. Therefore, he is requesting to purchase 4 winter tires and some spare parts for his car. He said that he can successfully pay back the loan on time with his income.

loans.use: To purchase 4 winter tires and some spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Vanroeun

texts.en:
Vanroeun (in the photo), 26, and her husband, Channa, 31, live in a village along National Road number five approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two young sons.

Vanroeun sells gasoline at home. Her husband is a driver who drives for a company. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy her neighboring land to expand her land property.

loans.use: To buy her neighboring land to expand her land property.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling beer in the town of Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.
Zakia requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more beer for sale. She will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more beer for sale.

loans.name: Zevgee

texts.en: Zevgee lives with her daugther in a ger (a Mongolian yurt/ nomadic tent) in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Her daughter is a high school student. She operates a business planting and selling vegetables. She started her business in 2002. She has many years of work and business experience. She is a diligent and open-minded woman who says, "I want to expand my business and increase my profit within my capacity and ability." She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy vegetables from the Hovd province to sell in her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for sale

loans.name: Yieng

texts.en:
Yieng (in the photo with her loom) and her husband, Pao, live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children - one son and four daughters. 

Yieng is a weaver, and her husband is a fisherman who raises cows at home. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, who is 38 years old and resides in Silang, Cavite City, in the Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a driver, and she has one child. She and her husband manage their own household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and to support her child’s schooling. 

Erlinda oversees the operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a daily quota each day to her. Aside from this, she also sells products via direct sales to her customers. In her business, her regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and to pay for its maintenance. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Erlinda dreams of being able to give her child a high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and she draws strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit.

loans.name: Abdulchalil

texts.ru: Абдучалил проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 43 года. Женат. Имеет пятерых детей. Уже десять лет как занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает масла для автомобилей. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара. Он намерен купить другие виды автомобильного масла.
texts.en: Abdulchalil lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  He has been involved in sales for ten years.  He leases a retail outlet, where he sells automotive oil.  He is requesting this loan to increase his merchandise assortment.  Abdulchalil plans to buy other types of automotive oil.

loans.use: to buy automotive oil

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
Ritah is 16 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past year, Ritah has been working hard to manage her catering business, with which she delivers hot meals to local families and businesses. 

To help expand her business, Ritah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy electric stoves, plates, and chairs for the customers, and will help Ritah to generate greater profit and pay the school fees for her siblings. Ritah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a tailoring machine. 

Ritah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Ritah's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electric stoves, plates, and chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Chengheng

texts.en:
Chengheng (in the photo) is a carpenter and fisherman, while his wife Saro is a weaver.  They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three daughters, two of whom are garment workers and another one stays at home. 

Chengheng is requesting a loan in the amount of US$500 to buy wooden materials to repair the house where he lives because it is breaking in some part.

loans.use: To buy wooden materials to repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Tugeme Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her late 30s is married with three children who go to school. She has been running several types of businesses. She has a grocery store, a beauty salon, sells second-hand clothing, and motor cycle spares.  She has been in these businesses for eight years now. She works from 8 a.m to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start the beauty salon, second-hand clothes selling business, and the motor cycle spare sales. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the grocery store stock, salon equipment, second-hand clothing, and motor cycle spares.  Her dream is to be able to build her own house one day.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Tugeme" which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her grocery store stock, purchase beauty salon equipment, second-hand clothing, and motor cycle spares.

loans.name: Steller

texts.en:
Steller is a married woman with five children who attend school. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house with has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has been operating a fuel sales business for the past one year. In addition, she has a cereals shop. Her potential clients are motorcycle operators. She faces a major challenge of fuel price fluctuation. She dreams of expanding her business into a filling station.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase more fuel for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fuel for sale.

loans.name: Japherson

texts.en:
Japherson is a 30-year-old married man. He is a food vendor.  His business has been in operation for the last three years. 

Japherson was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks his first borrowing to finance his business. With this loan, he plans to expand his business premise and to purchase more chicken for roasting. 

The profits that will be generated from his business will be directed into the gradual expansion of his business and the repayment of the loan. His  dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to expand his business premise and to purchase more chicken

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly (in the photo) and her husband, Khan, have been married since 1997 and have one daughter who is a garment worker. They are living in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Ly now stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her daughter’s salary and her husband’s business. Her husband is a mason. Ly is applying for her second loan, for $300, to purchase a cow to raise. She hopes she will be able to earn extra income from selling calves when the cow delivers a baby.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Saphina

texts.en:
Saphina is 17 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Saphina has been working hard to manage her farm, which sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Saphina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to rent land to be used for farming and will help Saphina to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Saphina hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Saphina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Saphina’s future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to rent land to be used for farming

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom (in the photo) and her husband, Maly, live in a village along National Road Number 5, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: one son and three daughters. 

Mom sells grocery items at her home. Her husband is a construction worker. She is applying for her second loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
This is Gil, 40, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is single and manages his own household while operating the business.  At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. 

Gil operates a school supplies business. It is where one can buy school supplies like pens, bond paper, cartolina (heavy colored paper) and the like, without going to a bookstore. He gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of school supplies to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Gil hopes to be able to expand soon .He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of school supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 26 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator branch. She has been in this business for five years. She can also earn income from selling groundnut paste.

Mary requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shampoo, a blow dryer and hair conditioners to add to her stock.

loans.name: Jallety

texts.en:
Jallety is 51 years old, married, and a mother of two children.  She owns a rental house in Kilifi. Jallety has been in this business for the past 15 years and it’s been a success. 

She has been a KADET client and this marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to renovate one unit of the rental house. 

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business and used to repay the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to renovate one unit of her rental house

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom is 37 years old and her husband, Saroeun, is 46 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: three sons and one daughter. One is married, one is a security guard and the other two are in school. 

Sreymom is a weaver and her husband is a soldier. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son, who is a security guard, to drive to work.

Photo: Sreymom is standing next to the motorcycle because she bought it but has not yet paid for it.  So she asks for the loan to pay for it.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Malikakhon

texts.ru: Маликахон жительница города Худжанд.  Возраст, 41 год. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Она занимается торговлей женской одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа туники, теплых колготок, плащей и нижнего белья.
texts.en: Malikakhon is a resident of the town of Khujand.  She is 41 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in sales of women's clothing and has been in this business for five years.  Malikakhon is requesting this loan for the purchase of tunics, warm stockings, raincoats and undergarments.

loans.use: to purchase of tunics, warm stockings, raincoats and undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Jepchirchir

texts.en:
She is 38 years old and married to Jonah. She supports a family of seven people. Her spouse is a farmer and together they support the family.

She has been operating her retail shop for a period of five years. She was given a loan of KSHS 20,000, which she plans to use to buy more goods like sugar, salt and wheat flour to sell. She earns a monthly income of KSHS 15,000.

The anticipated profit from her business will be used to add more stock to the business. This is her first loan and so she hopes to pay it back well. Her dreams and hopes are to improve her future business and family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like sugar, salt and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Jaih

texts.en: Jaih is 40 years old and lives with his wife and children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Bayan-Ulgii province in Mongolia. His wife works at the local company. His two children are high school students. He started his business in 1999 by selling livestock. He has been managing the same business until now. He started the business with turnover capital of 200,000 MNT. Now this turnover has increased to 800,000 MNT. Now he owns a commercial space to sell the livestock at the local market. He is a diligent and hard working man who says, "When my business goes well and make more profits, I plan to purchase a car." He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat at whole sale price.

loans.use: To purchase more meat at whole sale price

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en:
Sambath (in the photo) is a weaver. In addition, she also buys some cotton and silk products from the weavers in her village and sells them in other places away from her house. Her husband, Set, is a primary-school teacher.

Sambath is asking for another loan of $300 to more purchase cotton and silk products for sale.

The couple has been married since 1979 and has five children: two sons and three daughters. Two children are married and live in separate homes; two assist their mother in the business; and another one is in school. They live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To purchase cotton and silk products for sale.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 26-year-old businessman. He is married to Irene, who is employed. They have no children yet. He has been selling new clothes for the past four years with the monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Henry will use the loan to buy more clothes for his business stock. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand it. 

His hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop that will give him good income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for his business stock.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Christina has been working hard to manage her business of making and selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Christina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood to be used for burning to make charcoal, and will help Christina to generate greater profits and pay school fees for siblings. Christina hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a salon. 

Christina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Christina's future prospects by helping her to improve her capital.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to be used to make charcoal.

loans.name: Oosor

texts.en: Mr. Oosor is 51 years old and the father of three daughters. He lives with his wife and youngest daughter in an apartment that they just bought. He has been working for Ulaanbaatar Railway Company as a serviceman of the train for 15 years. His wife is an accountant in a private company. They have another apartment located on the first floor of the building, and it is possible to use it as a cafeteria. Oosor wants to renovate that apartment for a cafeteria business. He is requesting a loan to make renovations to this apartment.

loans.use: To make renovations to his apartment for a cafeteria.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with five school-going children. Her husband is a reporter who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past three years; her potential clients are the neighbors. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of the access to business loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Reli Group

texts.en:
Abdalah, who is in his mid-30s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  He also takes care of his mother.  He has been running a general store business for one year now.  He works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to stock the missing items from the general store.  He also bought a piece of land.  He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants this loan to increase the store's inventory.  His dream is to one day be able to make his general store into a supermarket.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Reli.  Reli has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase his store's inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy school desks, chairs and tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his fridge and buy more milk.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 27-years-old and married to Beatrice. They have a child who is two -years-old and who has not yet to started going to school.

William has a retail business that he runs and it consists of selling earrings, necklaces, head gears etc. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him increase his stock.

He hopes to open a cosmetic shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy more earrings, necklaces, etc., to add to his stock.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling beer and local waragi in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.
Viola requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC South Sudan, with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that in the future she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and local brewery waragi for sale.

loans.name: Monje

texts.en:
Monje is a married woman with nine children, three of whom attend school, and six of whom are all grown up. She has a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Monje has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumable items like maize flour, wheat flour and rice to her customers, who are local area residents. A major challenge she faces in her business is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business into a wholesale shop in the future.

With her 30,000 KES loan, Monje wants to purchase ten bundles of maize flour for her retail shop. She decided to join Yehu to access business loans.

loans.use: to purchase ten bundles of maize flour for her retail shop.

loans.name: Tileu

texts.en: Tileu is 37 years old and lives with his wife and child in a ger, a Mongolian yurt (nomadic tent), in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. He started a family business of selling meat in 2010. Aside from the family business, he has a full-time job. However, his family business is only active in the fall season. He is planning to purchase more animals and to store their meat during this time of year. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my capital turnover." He is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock from the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase livestock from the countryside.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 54, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a technician, and is the mother of their two children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine Pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Teresita hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items and products for her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a 27-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling distilled alcohol in Kator, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.
Julia requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC South Sudan, with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more distilled alcohol for sale.

loans.name: Rugendo

texts.en:
Rugendo is a married man with three children, one of whom attends school while two have graduated from school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Rugendo owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.
Rugendo has operated a business buying and selling goats for meat for the past two years. He sells from home to his neighbors and passers-by. In addition he practises farming, which is another source of income. He faces the major challenge of transporting the goats from their place of purchase to his place of operation. He dreams of opening a slaughterhouse one day.
With this 40,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase more goats for sale. He decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, so that he can access funds.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business premises.

loans.name: Damaris Kavee

texts.en:
Damaris is 36 years old, married and has six children aged between 2 and 15. She hopes to give a good education to her children to the university level.
Damaris sells clothes at a shopping center in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. Damaris has been selling dresses, trousers, etc. for the last five years to local people. She says that this business is profitable but the major challenge she has is that in some seasons she registers low sales. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 20,000 KES to restock her clothes business to grow it into a boutique. In the future, she hopes to build a house for her family. She describes herself as aggressive, committed and responsible.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 2 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her business, which sells phone airtime. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy phone airtime for resale, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to own a poultry farm. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Agnes's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy phone airtime for resale.

loans.name: Violy

texts.en:
Violy is 26 years old, a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling beans, rice, breads in the Kator branch in south Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Violy requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more breads, rice, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 38 years old, married to Rose and they have three children. 

Charles has a business of selling shoes and handbags and has been in the business for the past ten years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him to increase his inventory of shoes and handbags. He hopes to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to add to his stock.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who all go to school. She has one additional family member (brother). 

Sylvia operates a retail shop which she rents. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. Sylvia has requested for a loan of 400000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, 50kg of rice, soap, and cooking oil. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop and also to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house. Her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for the business.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, 50kg of rice, soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat is a 51-year-old married man and father of five children.  Izzat opened a grocery store as his lifetime business to provide a good living for his family.   As life started to be difficult for him financially Izzat thought of starting a new extra business to help to improve and increase his income.  He decided to open a small espresso zone in his shop, where he sells coffee, tea, and the popular Hooka for rent, as it's used these days.  To take this step Izzat requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, and it brought a very good income.

Now Izzat is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase his shop's merchandise with goods requested by students and those important for the winter season.  It will be his second cycle as a borrower.

Most of his customers are neighbours and villagers, who support him to raise his children in a good environment.

loans.use: to increase his shop's merchandise for the school and winter season

loans.name: Biorifa

texts.ru: Биорифа проживает в городе Худжанд. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем. У нее двое детей. Она занимается животноводством. В основном она занимается разведением бычков. Этим видом деятельности занимается  два года. Кредит берет для закупа быка.
texts.en: Biorifa lives in the town of Khujand.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  She primarily breeds cattle.  Biorifa has been in this business for two years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is now single. All of her 8 children go to school. She has one additional family member. 

Justine sells charcoal at the market, on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 13 years. Sylvia has requested for a loan of 300000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her charcoal business. She lives in a rented house and her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her early 30s, is married. Of her three children, two go to school. She has been selling new clothes door to door for three years now. She works from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. (four hours only) daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her 11th loan, from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the clothes stock, managed to buy a piece of land and to pay for her upkeep with household expenses. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She wants another loan to increase her clothes stock. Her dream is to, one day, be able to build her house, now that she has land.

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group, "Maendeleo", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Oliftamo

texts.ru: Олифтамо проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 38 лет. Она замужем. Занимается животноводством десять лет. Она разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Oliftamo lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 38 years old and married.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for ten years.  Oliftamo breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a mother of five children, aged between 7 and 20 years, with the last four still in schooling. She has been in farming for the last 5 years in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, vegetables and beans for the local market. She also operates a retail shop in the local market.

Margaret has made her first loan request, with Juhudi Kilimo, for 41,600 KES to fund her purchase and insurance of a dairy cow. She is optimistic that she will be able to educate her children from the boosted farming business income. She aspires to own three dairy cows and to improve her family's living standards.

Margaret laments of the high cost of feeds and fluctuating milk prices. She, however, remains glad with Juhudi Kilimo services.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Andranik

texts.ru:
Андранику 36 лет, он проживает в деревне Тсовагюх (Tsovagyugh), Сьюникского региона, вместе со своей женой и тремя детьми. Дочери Андраника посещают школу, а сын – детский сад. 
Андраник занимается сельским хозяйством и параллельно торговлей продуктов и хозяйственных товаров. У него в хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы, 2 теленка и 20 кур. А продовольственными и хозяйственными товарами он торгует уже 10 лет в небольшом вагончике, который находится в непосредственной близости от его дома. В торговле ему помогает жена. И благодаря своему бизнесу и ферме они содержат свою семью. 
Андранику необходим кредит на сумму 800.000 драм для увеличения ассортимента своего вагона-магазинчика, а именно для приобретения партии макаронных изделий, консервированных продуктов, подсолнечного масла, а также большой партии стиральных порошков и чистящих средств. 
Будущую прибыль Андраник намерен использовать для строительства нового магазинчика для своей торговли.
texts.en: Andranik is 36 years old.  He lives in the Tsovagyugh village in the Syunik region together with his wife and three children.  Andranik's daughters attend a school, and son goes to kindergarten.  Andranik is involved in agriculture and, parallel to that, sales of products and household goods.  His farm includes 3 cows, 2 calves and 20 chickens.  He has been selling food products and household goods for 10 years at a small wagon, which is located in close proximity to his home.  His wife helps him with the sales.  Thanks to their business and farm, they can support their family.  Andranik needs a loan in the sum of 800,000 dram to expand the assortment of his wagon-store, especially to buy an inventory of pasta, canned goods, sunflower oil and also a large inventory of laundry detergents and cleaning supplies.  Andranik plans to use the future profit to build a new store for his retail business.

loans.use: to buy provisions and household goods for his business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a fourty-four year old married woman, with five children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She takes care of her family with the help of her husband,  a farmer. Their dream is to educate their children up to university level. She has been operating a salon for nineteen years and this has facilitated her in looking after the family. 

Joyce has challenges of limited capital and her dream is to have a big and modern salon. Joyce needs the loan to buy cosmetics for use in the salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for use in the salon.

loans.name: Sanam

texts.ru: Санам проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее среднее образование. Она при доме имеет участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Sanam lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 47 years old, married and has a secondary education.  She has a plot of land by her house, where she sows wheat and grows vegetables.  Sanam has been involved in this business for four years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Ajala

texts.en:
Ajala is a widowed woman with five children, three of whom attend school while the other two have finished high school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Ajala has operated a vegetable grocery business for the past fifteen years; her potential clients are neighbors, friends and relatives. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the main market to her place of business. She dreams of increasing sales and diversifying to chicken rearing in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits for her grocery. She decided to join Yehu because of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruit for her grocery.

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.en:
This is Gliceria, 60, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Policarpio, her business partner, and mother to their two children who already have their own families. With her husband, Gliceria manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gliceria operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is to buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it with a little profit. Her products are children’s clothes, RTW and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Aside from this, she also operates a small variety store for added income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 800 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Gliceria is requesting a PHP35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy RTW products and merchandise items to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gliceria hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of 'Ready To Wear' merchandise and product items needed in her business.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab, a 27-year-old married mother of one child, started working as a hairdresser in 2001 from her house, both to help her husband meet their income requirements and to use her time productively. The steady growth of Zeinab's business has led to an improvement in her family's social and financial situation.

A hardworking woman with a very good reputation, she is planning to open her own beauty salon to meet customer demand, and so is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Zeinab hopes to expand her shop in the future to meet all women's beauty needs.

loans.use: to open her own beauty salon.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu, 38 years old and living in an airport community, is married to a businessman, and they have six children between the ages of 13 and 25 years old, some of whom attend school and all of whom live at home.

For the past nine years Fatu has been the only seller of cow skin in the local market, enjoying a large customer base and good profits. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more cow skin for her business. She plans to buy land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cow skin for her business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is requesting a loan to buy maize and beans for planting this season. He was able to harvest ten bags of maize in the last season, but his major business hardship is ever-increasing fuel prices which raise the costs for the farming and transportation of produce. Robert's dreams are to set up a food store and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Mwajaa

texts.en:
Mwajaa is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is a grownup. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past ten years. In addition, she also sells foodstuffs which earns her another source of income. Her potential clients are her friends and relatives. She faces the major challenge of seasonality; during the low season there is low demand. She dreams of being able to sell to a wider market in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to do business.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married with four children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her old parents). 

She has a restaurant business which she has operated for three years. She works from a rented shop and sells to all categories of people at retail prices. Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters, and even holidays because many of her customers are university students.

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO which she wants to use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes and chicken.  Sophia wants to own a fully stocked restaurant. 

She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and chicken.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en:
Domitille is 42 years old and married with 3 children and one adopted orphan. She owns typewriter and charges customers for using typewriter. She also does secretarial work for her customers and gets paid. 

Domitille is looking for a loan of 500,000 RWF to be repaid in 6 months. The loan would be used to buy more paper, ink for a machine, files, etc. Her dream is to buy new computers to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more papers, ink for typewriter, files, etc.

loans.name: Renie Fe

texts.en:
Renie Fe is married with five grown children. She is 58 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.
 
For the past five years, Renie Fe has engaged in raising pigs to earn a living. It was her field of interest even when she was still young and single. She got used to their everyday routine - cleaning their home, feeding and bathing them. While not the only source of income, Renie Fe earns approximately PHP 8,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Renie Fe hopes to raise them all successfully and trade them at a very good price. She plans to repair and widen their shelter, hopefully within the year.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 42 года. Женат. Детей не имеет. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 42 years old, married and has no children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Bakhtiyor provides a taxi service and has been in this business for two years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car in order to provide a safe service.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo is 29 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and has two school-aged children. 

Wilfredo owns and operates a motorcycle to earn a living. He is driving a two-wheeled vehicle that carries 2 to 6 passengers. Vehicles like this are commonly seen in rural and remote areas. The family has extra sources of income but it is this business they've relied on most for daily expenses. He has run the business for five years and earns about PHP 8,000 a month. He has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase motorcycle tires and other spare parts. 

Wilfredo hopes to sustain the business much longer into the future. He plans to buy a motor cab to provide better accommodation to the passengers.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Rurh is a resident of Kitale, Western Kenya, and a farmer. She is aged 51 and has been in farming for 15 years, producing and selling milk, maize, eggs, beans, sorghum and millet to the local market. She also runs a secondhand clothes business to supplement her farming income. She is married with four children, with the last two still schooling.

Ruth has made a loan request for 100,000 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to enable her to construct a modern dairy unit at 30,000 KES and buy more poultry birds at 70,000 KES to boost her poultry business. She says the loan will help boost her farming and enable her to educate her last two children. It will also improve her family's overall well being.

She laments common poultry diseases but is glad for Juhudi's intervention.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds and build a dairy unit.

loans.name: Jean Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 39 years old and is married with three children. He owns a business selling soft drinks and food in his restaurant. This is his fifth successful year in this work and he currently employs two people to help him.  The hours of his work are from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. every day. 

Maurice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to increase his restaurant business. This will allow him to have good profits. With any profit, he will be able to build a secure a future for his business as well as for his family, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food and drinks for his restaurant to resell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married with two school-aged children. She is 47 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Ruth is peddling fish varieties around the local community to earn a living. She has been doing the job for ten years and has relied on the earnings from this activity to provide the everyday needs of her house. While not the only means of income, Ruth is able to earn about PHP 9,000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 18,000 from GDMPC to obtain several fish varieties to sell.

In the future, Ruth hopes to acquire more stock of fish to sustain the daily needs of the family. She aspires to owning a fish vending stall in the market to gain more income and send her children to a better school.

loans.use: To obtain several fish varieties to sell.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a divorced woman with three children who are all grown up. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and medical expenses. 

She has operated a water selling business (borehole) for the past two years. Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality where during the rainy season there is low demand because people trap rain water for use. She dreams of owning a well-built borehole in the future.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase blocks for construction of her borehole. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase blocks for construction of her borehole.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-age children. 

To earn a living, Gemma plants and harvests various fruits and vegetables. She grows pineapple, lanzones, mango, root crops, legumes, and many more. She sells them in the local market and to interested neighbors. She has been gardening for five years. Each month, Gemma earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers.

In 2009, Gemma joined GDMPC. This is her fourth loan cycle in the cooperative, and she expects there will be another in the future. Gemma hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers to boost production

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is married with five children. She is 57 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store selling grocery products such as noodles, spices, canned goods, laundry and bath soap, soft drinks, etc. She has run this business for over six years. Her spouse works as a motorcycle driver. Each month she earns approximately PHP 8,900. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to acquire additional grocery products to sell. 

In 2007, Merlinda joined the GDMPC family. This is her third loan in the cooperative. She hopes to expand and improve her business to gain more income for the family, and for a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To acquire additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 47 years old, and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Editha owns and operates a retail shop at home to earn a living. She sells various grocery products, livestock feeds, rice, and rice and corn bran to the local community. She has been doing this for seven years. Her husband also earns income working as a chainsaw operator, but the work is not permanent in nature. From all income sources, Editha is able to generate PHP 7,800 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 from GDMPC to purchase rice and rice bran to sell.

Editha has been a member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Editha hopes to expand and improve her business to gain more income. She plans to invest in agriculture as an alternative source of income.

loans.use: To purchase rice and rice bran to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is married and has three school-age children. Francisca is 39 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To assist with the everyday needs of the family, Francisca's husband drives a motorcycle. The family is working together to attain the purpose of living. 

To earn a living, Francisca owns and operates a retail shop at home, selling various grocery items and a few other supplies such as school and office supplies. She has run the store for over five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 7,100. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional liquors to sell. 

Francisca has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Francisca hopes to expand and improve the business. She plans to venture into farming activity soon to have more income.

loans.use: To purchase additional liquors to sell.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is married and has two grown children. Rizalina is 53 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home, selling grocery items as well as charcoal, ripe bananas and school and office supplies. She also has a display of viands in her store. She has been doing this activity for ten years already. Her husband is an automotive mechanic. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 8,900. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional products to sell.

Rizalina has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. This is her second loan from the cooperative. In the future, Rizalina hopes to expand and improve the scope of her business and be prosperous in succeeding operations. She plans to buy new fridge for the business.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
This is Randy, 24, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. He is married to Allen, a housewife and mother of their child. Randy, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Randy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Randy earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. He will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Randy hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he hopes to support his child's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 42 years old and lives in Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has one grown child. 

Robina owns and operates a retail shop at home selling mostly grocery items. She has been running the store for eight years. Each month, she earns a total of PHP 5,700. To help support the family, her husband drives a motorcycle. 

Robina has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Robina hopes to get enough capital to sustain the business for many years. She also plans to raise some pigs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of feed for resale.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 66 years old, married and blessed with seven children. 

To earn a living, she runs a green grocery. Besides, she sells cereals to supplement her income. She has employed two people to assist her in her business. She also does livestock farming.

Leah has managed to boost her business because of her previous loans from Faulu Kenya. She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is married and has eight children. She is 48 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Felecitas is a farmer and grows palay (unhusked rice) to earn a living. She has been plowing, planting and harvesting rice for 28 years. The whole family is working together to facilitate farm activities. She has alternative sources of income and that allows her to earn a total of PHP 10,000 a month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers to boost her farm's production. 

In the future, Felecitas hopes to cultivate additional farm fields to earn more income and improve the general living condition of the family..

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick intends to use this loan to buy firewood to resell. 

He has been in business three years and with the profits generated, he has been able to educate his children.

He still has a tender of supplying firewood to a tea factory and his dream is to be the sole tenderer of the factory.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Oydona

texts.ru: Ойдона проживает в районе Хамадони. Она вдова. Ей 51 год. У нее детей нет. Она более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. В основном она выращивает овощи и бахчевые культуры. Целью получения кредита является закуп топлива и необходимых удобрений для обработки земли.
texts.en: Oydona lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 51 years old, a widow and has no children.  She has been involved in agriculture for over 15 years.  She primarily grows vegetables and melon crops.  The goal of this loan is to buy fuel and necessary fertilizers for land treatment.

loans.use: to buy fuel and necessary fertilizers for land treatment

loans.name: Dioclesiano

texts.en:
Dioclesiano is married and has three school-aged children. He is 42 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Dioclesiano is a farmer and grows palay (unhulled rice) to earn a living. He takes good care of his fields. Farming is considered the dominant means of livelihood in this place. He has been cultivating this land for three years. The family also has alternative sources of income and that allows the family to earn PHP 10,000 a month. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase farm fertilizers to boost production. 

In the future, Dioclesiano hopes to have a good return on investment and farm more land. He dreams of being financially stable and giving a better living situation to his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers to boost production.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with three school-going children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a retail shop for the past six years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge in the fluctuating prices of commodities. She dreams of owning a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase flour (maize and wheat), cooking oil and bars of soap for her business. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her business standard.

loans.use: To purchase flour (maize and wheat), cooking oil and bars of soap for her business.

loans.name: Joselito

texts.en:
Joselito is married and has four school-age children. He is 40 years old and lives in Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte, Philippines.

Joselito is a farmer and a gardener. He has been planting and harvesting coconuts to earn a living. He makes money from the palms, fruits, husks, shells and logs. He has owned and enjoyed this business for 15 years already. 

His spouse runs a small business as well. Having all these sources, Joselito gets PHP 9,000 a month. He has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding his coconut production. 

Joselito is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, he hopes to improve and expand the business to earn more income. He plans to buy some land and hopes for a high buying rate of coconuts in the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his coconut production.

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
From Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province, Mrs. Chhoeum has spent her life making plastic kindling that can be used to make a fire. She also buys finished goods from other villagers who make these kind of products at a low cost.  She then sells the kindling for a higher price in the neighboring country, Thailand.

Mrs. Chhoeum is married and blessed with three children who are single and are supported by her income. Some of them attend the local public school. Outside of her business, Mrs. Chhoeum also assists her husband growing the rice crop on her existing farmland. This couple normally generates an average of $6USD per day to cover their daily expenses for living. Mrs. Choeum has run out of raw materials, so she would like to borrow some funds from Kiva to use as capital to buy additional materials for producing her goods. In the future, Mrs. Chhoeum hopes she will be able to support all her children in achieving a high level of education and to buy a plowing machine for farming business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for producing her goods.

loans.name: Artur

texts.ru:
Артуру 45 лет. Вместе со своей женой и дочерью он проживает в деревне Тсовагюх (Tsovagyugh), Севанского региона. Дочь Артура посещает среднюю школу. 
Артур разводит коров, овец и кур. А начиная с 2005 года он начал торговлю продовольственными и хозяйственными продуктами в вагоне-магазинчике по соседству со своим домом. Жена не работает и помогает Артуру в магазине и на ферме. Благодаря совместным усилиям они содержат свою семью и надеются развивать свой бизнес и в дальнейшем. 
Артур получает кредит от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon) во второй раз, и сейчас ему необходимо 500.000 драм для увеличения ассортимента своего магазина: а именно для покупки большой партии прохладительных напитков, круп, кофе и чая, а также партии  мыла, шампуней и т.д.    
Благодаря будущей прибыли, Артур надеется приобрести использованный автомобиль для доставки товаров для своего магазина, что существенно уменьшит расходы его бизнеса в будущем.
texts.en: Artur is 45 years old.  He lives with his wife and daughter in the Tsovagyugh village of the Syunik region.  Artur's daughter attends a secondary school. Artur breeds cattle, sheep and chickens.  He started to sell food and household products in a wagon-store nearby his home in 2005.  His wife does not work and helps Artur in the store and on the farm.  Thanks to their joint efforts, they are able to support their family and hope to continue developing their business in the future.  Artur is requesting a second loan from the Nor Horizon organization and now needs 500,000 dram to expand the assortment of his store and especially to buy a large inventory of cold drinks, grans, coffee, tea and also an inventory of soap, shampoos, etc. Thanks to the future profit, Artur hopes to buy a used car to deliver goods for his store, which would significantly reduce his business expenses in the future.

loans.use: to buy a large inventory of cold drinks, grans, coffee, tea and also an inventory of soap, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is aged 26 and married, with a 4-year-old child. He has been in farming for 3 years and currently employs one farmhand.  Samuel's farm produces milk, maize and beans. He also operates a motorcycle transport business.

Samuel has made his first loan request from Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 61,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this loan will help him improve his business and the well-being of his family. He hopes to expand his farm by adding three more dairy cows.

Samuel notes that farmers face the challenges of common dairy animal and poultry diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and poultry

loans.name: Trần Thị Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Ngọc is a 38-year-old woman living in the town of Yen Phong district in Yen Phong province.  Ngọc is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đức Lân nhóm 07 (7).

Ngọc is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, she operates a family member's business, raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ngọc has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

Ngọc joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This is her first loan from SEDA.  Ngọc plans to use the additional revenue generated  to improve and expand her business.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  Đoàn is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock food for pigs.

2.  Oanh is a 38-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising pigs and chickens.

3.  Lan is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock, to buy chickens and food for pigs.

4.  Thơ is a 40-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising piglets.

5.  Thái  is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock food for chickens.

6.  Oanh is a 42-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock food for chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is aged 28 and married, with 3 children between 2 and 7 years old.  She has been in farming in her home area of Kitale for 3 years. Her farm produces milk, maize and beans for the local market. She works as a tailor for additional income.

Everlyne has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is her first loan request from Juhudi Kilmo. She says she is looking forward to a good relationship with the organization and to repaying the loan on time. She adds that milk production will improve her income and make life better for her family.

She laments of fluctuating milk prices and rampant animal diseases.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Mrs. Tun, age 30, live in Ornlong Veng district of Siem Reap province.

She has a life partner in her husband who works as a local farming cultivator. To earn a living, Mrs. Tun, like other villagers, makes plastic kindling that can be used to make a fire.  She sells the kindling in a local market or to her neighbors. 

Mrs. Tun has three single children, some of whom are attending a local state school. Besides her business, Mrs. Tun helps her husband plant rice crops on the farm. The family typically earns an income of approximately $4.5USD per day. Mrs. Tun has run out of raw materials from her stock supply. To solve this problem, Mrs. Tun is looking for a loan from Kiva to buy additional materials for her business.

In the future, Mrs. Tun wishes to improve her income. With an increase in income, she hopes that she will be able to enlarge their existing house and send her children to finish school, at least through the high school level.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Sitoramo

texts.ru: Ситорамо проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. Ситорамо предоставляет услугу. На сегодняшний день она открыла свадебный салон, где предоставляет клиентам свадебные платья в аренду. В этой области она два года. Кредит берет для приобретения новых свадебных и вечерних платьев.
texts.en: Sitoramo lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 28 years old, married.  Sitoramo provides a service.  Today, she has a wedding parlour, where she offers wedding dresses for rent to her customers.  She has been in this business for two years.  She is requesting a loan for the purchase of new wedding and evening dresses.

loans.use: to purchase new wedding and evening dresses

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia describes herself as a simple and responsible parent. She is a 56-year-old widow who has been blessed with four children, who are now grown. She owns and manages a retail store within the village of Villa Cruz San Mateo.  Three of her are married while the youngest is still single and working.

Delia aimed to sell more grocery items to earn a higher income, but she does not have enough capital.  That's why she is asking for additional capital of P30,000 to buy additional stocks of groceries such as soft drinks, biscuit, eggs, canned goods, instant noodles, vegetables, meat and ingredients needed in her retail shop business. She believes that through the loan she requests, she will be able to improve the business and increase her income to sustain her needs and education of her grandchild. In the future, she is hoping to save a larger amount so that she can remain secure as she ages.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, eggs, canned goods, instant noodles, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Mr. Toch is a 30-year old man who lives in Siem Reap province. He is married with three single children who attend school. Mr. Toch and his wife work as domestic farmers on their existing farmland. Besides his farming business, Mr. Toch also burns wood charcoal to sell for extra income. Mr. Toch normally earns an average of $4USD per day to cover his daily expenses. Recently Mr. Toch applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase some fertilizer and to construct a storage area for stocking the family's rice. In the future, Mr. Toch expects that he can enlarge his old house and buy a plowing machine  for the farm.

loans.use: to purchase some fertilizer and construct a storage area for stocking the family's rice.

loans.name: Rhodah

texts.en:
Rhodah is 61 years old and a single mother of three.  To earn a living, she runs a retail shop.  She also operates a pharmacy to boost her income, and in addition, she practices farming.  She really works hard to make ends meet.

Rhodah desires to open a clinic in five years as she has good experience in the medical field.  She has requested a loan of  20,000 Kenya shillings to buy medicine.

loans.use: To buy medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt, soap and sugar

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children who attend school. Her husband's employment also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees for her children and transport. 

She has operated a cloth-selling business for the past five years; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality as demand is high only at the end of the month. She dreams of opening a boutique.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase clothes like skirts and blouses to sell. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase clothes like ladies' skirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам  трудолюбивый, честный предприниматель. Он более 5 лет занимается куплей – продажей сельхозпродуктов. Он в основном торгует овощами. Рустам женат, у него 3 детей. У него на иждивении двое. Он  старается продавать качественный продукт, чтобы привлечь клиентов. Рустам в дальнейшем  хочет открыть собственный ларек по продаже овощей и  расширить  свой бизнес. У Рустама нет  нужных  средств для развития  бизнеса, торговли. Ему нужен займ. Он надеется, что вы поможете ему.  Получение этого займа принесет пользу и развитию бизнеса и семейному бюджету. Рустам заранее благодарит вас за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Rustam is a hard-working and honest entrepreneur.  He has been involved in buying and selling agricultural crops for over five years.  He primarily sells vegetables.  Rustam is married and has three children and also support two more.  He tries to sell quality products in order to attract customer attention.  In the future, Rustam wants to open his own kiosk, where he could sell vegetables, and, thus, expand his business.  Rustam does not have the necessary means to develop his retail business.  He needs a loan and he hopes that you would help him.  Obtaining this loan would bring benefit not only for business development, but for the family budget as well.  Rustam thanks you in advance for the help and support.

loans.use: to open his own kiosk and buy vegetables

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.en:
Yuliana is a 57-year-old lady who is from Semarang. Yuliana is married to Joseph, a 43-year-old man. They are blessed with four children namely: Stevany, 23, married; Ivan, 21, and Yustin, 19, both of whom graduated from senior high school; and Armando, 17, who is studying at the second grade of senior high school. 

Yuliana owns a piglet breeding business. She has been involved in this business for eight months. She started the business by purchasing two piglets. Yuliana is interested in running the business since the income is generated quickly; she only needs six months to raise and sell them. According to Yulia this business enables her to meet their daily needs. 

Currently, Yuliana plans to raise more piglets but she needs more money to do so. She is requesting a loan of 7,500,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM to purchase four piglets and fodder. Yuliana really hopes that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business. She believes that the loan will motivate her to go forward.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and fodder

loans.name: Manuchehr
