texts.ru: Манучехр проживает в городе Куляб. Ему 29 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сам Манучехр таксист. Он развозит людей с одного места на другое. В этой области он семь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения запасных частей автомашины.
texts.en: Manuchehr lives in the town of Kulob.  He is 29 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker, and children attend a secondary school.  Manuchehr is a taxi driver.  He transports people from one place to another.  He has been in this business for seven years.  Manuchehr is requesting this loan for the purchase of spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She sells bananas at the market on retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last one year. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more green bananas. 

Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to the university level. She lives in her house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To  buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a cafe business for the past six years; her potential clients are the local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of opening a retail shop one day.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase blocks and cement to expand her business premises. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase blocks and cement to expand her business premises.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married and has three children. He has been growing bananas and avocado to earn a living. He has engaged in the business for eight years and has employed two people. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to boost his business.

Joseph hopes to expand his business and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and rice for resale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a married woman and she and her husband have four children, whom they hope to give good education, up to the university level. She owns a tailoring services business in which she makes and sells clothes to the local people. 

Anna's business is located at a busy market in Nairobi. She has been running this business for the last 12 years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is financial constraints. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy more materials to make more clothes to sell, especially as we near Christmas festivities. She describes herself as resilient and outspoken.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman. She has three school going children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and transportation. 

Asha has operated a weaving business for the past nine years. In addition, she has a motorcycle transport business, which contributes as her other source of income. Her potential clients are the area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to uplift her business standards.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Rakhimchon

texts.ru: Рахимчон старательный, честный человек и заботливый отец. У него двое детей.   Он работает в столовой, где всегда чисто и приятно и, несмотря на то, что он занимается предпринимательской деятельностью всего полтора года, уже имеет  постоянных  клиентов. Ему помогает брат  и несколько ребят помощников. Каждый день он готовит 5-6 видов  вкусных блюд. В округе его знают как  решительного бизнесмена с хорошей репутацией. Рахимчон хочет расширить бизнес, чтобы о его кухне узнало как можно больше людей. Это поможет ему увеличить товарооборот и поможет другим ребятам, так как это новое, постоянное  рабочее место. Рахимчону  для этого важного дела нужен займ  на сумму 2500$ США. Он надеясь на ваше понимание выражает вам свою признательность.
texts.en: Rakhimchon is a diligent, honest person and a caring father.  He has two children.  He works at a cafe, where it is always clean and pleasant.  Despite the fact that he has been involved in entrepreneurial activity for only a year and a half, he already has regular customers.  His brother and several workers help him.  Rakhimchon prepares 5-6 types of delicious dishes every day.  He is known in the area as a decisive businessman with a good reputation.  Rakhimchon wants to expand his business, so that as many as people as possible learned about his kitchen.  This will help to increase product turnover and help his workers because this is a new permanent workplace.  Rakhimchon needs a loan in the sum of $2500 for this important deed.  He expresses his gratitude to you, hoping for your understanding.

loans.use: to expand his business and increase goods turnover

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 28 years old, married and has four children. He has been running an electronics shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years.  He also does dairy farming for extra income. 

Alex has been able to add stock to his electronic shop with his previous loan from Faulu Kenya. Alex has also improved his business because he has been trained on business management skills through the trainings conducted by Faulu Kenya. He has requested another loan for 70,000 KES to buy a mobile phone battery-charger.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone battery-charger.

loans.name: Abduvali

texts.ru: Абдували житель района Хамадони. Возраст, 45 лет. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Он десять лет как занимается изготовлением окон и дверей. Кредит берет для покупки сырья, то есть досок и стекла.
texts.en: Abduvali is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  He is 45 years old, married and has two children.  He has been involved in making windows and doors for ten years.  Abduvali is requesting this loan for the purchase of raw materials, i.e. wood panels and glass.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka, a 48-year-old lady, is married to Yeremias, a 53-year-old man. From their marriage, they have been blessed with six children, namely: Moret, 29; Semi, 28; Fredwin, 27; (all three of them are married) Jems, 26 and Iwan, 19, both of whom graduated from senior high school; and the youngest Gandri, 17, who is still in the second grade of senior high school. 

Milka and husband have some farmland located near to their house. Together they plant rice and corn and various vegetables, such as water spinach, eggplants, tomatoes, and chili. She was once involved in TLM's Group Lending Program. She was able to purchase seeds through the loan. Milka sells her produce at Oesao market, and in other traditional markets, three times a week. Her income is usually spent on the daily needs of her family members and on Gandri's school fees. 

Milka is grateful for her business, however she desires to improve her income by selling more rice as she believes that the rice business would enable her to save money for their future. Therefore she is requesting a loan of 10,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. She hopes that TLM is willing to approve her application.

loans.use: To purchase rice for resale

loans.name: Napisa

texts.ru:
Компания «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» выражает искреннюю признательность социальным инвесторам Кива за поддержку первого кредита на развитие бизнеса Написы, который был выплачен без просрочек.  
Написа занимается  торговлей продуктами питания, открыв этот бизнес 2008 году. С помощью стартового капитала в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) Написа сумела развить торговую деятельность своего магазина, который приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Первый кредит по линии Кива помог Написе разнообразить ассортимент своего товара и приобрести новых клиентов. Желание не останавливаться на достигнутом привело Напису во второй раз в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента представленного товара.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить  в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners organization expresses sincere appreciation to the social investors at Kiva for their support of the first loan given to develop Napisa's business, which was paid out without delinquencies.

Napisa sells food products and opened her business in 2008. With the help of a starting capital of 20,000 KGS Napisa was able to develop her store business which brings about 15,000 KGS a month. Her first Kiva loan helped Napisa to widen the variety of her goods and acquire new customers. Her desire to not stop on what she has achieved brought Napisa back to Bai Tushum and Partners for the second time for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to increase the assortment of goods. She plans to use the profit from the loan to invest in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She and her husband have two children, aged nine years old and three years old, for whom they hope to provide good education to the university level. 

Agnes owns a clothing sales business in which she sells materials to the local tailors in Nairobi. She has been running this business for the last nine years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge is that there are other people in the area doing the same kind of business, so her customers are spoiled for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more materials for resale. She hopes to open a bigger shop in the future. She describes herself as ambitious and visionary.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan, a 51-year old married woman, lives in Baray district of Kompong Thom province. Mrs. Chan has operated a small business as a fish seller for years. In order to process this business well, Mrs. Chan has to buy fish from fishermen in the village and from other suppliers to stock for daily sale as well as for the future sales. Her husband always helps her transport the fish to sell in a local market. Besides this work, he also provides a motor taxi service around the community. 

Mrs. Chan has four children, all of whom work in various careers. Two of her children are students in a local public school, while one of the children is already married and has started a new family. This humble family earns a profit, on average, of $6.5USD per day to meet their needs. Presently, Mrs. Chan has run out of fish from her stock. Thus, she would like to request some funds to use as capital to buy some additional fish to continue selling in the future. For her prospect, Mrs. Chan hopes that she will be able to expand her existing business. She would like to increase her income from this fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy some additional fish to continue selling in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour (wheat and maize) and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 23-year-old married woman who has three children; two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more charcoal for sale. She will use the extra income for paying the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon needs the loan to buy goats, maize and pay school fees.With the previous loan he was able purchase sacks of maize. With the profit earned he was  able to prepare land and pay labour so that he could plant his own maize instead of buying from other people. He dreams of a food store and educating his children to become proffesionals.

loans.use: to buy goats, maize and pay school fees.

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Tungalag is 47-years-old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 19 and 26, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, which is in outer ger district, a district without basic infrastructure of the city. Her son attends a local high school and her daughter helps at her business while her husband works at a rural company.

Tungalag supports her family by operating a clothing retail stall at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. First she sold her handmade women's coats of various kinds at the another person's stall. As she expanded her business she began to sell women's clothes with imports from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. 

Today, she is requesting a 1.200.000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to purchase more clothes to sell in this autumn and warm clothes to sell which customers need in the beginning winter season. She hopes that she will improve her business as well.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell this autumn.

loans.name: Josinta

texts.en:
Josinta is a 30-year-old woman; she is married to Timotius, a 35-year-old man. Josinta has been blessed with three children, they are: Inyo, who is 10 years old and is in the fifth grade of elementary school; Rafly, who is seven years old and is in the first grade of primary school; and Intan, who is five years old and is not at school yet. 

Josinta's husband runs a betel nut business. Her husband is only able to sell betel nut in small quantities, so their daily income is not sufficient to fully cover their daily needs. Josinta realized that she cannot rely solely on her husband's income. To support her husband in generating income, Josinta runs a home-based kiosk business. 

She started this business two years ago by utilizing the very small amount of capital that she had. She first received loan assistance from TLM in a group loan (she joined a group lending program twice). The loans were used to purchase more daily household items such as; coffee, sugar, tea, betel nut, detergents, snacks etc. to be sold at her kiosk. 

Josinta wishes to stock her kiosk with varied items such as: kerosene, rice, cooking spices, and instant noodles as requested by her customers. However, she doesn't have enough capital to make it happen. Josinta then submitted her loan application and requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. Josinta is expecting that TLM will assist her again with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as: kerosene, rice, cooking spices, and instant noodles

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru: Лутфулло  ответственный, честный предприниматель. Он занимается предпринимательством более 4 лет и уже накопил опыт.  Лутфулло работает в  собственном магазине у него всегда  свежий товар и разнообразный ассортимент. Он старается хорошо обслужить каждого клиента. Также Лутфулло любящий  муж и заботливый отец троих  детей. Этим бизнесом он занимается  самостоятельно. Лутфулло хочет расширить свой бизнес, чтобы был дополнительный доход и семье и развить бизнес, ему нужен займ в размере 3000$ США. Лутфулло надеется, на вашу помощь и поддержку и благодарит вас за помощь.
texts.en: Lutfullo is a responsible and honest entrepreneur.  He has been involved in entrepreneurship for over 4 years and already gained experience.  Lutfullo works at his own store, where he always has fresh merchandise and various assortment.  He tries to serve each customer well.  Lutfullo is also a loving husband and a caring father of three children.  He runs his business independently.  Lutfullo wants to expand his business in order to have additional income for the family and to develop the business.  He needs a loan in the sum of $3000 for this purpose.  Lutfullo relies on your help and support and thanks you for your help.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of products

loans.name: Atartuya

texts.en: Atartuya is 37-years old, single, and lives with her mother. She is a teacher at university and has been doing this job for 4 years. She is a very caring person that she still takes care of her mother. She and her mother live in a small house which needs repair. The furnace is also so old that it can’t warm the house fully. Since the winter is coming, she wants to buy new furnace which uses smokeless-fuel. She thinks that it is beneficial to her expenses and natural-orientation for the environment. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a new furnace and to purchase some building materials to make a repair to her house.

loans.use: to buy a new furnace and purchase some building materials to make a repair to her house.

loans.name: Goretti

texts.en:
Gorreti is a tailor. She operates her business from home on a retail basis and works seven days a week. She has been in her business for the last nine years. 

She has requested a loan from MCDT SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her primary goal and aspiration is to build rental houses and to also expand her business into a tailoring school.

She lives in her own house in Kampala, Uganda, with her husband and four children. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, as all her children attend school.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin, age 24, earns his living by running a butcher shop. He has been in the business for three years and has employed one person. He also grows tea for extra income.  

He joined Faulu Kenya so that he can save his money and access business loans. So far, he has gained a great deal of knowledge on business management through training. This has helped him to improve his business.

Martin, who is still unmarried, hopes to expand his business and employ more people. He has requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya shillings in order to buy a cow for slaughter and sale.

loans.use: to buy a cow for slaughter and sale

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy, age 39, sells breads in the Kator region of south Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Jimmy has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. 

She will use her profit from this loan to help pay for her children to go to school. She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school.

loans.use: to purchase more breads to offer for sale

loans.name: Chamshedjon

texts.ru: Чамшедджон трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. Он женат, которая ухаживает за  маленьким  ребенком. Предпринимательством он занимается самостоятельно полтора года, но уже накопил опыт. Он занимается куплей и продажей запасных частей для автомобиля и считает свой бизнес крайне полезным, потому что помогает другим в решении проблем.  Чамшедджон имеет постоянных клиентов, так как продает качественный товар. У него репутация  честного, отзывчивого предпринимателя. Чамшедджон хочет  купить товар, так как начинается сезон, но у него нет нужной суммы, поэтому он хотел бы получить займ на сумму 3000$ США. Он очень надеется на вашу поддержку для развития этого полезного дела и заранее благодарит вас за помощь и понимание.
texts.en: Chamshedjon is a hard-working and goal-oriented person.  He is married, and his wife takes care of their small child.  He has been involved in entrepreneurship independently for one and a half years, but has already gained experience.  He is involved in buying and selling spare parts for automobiles and considers his business useful because he helps others in solving their problems.  Chamshedjon has regular customers because he sells quality merchandise.  He has a reputation of an honest and responsive entrepreneur.  Chamshedjon wants to buy merchandise since the season is starting, but he does not have the necessary amount for it.  This is why he wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $3000.  He relies on your support for developing this useful business and thanks you in advance for your help and understanding.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a is a vendor of fruits and vegetables. Dhe has operated her business for the past three years and sells to local area residents. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators in the market. She dreams of supplying her products to local factories.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase tens bags of passionfruit and five bags of oranges for her business. She decided to join Yehu to boost herself financially.

Margaret is a single woman with two school-going children. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tens bags of passionfruit and five bags of oranges

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 28 years old and has two children, aged 5 months and 3 years. He and his wife have been farming for the past five years.

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production; they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production.
 
With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius operates a motorcycle transport business to support the family. He has run his business for five years. He also practices dairy farming to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to buy a van. 

With his loan funds of 30,000 Kenya shillings, he intends to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a 22-year-old lady; she is married to Milton, a 23-year-old man. They have a son, Christian, a one year and nine month old baby. 

Although Filomena is married she and her son are still living with Filomena's parents. Filomena's husband resides and works in another province – Maluku. To make a living, Filomena runs a home-based kiosk business at her parent's house. She has been operating her small kiosk for about two years. She sells kerosene, corn, snacks, coffee, tea, shampoo etc. in small quantities. Her kiosk income is quite helpful to in providing daily meals for Filomena and her son. She is also responsible for supporting her parents' needs as she lives with them. 

Therefore Filomena always tries her best to increase her income. She wishes to improve her kiosk business to generate better income. One day her mother suggested that she apply for a loan from TLM. She looked for more information on the TLM Lending Program by visiting the nearest branch office and she found herself interested in joining the program. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah (IDR). The loan will be used to purchase hundreds of kilograms of corn. Filomena hopes that her loan application will be approved by TLM.

loans.use: to purchase hundreds of kilograms of corn

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy, a 31-year-old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines, married to Napoleon, a tricycle driver, and mother to her only child who is now studying in elementary school. By the grace of God, Daisy has managed to support her child’s schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Daisy oversees the operation of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. Daisy’s husband, who operates their tricycle, remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Daisy also has a direct-selling business, with her neighbors and the local community as her regular customers. She earns a minimum of Php 584 Philippine Pesos (PHP) every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan to buy spare parts and accessories and to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Part of the loan will also be used to buy orders for her customers, and she expects a boost in her business income as she expands her direct-sales enterprise.

Daisy hopes to grow her business, and dreams of travelling abroad some day. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their tricycle unit and to pay for products needed in her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 30 years old, married and has two children who are 5 and 7 years old. For the last three years, she has made a living by selling a variety of goods like bananas, soft drinks and sugar. Her shop is open from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day, and she is applying for a loan from Kiva and Vision Finance Company to expand her business and increase her income. Her goal is to provide her family with greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, soft drinks and sugar to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is married, has one child and has graduated from school. Her husband is a businessman who helps support his family, which owns and lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. Their greatest monthly expense is food. For the last nine years, Mwanasha has run a business selling fish to neighbors and passersby. She earns additional money on the side by braiding hair. Her biggest challenge is a lack of fish to sell during the colder parts of the year, and she dreams of buying a freezer where she can stock more fish and serve a larger number of customers. Mwanasha is applying for a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy more fish to sell. She joined Yehu because it has good benefits and helps people improve their living standards

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Munkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Munkhtsetseg, 43, is a doctor in private medicine located in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her old mother, a pensioner, and her daughter in the slum district of the city. Munkhtsetseg has been working as a doctor since 1988 and is a skillful and experienced doctor of acuclosure or bone setting.

Currently her family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, and actually it is uncomfortable or cold to live in, especially for sickly people during the freezing wintertime. Because of this, she started building a new house beside her ger last fall, but she could not finish the building because of a lack of money to purchase some construction materials, especially brick, iron-pipes, window frames and insulation materials, etc. Her family will be moving to the new house and will be living in a warm, comfortable house If she can finish it before this winter.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase the building materials to finish building her new house.

loans.use: to purchase the building materials to finish building her new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large thread embroidery machine

loans.name: Khudodod

texts.ru: Худодод  честный и трудолюбивый молодой человек. Он начал заниматься  предпринимательством  в 15лет. После занятий в школе он  занимался продажей  продуктовых товаров. Он уже имеет накопленный опыт в этом бизнесе. Худододу помогает в бизнесе его брат. Он продает качественный, разнообразный продтовары. Худодод имеет постоянных клиентов. Он хочет увеличить и разнообразить ассортимент товаров, но у него нет средств. Худодод хотел бы получить займ на сумму 1500$ США для этой цели. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и выражает вам свою признательность за помощь.
texts.en: Khudodod is an honest and hard-working young man.  He became involved in entrepreneurship when he was 15 years old.  He sold food products after his school studies.  He already has accumulated experience in this business.  Khudodod's brother helps him in this business.  Khudodod sells quality and varied food products.  He has many regular customers.  He wants to expand and vary his product assortment, but has no means to do so.  Khudodod wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1500 for this goal.  He relies on your support and expresses his gratitude for your help.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of products

loans.name: Athanase

texts.en:
Athanase is 30 years old and has 4 children aged 1 to 8 years. Two of them are in school. He and his wife have been farmers for the past 10 years.

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and for fertilizer during maize production; they need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production.
 
With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Hermosa

texts.en:
This is Hermosa, 50, a resident of Silang Cavite City, Philippines. Single, she manages her own household while operating the business. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Hermosa operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and also a variety of hanging plants and other similar plants. Aside from this she also sells cooked viands (tasty food dishes) for extra income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 32,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer, garden inputs and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Hermosa hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to have her own family someday. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Abdukholik

texts.ru: Абдухолик проживает в районе Гиссар. Он женат. Ему 40 лет. У него четверо детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Он работает в пекарне. В основном он печет лепешки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки дров, муки и угля.
texts.en: Abdukholik lives in the Gissar district.  He is 40 years old, married and has four children.  He has a secondary education and works at a bakery.  Abdukholik primarily bakes flatbread.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of firewood, flour and coal.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, flour and coal

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en:
Sikola lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and both go to school. She has one additional family member, her sister’s baby. She has a restaurant which she rents at the market. She works six days a week and has been in business for the last 4 years.

She has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more flour, rice, beef, and chicken. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house and her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, rice, beef and chicken

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 21-year-old single man; he is living with his siblings and parents. Albert is the second of six children and graduated from senior high school two years ago. 

Albert is a hardworking man; he takes on the responsibility to support his family. Albert has been accustomed to working at the farm since he was at school in order to help his father in cultivating plants such cucumber, rice, tomatoes, and vegetables. In addition, Albert is also raising livestock such as pigs, chicken and goats to sell at the market. The income from his business is used to meet his family's daily needs. 

Albert dreams of cultivating more plants at the farm such cucumber and tomatoes. He is sure that he will generate more income since he could harvest more. Therefore he would like to request a loan of 5,000,000 Rupiah (IDR) from TLM. He would spend the loan on more seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. He believes that the loan will support him in improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cloth to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Odmaa

texts.en: Odmaa has been running her shoes sales business successfully. Once again she is asking for a loan to increase her business’ working capital and purchase winter shoes. She said winter shoes are more profitable than other seasonal shoes.  With this loan she can offer more shoes with quick turnover and be able to compete in the sector.

loans.use: To increase her business' working capital and purchase winter shoes

loans.name: Rinata

texts.ru: Рината – молодая предпринимательница из г. Токмок.  Ей 24 года, не замужем. Будучи инициативной от природы, Рината начала свой бизнес в 18 лет с начальной суммой в 3,000 сом (KGS). За шесть лет она добилась хороших результатов – сумела приобрести в собственность павильон с торговым оборотом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS).  В стремлении к новым высотам, Рината обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в третий раз за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в ремонт квартиры.
texts.en: Rinata is a young entrepreneur from the town of Tokmok.  She is 24 years and single.  Being gifted with initiative from nature, Rinata started her own business when she was 18 years old, using a sum of 3,000 som (KGS).  During the course of six years, she achieved good results - she was able to buy a pavilion with a goods turnover of 25,000 som (KGS).  Reaching for new heights, Rinata requested a loan in the sum of 25,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai Tushum and Partners" company to expand merchandise assortment.  She plans to use the profits from the loan to repair her apartment.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
This is Precila, 36, resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rolly, a barangay (village) worker. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses.  

Precila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells ornamental and garden plants. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy grocery items, beverages, and gardening materials needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Precila hopes to expand her business soon and dreams to have a child someday. She faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.en:
Ayub is a 30-year-old man, married to Yane, a 26-year-old lady. They have two children named Alya, aged 3 years, and Charly, aged 6 months. Ayub and family live in a simple house with a palm leaf roof, palm tree branches for walls and a cement floor. 

To cover their living expenses, Ayub works as a shrimp fisherman. He has been running this business for 10 years. Ayub usually catches the shrimp in the early morning at 4 am using a trawl net and returns home at 11 am. In a day, Ayub can catch about 2 to 4 kilograms of shrimp and he sells them to his customers. The customers usually pay him at the end of month after they weight all his catch.

However, Ayub cannot catch shrimp now since his trawl net is torn. He does not have money to buy a new trawl net or even to fix the old one. Therefore, he is seeking a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000. He plans to spend the loan on some trawl nets to stock and another boat to support his work. Ayub really expects that TLM is willing to assist him with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase some trawl nets and another boat.

loans.name: Mendsaikhan

texts.en: Mr.Mendsaikhan is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and two children. He has been working at a window and door manufacturing company for 15 years. He has plenty of experience, and has started to produce doors and windows by himself. With his commitment and experience, the demand for his product is growing rapidly. He needs a vehicle to deliver the windows and doors, so that he can earn his customers’ satisfaction and loyalty. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a mini truck.

loans.use: To purchase a mini truck for deliveries

loans.name: Djamilya

texts.ru: Джамиля трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем, у нее 2 совершеннолетних и один несовершеннолетний сын. Более18 лет она занимается приготовлением разных салатов. Начала она свой бизнес с приготовления двух видов салата в маленьких объемах. Сейчас  вместе со старшими детьми в домашних условиях они готовят салаты  в  большом объеме и продают их на рынке. Для приготовления салатов она покупает свежие овощи, поэтому имеют спрос. Джамиля  имеет постоянных клиентов. Она старается готовить не только вкусные, но новые салаты, которые отличаются от других и внешне. Джамиля знает, что очень трудно устоять на рынке, потому что сильная конкуренция. Она хочет поехать в Китай за приобретением товара, так как там все очень дешево. Покупка товаров поможет ей расширить бизнес и укрепить свои позиции на рынке. Она заботливая мать и знает, что развитие ее бизнеса принесет ей дополнительный доход в семейный бюджет, а также хорошие условия детям. У Джамили нет нужной суммы 3000$ США, она обратилась к вам в надежде на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Djamilya is a hard-working and conscientious woman.  She is married and has two adult and one adolescent sons.  She has been involved in preparing various salads for over 18 years.  Djamilya started her business with preparing two types of salads in small volumes.  Now, together with her older children, she prepares salads in large volumes and sell them at the market.  She buys fresh vegetables for her salads, and that is why they are in demand.  Djamilya has regular customers.  She tries to prepare not only delicious, but new salads that differ in appearance from others.  Djamilya knows that it is very hard to make it at the market because there is strong competition.  She wants to go to China for her products because everything is very inexpensive there.  The purchase of products would help her expand her business and strengthen her position at the market.  She is a caring mother and knows that developing her business would bring her an additional income for the family budget and better conditions for the children.  Djamilya does not have the necessary sum of $3000, and she came to you, hoping for your help.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru:
Elmira yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona zamujem i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Elmira rodilas v 1958 qodu.
Ona uje 15 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Seychas ona nujdayetsay v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci. Eto yeyo pervaya ssuda.
texts.en: Elmira is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her family.  She is married and has one child.  Elmira was born in 1958.  She has been involved in poultry farming for 15 years and breeds chickens.  She now needs a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy chickens.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Uuganbat

texts.en: Uuganbat is a 29 year old divorced father of two children. He is currently living alone. He is a mechanical engineer and has been driving a taxi for seven years.  Even though he lives alone, he is always looking for an advantage – something to increase his earnings. He wants to save more and start a new life. Over the last few months, he has been looking for another opportunity to earn more, and he has found the idea of selling coal during the winter. To do that, the first thing he needs is a vehicle to deliver the coal. He is requesting a loan to buy a mini truck.

loans.use: To buy a mini truck to deliver coal

loans.name: Sochida

texts.ru: Сочида проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 40 лет. Она разведена. Сочида уже три года как занимается торговлей детской одежды. Кроме того она имеет высшее образование. По профессии она педагог. В этой области работает 19 лет. Кредит берет для покупки сезонного товара. Она хочет закупить теплые детские брюки и спортивки вместе с бриджами.
texts.en: Sochida lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 40 years old and divorced.  Sochida has been involved in sales of children's clothing for three years.  Besides this, she has a higher education and is a teacher.  She has been working in this field for 19 years.  Sochida is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.  She wants to buy warm children's trousers and athletic suits with breeches.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 54 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nonito, a rice farmer, and mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Caridad makes a living by selling vegetables such as string beans, eggplant, cabbage and carrots while her husband manages the rice field that they are farming. When harvest time comes they sell their products to their contact rice dealers. For her vegetables she offers it in their local community. She earns a minimum of 250 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP17,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of vegetables, fertilizers and other farm inputs needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Caridad hopes for a good harvest and continuous growth of their business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and other farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam was born in 1983 and she lives with her mother, brother and sister-in-law in Yerevan. Her father works seasonally in the Russian Federation, which helps to cover his family’s needs. 

Mariam has danced for more than 14 years; she graduated from Sofi Devoyan’s Soul and Dance Theatre and she has a dance teacher certificate.  Besides dance, Mariam worked as a floral designer for more than 7 years. She says it is a very interesting and pleasing occupation, but not very profitable – so she decided to start her own business.  She now rents a stall in the Yerevan Jeweler’s market, where she sells gold and silver wares which are produced by her brother in their home. At the same time, she is taking accounting courses in order to develop her knowledge of the economy which will help her in her business. Thanks to the jewelry trade Mariam and her family have solved the problem of meeting all their needs.

She is asking for a $3000 loan to buy gold for producing and selling.

loans.use: To buy gold for producing and selling

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 25 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, 1 currently still in school. For the past 3 years, Robert has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which sells medicine and provides medical services to the local community. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more medicine, and will help Robert to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to build more rental houses and expand his pharmacy into a clinic. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new medicine for resale.

loans.name: Niyar

texts.ru: Niyar zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoim lubimim mujem i detmi. Niyar 45 let. Ona uje 6 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji. Niyar etomu biznessu nauchilas u svoyey starshey sestri.
texts.en: Niyar is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with her beloved husband and children.  Niyar is 45 years old.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for six years and breeds cattle.  She currently needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle in order to increase livestock quantity for sale.  Niyar learned this business from her older sister.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in airport community. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have four children between the ages of 8 and 30 years old. All of the children are presently in school and live at home. 

For the past twenty years she has been selling oil, pepper, onion, bitter ball, and salt. She makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more  oil, pepper, onion, bitter, and salt for her business. She plans to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, onion, bitter, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Marziya

texts.ru: Marziya 45 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Marziya uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione , posolok Akhmedbeyli vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Marziya seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Eto pervaya ssuda Marziyi.
texts.en: Marziya is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She has been in the poultry business raising chickens for the past 9 years. As an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) she was resettled from the city of Fuzuli to the town of Akhmedbeyli in the Fuzuli region, where she now lives with her family. Marziya is in need of 2000 AZN to buy chickens. It is a business she started with her mother. This is Marziya's first loan.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en:
Zabibu is a married woman who has no children. Her husband is a teacher and contributes his earnings towards the family's basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past three years; in addition, she sells vegetables. Her potential clients are her neighbors, friends and family members. She faces a major challenge of lack of payments from customers. She dreams of operating a larger shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of zips, rolls of fabric, ribbons and buttons. She decided to join Yehu because of sustainable financial services.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of zips, rolls of fabric, ribbons and buttons.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe, in the Jinja region of Uganda. For the past 5 years, Alex has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food to sell in his shop. This will help Alex to generate greater profits and provide for his family's basic needs. Alex hopes that, in the future, he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señorita Mercedes es estudiante, tiene 25 años de edad, está cursando la carrera de Licenciatura en enfermería en la Universidad Privada del Guaira.
Comenta además que es funcionaria contratada de la Secretaria Nacional de la Vivienda y el Hábitat. Mercedes con mucho esfuerzo está logrando cubrir los gastos de su estudio como la matricula, materiales didácticos y otros. Su sueño es terminar la carrera, ser una enfermera  profesional y servir a su comunidad.
Con este crédito que solicita ella va a pagar las cuotas que le quedan de este año y pagar derechos de examen. La misma agradece a Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo ofrecido porque gracias a eso ella va a poder continuar estudiando.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 25-year-old student enrolled in a program in The Private University of Guaira to become a licensed nurse.

She mentions also that she works as a civil servant for the Secretaria Nacional de la Vivienda y el Hábitat (Ministry of Housing and Habitat).  With a great deal of effort, Mercedes is managing to cover her educational expenses such as registration fees, educational materials, and other expenses.  

Her dream is to finish her course, become a professional nurse and serve her community.

With this loan she will pay her current fees for this school year and pay her examination fees.  She wishes to thank Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for offering their support, since thanks to this loan she will be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to cover exam fees and other educational fees.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза ответственная и трудолюбивая. Она опытная предпринимательница. Куплей и продажей детской одежды она занимается более 9 лет. Фируза любящая жена и заботливая мать. У нее торговая точка на рынке. Ее товар всегда имеет спрос,  с клиентами она внимательная и приветливая, поэтому имеет постоянных клиентов. Фируза  планирует расширить бизнес, приобрести новые товары, но у нее нет достаточных средств. Она хотела бы получить займ на сумму  1600$ США.  Приобретение товара поможет ей развить бизнес, она надеется на вашу проверку и заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Firuza is a responsible and hard-working person.  She is an experienced entrepreneur, who has been involved in buying and selling children's clothing for over nine years.  Firuza is a loving wife and caring mother.  She has a retail outlet at a market.  Her merchandise is always in demand.  She is always attentive and friendly with customers, and this is why she has regular customers.  Firuza plans to expand her business and buy new merchandise, but she does not have sufficient means.  She wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1600 to develop her business.  She relies on your support and thanks you in advance for it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en: Altantsetseg is a hardworking 53-year-old woman who has two daughters who are 31 and 33 years old. She lives in the capital of Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar, in a small traditional house (or ger) that lacks the infrastructure people have if they live closer to the city. Both of her daughters are married and on their own. Since 2000, Altantsetseg has made a living selling children’s clothing at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. She started out by renting a small stall but has done a good job of increasing her capital and attracting more customers. Today she has many regular customers who enjoy doing business with her. She is applying for a loan for 1,200,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to buy more children’s clothes to sell this autumn and winter. She is one of our trusted repeat clients who is extremely thankful to Kiva lenders for having given her an opportunity to make many positive changes in her business.

loans.use: to buy fall and winter children's clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Isaaka

texts.en:
Isaaka is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Isaaka has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and home supplies. 

To help expand his business, Isaaka has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more foodstuff to sell in his shop, and will help Isaaka to generate greater profits, and provide for his family's basic needs. Isaaka hopes that in the future, he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Isaaka is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaaka who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Husen

texts.ru: Хусен проживает в районе Дангара. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Образование у него средне - специальное, он шафер. В этой области он 14 лет. Хусен предоставляет услугу, такси. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Husen lives in the Dangara district.  He is 41 years old, married and has four children.  He has a secondary specialized education; he is a driver.  Husen has been in this business for 14 years.  He provides a taxi service.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his vehicle.

loans.use: to make repairs to his vehicle

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a divorced woman with two children; one of whom attends school while the other is too young for school. She has a house with electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past two years. In addition, she sells leso (Khangas) which adds to her other source of income. Her potential clients are the people that come to the market to buy fish. She faces a major challenge of lack of fish, especially during the cold seasons. She dreams of buying her own freezer, so that she can stock more fish for sale.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase more fish, ten liters of oil for frying fish, and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish, ten liters of oil for frying fish, and charcoal.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 23 years old, and lives in airport community. She is single, and has a five year old child that is currently in school, and lives at home. For the past seven years, she has been selling red oil. She has many customers, and makes a lot of profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil for her business, her plans are to buy her land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil for her business

loans.name: Andranik

texts.ru:
52-х летний Андраник живет в деревне Нореашен, Севанского региона, со своей женой и сыном. Андраник окончил индустриально-технологоческий техникум, где получил специальность бухгалтера. 
Сейчас Андраник работает в организации “Южно-Кавказские железные дороги”.  Сын учится в колледже.
Параллельно своей работе, Андраник и его жена занимаются сельским хозяйством. Они разводят крупный рогатых скот и кур, а также выращивают картофель. Картофель Андраник продает на рынке, мясо сдает мясникам на рынке, а молочную продукцию продает прямо из своего дома своим постоянным клиентам.   
Андрамику необходим кредит в 550.000 драм для покупки 3 телят, что позволит ему получать больший доход от своей фермы в будущем. 
Данный кредит является вторым, получаемым Андрамиком от организации Нор Оризон (Nor Horizon).
texts.en: 52-year-old Andranik lives together with his wife and son in the Noreashen village in the Sevan region.  Andranik graduated from an industrial-technical college and obtained a speciality of an accountant.  He currently works for the Southern Caucasus Railroads organization.  His son attends a college.  Parallel to his work, Andranik and his wife are involved in agriculture.  They breed cattle and chickens and also grow potatoes.  Andranik sells the potatoes at a market, sells meat to butchers at the market and sells milk right from his house to his loyal customers.  He needs a loan in the sum of 550,000 dram to buy three calves, which would let him earn a large income from his farm in the future.  This is Andranik's second loan from the Nor Horizon organization.

loans.use: to buy three calves for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken feed and 50 new chicks.

loans.name: Nazemse Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est la représentante du groupe NAZEMSE. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04ans et le moins âgé a 03 mois. Un (01) va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de la farine de maïs depuis 07ans.Sur la photo,elle tient un sachet de farine. Elle s’approvisionnement au marché de Bisghin. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de maïs pour transformer en farine.

Avec ses économies, elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin pour stocker le maïs et revendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata is the representative of the Nazemse group.  She is married and the mother of three children, the oldest of whom is four and the youngest three months.  One attends school.  She has three people under her care.

She has been selling corn flour for seven years.  In the photo, she is holding a sack of flour.  She buys her materials in the Bisghin market, and her customers are women.  She would like to buy three sacks of corn to make into flour.  With her savings, she contributes toward improving her family's standard of living.  She hopes to open a large store for storing and reselling corn.

loans.use: to buy three bags of corn to make into flour.

loans.name: Sochidamo

texts.ru: Сочидамо честная  старательная жена. За ее плечами12 лет предпринимательской деятельности. Сочидамо  продает продукты питания. Она приобретает товар на центральных  оптовых рынках и продает на районном рынке. У нее своя торговая точка. Она замужем у них 4 детей, но бизнесом она занимается самостоятельно. У нее растут дети, чтобы обеспечить их всем необходимым и развить бизнес она  хочет расширить бизнес. Сочидамо  не имеет нужной суммы. Она хотела бы получить займ на сумму 1100$ США. Сочидамо рассчитывает на вашу поддержку и благодарит вас за понимание.
texts.en: Sochidamo is an honest and hardworking woman. She has over 12 years of experiences as a business woman on her shoulders. Sochidamo sells groceries. She purchases goods at the central wholesale market and sells them at the regional market. She has her own grocery store. Sochdamo is married and has four children, but she is managing the business independently from her husband. Her children are growing up and to provide for them all she wants to expand her business. However, Sochidamo is lacking the starting capital for the expansion. She would like to take out a loan of US$ 1100 and is hoping for your support and grateful for you generosity.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in an airport community. She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 29. One lives at home and is presently in school, while the older one is working and lives at home. 

For the past twenty-five years Martha she has been selling frozen food (chicken, meat, and pig feet). She makes more profit since she sells very good and expensive products. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, fresh meat, and pig feet for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, fresh meat, and pig feet for her business.

loans.name: Boronkul

texts.ru: Боронкул проживает в районе Дангара. Женат. Имеет шестерых детей. Ему 50 лет. Его старший сын находится на заработках в России. Сам он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа двух бычков.
texts.en: Boronkul lives in the Dangara district.  He is 50 years old, married and has six children.  His oldest son works in Russia.  Boronkul earns a living by breeding cattle and small livestock.  He has been involved in this business for 15 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two bulls.

loans.use: to buy two bulls

loans.name: Alé

texts.fr: Monsieur Alé  habite au Sénégal. Il est âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants  âgés entre 3 et 13ans. Il s’active depuis 17 ans dans le secteur du transport. Il est chauffeur de la catégorie C1. Alé a fait  une formation en mécanique. Par la suite il est passé au service militaire avant d’exercer le métier de  chauffeur. Grâce a ce métier il a trouvé du travail  dans une entreprise de la place.  Il est sociétaire dans l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  depuis 7 ans. Il sollicite un prêt de 250 000 frs prévu pour la réparation de son taxi. Ce financement  l’aidera pour le redémarrage des activités de son taxi qui lui procurent des revenus supplémentaires.  Ainsi l’accroissement  de ses  revenus  l’aidera a mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Alé lives in Senegal. He is 39 years old, married and the father of 4 children aged between 3 and 13.

For 17 years he has been working in the transportation sector. He is a category C1 driver. Alé trained as a mechanic. After that, he went into military service before starting work as a driver. Due to his profession, he found work in a local business.

Alé has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC for 7 years. He is asking for a loan of 250,000 francs which he plans to use to repair his taxi. The loan will help him to re-start his work as a taxi driver which will provide extra income. Increased revenue will help him to better meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 46 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda. He is widowed and has 4 children. For the past 6 years, Francis has been working hard to manage his small business. He mills maize for making a Ugandan staple food called pocho. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize for milling, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and improve his family's quality of life. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to build rental houses and open more maize mills. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more maize for milling.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. Mwanasha has a house with no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

She has operated a grocery for the past two years. In addition, she also runs a leso (Khanga's) selling business. (Khangas are a traditional Kenyan woman's wrap, as pictured here.)  Her potential customers are the neighbors. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase one box of tomatoes, twenty kilos of sugar and thirty pieces of lesos (Khanga's) for sale. She decided to join Yehu to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase one box of tomatoes, twenty kilos of sugar and thirty pieces of lesos (Khanga's) for resale.

loans.name: Festo

texts.en:
Festo is 50 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, he has been working hard to manage his bar and brewery, which serves drinks and food to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Festo has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood to brew beer, and will help him to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school fees. He hopes that in the future he will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Festo is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Festo who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to brew beer.

loans.name: Saymurod

texts.ru: Саймурод проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат. У него пятеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Арендует помещение, где открыл национальную кухню. В этой области он 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения продуктов и необходимой посуды.
texts.en: Saymurod lives in the Dangara district.  He is 58 years old, married and has five children.  He has a secondary education.  Saymurod leases a space, where he opened a national kitchen cafe.  He has been in this business for 20 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of products and necessary dishware.

loans.use: to buy products and necessary dishware

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Mary is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap for resale, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Mary's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap for resale,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more book bags, travelling bags and children's bags for her business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 34 years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling mango juice and soda in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. Nancy requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more soft drinks likes mango juice and soda for resale. She will use the profits from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more mango juice, soda, and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy 36 pairs of shoes as well as some thioub fabrics

loans.name: Dahufa Ndagire's Group

texts.en:
Dahufa's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Dahufa is 16 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Dahufa has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar and soap to sell and will help Dahufa generate greater profit and pay for her school fees. Dahufa hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Dahufa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Dahufa's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 4 cylinder  pump motor, accessories, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Kamisa

texts.en:
Kamisa is a 39-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Kamisa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the extra income for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children who go to school. Her husband who is employed also contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She has a house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She has operated a poultry sales business for the past three years. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge with transportion since the market is far away. She dreams of selling her poultry wholesale.

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medication for the chicks. She decided to join Yehu to get capital for her business.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed, and medication for the chicks.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a single 22-year old. He is a focused businessman. For the last two years, he has been managing a tailoring business to earn a living. In the next 5 years, he wants to become more financially stable. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for making pillows and cushion covers. Thanks to Faulu Kenya's previous loans, he has been able to manage his business.

loans.use: To buy fabric for making pillows and cushion covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of Khangas (traditional African colourful garments)for resale.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial es de la ciudad Concepción, tiene 26 años y  está cursando el primer año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Enfermería de la Universidad Politécnica y Artística del Paraguay.
Marcial recibe apoyo de su mamá que está en España, la cual le envía dinero desde allí para sus gastos de estudio y demás.
El dice que su sueño es poder terminar su carrera para que de esa forma pueda tener su propio ingreso y además de eso por medio de su trabajo pueda ayudar a las personas que necesitan de su servicio.
El solicita el préstamo para el pago de la mensualidad de su facultad y también para la compra de libros que está necesitando para estudiar. Agradece a la Fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan para seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marcial is from the city of Concepción.  He is 26 years old and is studying to become a licensed nurse.  He is in his first year of a program at the Polytechnic and Artistic University of Paraguay.  Marcial receives support from his mother, who is in Spain.  She sends him money to help with his educational and other expenses.

He says that his dream is to be able to finish his course so that he can earn his own money.  Further, through his work he wants to be able to help people who need his services.  He is seeking this loan in order to meet his monthly schooling expenses and to buy books that he needs for his studies.  He wishes to thank Fundación Paraguaya  and Kiva for giving him the opportunity to continue his studies.

loans.use: to buy books and meet his monthly expenses.

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hairdressing for local women. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase equipment needed to do special braids and will help her generate greater profit to buy new clothes and food to feed her family. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to open another larger salon. 

Faridah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Faridah's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase the equipment needed to do special braids.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and lives in the town of Bungokho in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married with two children who are currently in school. For the past eleven years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her small shop where she sells pesticides, fertilizer and other farming supplies. 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. This loan will be used to purchase more farming supplies to sell and will help her generate greater profit to pay bills and medical expenses for her family. Catherine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch in a neighboring area. 

Catherine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Catherine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more farming supplies to sell.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is married with two children, both of whom are still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a café, and her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Nuru dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase furniture, chairs and tables for the café. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase furniture, chairs and tables for her café.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
