Gloria is a member of the Cochapamba communal bank.  She lives in Cuenca, which was recognized as a World Heritage Site in 1999 thanks to its colonial architecture, its friendly and cordial people, and the maintenance of its culture and traditions.

Gloria, age 50, is married and seven children.  Three of them are married and independent, two attend the university, and two work and help her financially.  Her husband works making ceilings in his own shop.  She lives in her own house.

Gloria works with her husband in the shop where they make ceilings.  They have been in this business activity for 19 years.  She works Monday through Saturday without a fixed schedule.

She has been a member of the communal bank for three years.  She will use her new loan to buy plaster, reeds, and cement to make the ceilings.

Her goal is to get ahead together with her family.

loans.use: to buy plaster, reeds, and cement.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Fraternidad Prospera, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui, parroquia que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, su estructura es un pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

Doña Rosa tiene 52 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, solo uno es casado e independiente, sus cuatro hijos solteros trabajan solo para sus gastos personales. Su esposo es comerciante, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica al comercio de sombreros, gorras, bisutería, frutas y todo lo que este es temporada, lleva en este negocio 20 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros, gorras, bisutería y más mercadería.
 
Su meta es comprar un vehículo para trasladarse con su mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Fraternidad Prospera Communal Bank.  She lives south of the city of Cuenca, in Tarqui Parish, which is organized as a small urban community of irregular design with houses of adobe, wattle and daub, and tile roofs, and that preserves its vernacular and traditional architecture.  The people work in livestock and agriculture, and are known for being friendly and charismatic.

Rosa, 52, is married and has five adult children from her marriage.  Only one child is married and independent.  Her four single children work only for their personal expenses.  Her husband is a businessman.  The house they live in is their own.

Rosa sells hats, caps, costume jewelry, fruit, and everything that is in season.  She has been working in this business for 20 years and works every day without a set schedule.

This is her first loan with the communal bank and she's going to use it to buy hats, caps, costume jewelry, and other merchandise.
 
Her goal is to buy a vehicle to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy hats, caps, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Noemi Karina

texts.es:
La Señorita Noemi es socia del banco comunal Fraternidad Prospera, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui, parroquia que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, su estructura es un pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

La Señorita. Noemi es soltera y tiene 19 años de edad, vive con sus padres, su padre es agricultor y su madre comerciante, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

Ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de sombreros y gorras, este actividad  la realiza hace 3 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo ciclo y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señorita Noemi is a member of the communal bank Fraternidad Prospera. She lives in the parish of Tarqui which is located in the south of the city of Cuenca. Tarqui is a small urban area of irregular shape and adobe houses, with mud and tiled roofs, which retains it traditional vernacular architecture  and its friendly and charismatic people who work in livestock and agriculture.

Señorita Noemi is single and 19 years old. She lives with her parents. Her father is a farmer and her mother a merchant. The house they live in is their own property.

She is a businesswoman who sells hats and caps. She has been doing this for the last 3 years. She works Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.

She is in her 2nd cycle with the communal bank and she is going to use the loan to purchase hats.

Her goal is to have a house of her own.

\

loans.use: to buy hats.

loans.name: Jorge German

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge es socio del banco comunal Fraternidad Prospera, vive por la parroquia de Tarqui, parroquia que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, su estructura es un pequeño conjunto urbano, de traza irregular, con viviendas de adobe, bahareque y techo de teja, que conserva su arquitectura vernácula y tradicional, su gente se dedica a la ganadería, agricultura y se caracterizan por ser personas amables y carismáticas.

El Señor. Jorge es soltero y tiene 25 años de edad, el lugar en el que vive es arrendado.
 
El  se dedica a la venta de toda clase de sombreros como: de paja toquilla, cuero y tela, negocio en el que se encuentra hace 3 años y vende dentro y fuera de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Es socio del banco comunal y este su quinto ciclo, este nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros para incrementar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge is a member of the "Fraternidad Prospera" communal bank. He lives in Tarqui parish, which is located in the south of the city of Cuenca.  It is made up of a small collection of buildings of irregular appearance, with houses of adobe, bahareque (wall made of plaited cane and mud) and tile roofs, that maintain the traditional architecture typical of the region. The people make their living raising livestock, and farming, and are known for being friendly and charming. 

Jorge is 25 and single. He place where he lives is rented. He sells all kinds of hats, such as toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats), leather hats, and fabric hats. He has been in business for three years, and sells both inside and outside the city. He works from Sunday to Sunday without fixed hours. 

He is a member of the communal bank, and this is his fifth loan. He will use this new loan to buy hats, in order to add to his merchandise. His goal is to buy himself a vehicle for his business.

loans.use: To buy hats.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno.  Tiene 52 años y está casada. Tiene una hija de 16 años. Su esposo le apoya en su negocio.
Todo el día a partir de las 5am hasta las 8pm Nely vende gaseosas, sacos, hojas de coca y otros productos en su puesto ubicado en un mercado de la zona. Tiene su negocio (bodeguita) ya hace más que 10 años.  Ella inició con un capital de S./1,000.00. 
Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S./ 2,300.00 va a comprar nuevos productos como papeles y hojas de coca.
Lo que le gusta sobre todo con Manuela Ramos es que el ahorro y su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nely is a member of the Nueva Generación 2000 Communal Bank in the Ilave district in the department of Puno.  She is 52 years old and married.  She has one daughter, age 16.  Her husband helps her in her business.

Nely sells sodas, bags, coca leaves, and other products all day long from 5 a.m. until 8 p.m. in her stall located in a market in the area.  She has had her business (a grocery store) for more than 10 years now.  She started with a capital investment of 1,000 PEN.

She has been a member of the Manuela Ramos movement for two years.

With this new loan of 2,300 PEN she's going to buy new products like papers and coca leaves.

What she likes about Manuela Ramos above all is the savings, and her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy paper and coca leaves.

loans.name: Glenis Aida

texts.es:
Glenis tiene 46 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos, reside en el Barrio La Soledad en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta basica, aseo personal y uso domestico.

Desde aproximadamente 15 años Glenis tiene su pulperia, inició su negocio porque vio la necesidad de sus vecinos de tener un lugar cercano donde comprar los productos de consumo alimenticio, de uso domestico entre otros. Su inversion inicial fue de 3,000 lempiras y poco a poco fueron mejorando sus ventas y con eso pudo incrementar el inventario de productos en su pulperia. Su horario de atencion comienza desde muy temprano por las mañanas y culmina a las 9:00 pm. 

El año pasado solicitó un prestamo para el mejoramiento de su negocio pero este no le alcanzó para terminar, asi que Glenis está solicitando este prestamo para pintar su pulperia y comprar varias vitrinas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio lucirá mas bonito y atractivo para sus clientes y sus productos estaran mejor exhibidos en las vitrinas.

Su meta es convertir su negocio en un mini-mercadito. Este es su ciclo 16 en FAMA y ha a pesar de que ha sido sometida tres veces a operaciones por la apendicitis, el pago de sus cuotas han sido puntuales.
texts.en:
Glenis is 46 years old and a single mother of two children. She resides in the neighborhood of La Soledad in the town of Juticalpa. Glenis sells basic food items, personal toiletries, and household products.

She has managed a store for approximately 15 years. Glenis started her business because she saw the need for her neighbors to have a place nearby where they could buy everyday consumer food products, household goods, and other items. Her initial investment was 3000 HNL and she gradually improved her sales. With her earnings, Glenis was able to increase the inventory of products in her store. Her schedule of operation starts very early in the morning and ends at 9pm.

Last year Glenis requested a loan to make improvements to her business, but she was not able to complete all of the work. She is now requesting a loan so that she can paint her store and buy several display cabinets. With the help of this loan, Glenis will be able to make her store nicer and more attractive to her customers. Her products will be well-displayed in their cases.

Her goal is to convert her business into a mini-market. This is her 16th loan with FAMA. Despite having undergone three operations for appendicitis, Glenis has been able to submit all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy paint and display cabinets for improving the appearance of her store.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es:
Eusebia es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generación 2000” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno.  Es viuda y tiene 63 años. Nunca visitó una escuela, pero sus tres hijas y dos hijos que tienen entre 25 y 44 años cuentan todos con una educación superior. Ellos ya son independientes y viven fuera, sólo su nieto D. 14 años vive con ella y le hace compañía D. vez en cuando en su negocio. 
DesD. hace seis años Eusebia se dedica a su bodeguita donD. venD. sobre todo bebidas. Inició con un capital D. S./ 1,000.00. Antes que instale esa bodeguita tuvo una tienda D. ropa, pero le han robado todo, así que tenía que empezar D. nuevo. Con este nuevo préstamo D. S./ 3,000.00 va a comprar productos nuevos como arroz, azúcar y abarrotes en general.
Su meta es ampliar su negocio. Está unos 7 años con Manuela Ramos y lo que le gusta es el ahorro.
texts.en:
Eusebia is a member of the Nueva Generación Community Bank in Ilave district in the department of Puno. She is a widow and is 63 years old. She herself has never been to school, but her three daughters and two sons aged between 25 and 44 have all had a good education. They are all adults living away from home. However, a 14-year old grandson lives with her and keeps her company from time to time in her store.

For the last six years Eusebia has run a small store where she sells mainly drinks. She began with an investment of S/.1000. Beforehand she had a clothing store but everything was stolen and she had to start over again. 

With this new loan of S/.3000 she plans to buy new products such as rice, sugar, and other groceries. Her goal is to expand her store. Eusebia has been a client of Manuela Ramon for seven years, and she most enjoys the opportunity to save.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and other groceries

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno y tiene 52 años. Está casada y tiene 7 hijos que tienen entre 10 y 32 años. A su cargo vive una hija que es madre soltera y su bebé.
Antes de ser socia de Manuela Ramos tuvo sólo un puesto de golosinas que estableció ella misma. Hace cuatro años que una amiga la invitó a ser parte de Manuela, ella tiene un negocio de venta de detergentes y querosene que inició con S./ 400.00. Una de sus hijas se quedó con el primero puesto. 
Con el nuevo préstamo de S./ 2,500.00 va a comprar detergentes y dos cilindros de querosene.
Le gusta con Manuela Ramos que el ahorro que gana interés y además los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
52-year old Clara is a member of the Nueva Generación Community Bank in Ilave district in the department of Puno. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 10 and 32. Clara still supports one daughter who is a single mother with a baby.

Before becoming a client with Manuela Ramos, she had a stand selling candy which she started herself. Then four years ago a friend invited her to be part of the Manuela Ramos organization. Now she has a business selling detergent and kerosene which she started with a loan of S/.400. One of her daughters now runs the candy stall. With this new loan of S/.2000 Clara is going to buy detergent and two cylinders of kerosene.

She enjoys working with Manuela Ramos because of the interest she earns from her savings and also the sporting events that are organized.

loans.use: to buy kerosene and detergent

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” del distrito Ilave en el departamento Puno y tiene 32 años. Está casada y tiene una hija y un hijo de dos y cuatro años. 
Desde pequeña le gustaba vender y su madre se lo enseñó. Desde hace cuatro años lleva su puesto de chiflería y hace un año que tiene una bodeguita instalada en su propia casa. Inició este negocio con un capital de S./ 1,000.00. Con el nuevo préstamo de S./ 1,000.00 va a comprar productos para su tienda como leche, atún, gaseosas y aceites.

Nos cuenta que aún vende sus productos de chiflería (varios/diversos de uso personal) de forma ambulatoria.
Su madre fue quien la invitó a ser socia en Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años. Lo que le gusta mucho con Manuela es el ahorro y las reuniones, donde se divierte y ríe mucho.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generacion 2000” in the district of Llave in the department of Puno. She is 32 years old, married and has a daughter aged 2 and a son aged 4. 

From childhood she loved to sell and her mother taught her. For the past 4 years she has had a street stall selling natural remedies and for the past year a small store located in her own house. She started this business with a capital of S./1,000.00 (PEN). With the new loan of S./1,000.00 (PEN)she  is going to buy products for her shop such as milk, tuna, sodas and oil.

She tells us that she still sells her natural remedies (various/miscellaneous for personal use) as a street vendor.

Her mother was the one who invited her to become a member of Manuela Ramos 2 years ago. What she likes a lot about Manuela is the savings and the meetings where she has a lot of fun and laughs.

loans.use: to buy tuna, oil and other products for her shop.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nieves es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” en el distrito Ilave, en el departamento Puno y tiene 22 años. Ella y su pareja tienen a una hija de un año.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa, telas, gorros y medias. Además su pareja fabrica balleta (tela artesanal) que ella también vende. Fue idea de su madre, quien también pertenece a Manuela Ramos, de establecer el negocio y empezó hace dos años con un capital de S./ 200.00. El nuevo préstamo de S./500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de lana para fabricar más balletas. 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia y ampliar el negocio un poco más. Con Manuela Ramos le gusta mucho las actividades como por ejemplo los talleres de producción.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generacion 2000” in the district of Llave in the department of Puno. She is 22 years old and she and her partner have a 1 year old daughter.

She sells clothes, fabrics, hats and socks. In addition, her partner makes balleta (a traditional cloth) which she also sells. It was her mother's idea, who is also a member of Manuela Ramos, to set up the business and she started 2 years ago with a capital outlay of S./200.00 (PEN). She will invest the new loan for S./500.00 (PEN) in the purchase of wool to make more balletas.

Her dream is to have her own house and expand her business a little more. At Manuela Ramos, she loves the activities such as the workshops

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” en el distrito Ilave, en el departamento Puno y tiene 45 años. Está casada y tiene 5 hijos entre 3 y 23 años.
Tiene un puesto grande donde vende ropa de niños y adultos. Ya lleva con este negocio más de 24 años y empezó muy pequeño y de manera ambulatoria. Sus hijas la apoyan en el negocio. 
Con el nuevo préstamo de S./ 2,500.00 comprará nuevos abrigos, polos y otras prendas. 

Lleva seis años con Manuela Ramos y su sueño es de tener una galería con más espacio donde podrá exhibir más productos.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generacion 2000” in the district of Llave in the department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 23.

She has a large stall where she sells children's clothes and adult clothing. She has been in the business for more than 24 years, starting off small as a street vendor. Her daughters help her out with the business.

With the new loan of S./2,500.00 (PEN), she will buy new coats, polo shirts and other garments.

She has been with Manuela Ramos for 6 years and her dream is to have a shop with more space where she can display more products.

loans.use: to buy new coats, polo shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Real Atahuallpa Group

texts.es:
El señor Patricio nació en la ciudad de San Román del departamento de Puno y radica hace 15 años en la ciudad de Cusco. (El socio está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

El señor Patricio tiene 51 años y está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos de la cuales tres son independientes y dos depende todavía de él, él es una hombre trabajador y responsable que saca adelante a su familia,  él es chofer de una empresa de transportes urbano, él también en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en su propio taxi. Ya son varios años que se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  En esta oportunidad Patricio requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su taxi.  

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Real Atahuallpa” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas de los demás socios son por ejemplo venta de abarrotes, alquiler de carros, cocinero, ayudante de maestro albañil, agricultura, alquiler de puesto de venta y otras. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. (El socio que está en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).
texts.en:
Patricio was born in the municipality of San Ramón in Puno department, and has resided in the city of Cusco for 15 years. He is the member raising his hand in the photograph. 

Patricio is 51, married, with five children, of whom three are on their own, and two still depend on him. He is a very hard-working and responsible man, who is helping his family get ahead in life.  He is a driver for a city bus company, and in his free time he also operates his own taxi. It's going very well, thanks to the effort he puts into his work. On this occasion, Patricio needs the loan to have maintenance done on his taxi.

The members of the "Real Atahualpa" communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Cusco. The communal bank is made up of people who are hard-working and enterprising, who at every turn are looking for opportunities to get ahead, and through their daily effort provide a better future for their children. The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco. The rest of the members are involved in money-making activities such as selling groceries, renting cars, cooking, master bricklayer's helper, farming, renting a retail stand and other things.

Cusco is well known for its tourism, commerce, traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because Machu Picchu, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, is located there.

loans.use: To have maintenance done on his taxi.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es:
Rogelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Nueva Generacion 2000” del distrito Ilave, en el departamento Puno y tiene 26 años. Ella y su pareja tienen una hija de 5 años.
Tiene un pequeño puesto en un mercado de la zona donde vende pollos. Fue idea de la familia de establecer este negocio, esto ya desde hace un año. 
Inició con un capital de S./ 1,500.00.  Con este nuevo préstamo de S./ 500.00 comprará pollos al por mayor.

Su sueño es que su negocio sea cada vez más grande.  Lo que le gusta de su banco comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Rogelia is a member of the communal bank “Nueva Generacion 2000” in the district of Llave in the department of Puno. She is 26 years old and has a 5 year old daughter with her partner.

She has a small stall in the market where she sells chickens. It was her family's idea to start this business a year ago.

She started the business with a capital of S./1,500.00 (PEN). With this new loan of S./500.00 (PEN) she is going to buy chickens in bulk.

Her dream is for her business to get bigger. What she likes about her communal bank is the savings.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres con Visión, vive por la parroquia de  LLacao que se encuentra situado al noreste de la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta con lugares turísticos como son: la Gruta del Cerro Ripichala, la Planicie de Pachamama, El cementerio de los Incas, Apangora – Molle(ruinas Cañaris), su gente se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías como: sombreros de paja toquilla, cestería y cerámica decorativa.
 
La Señora. María tiene 50 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos,  3 son casados e independientes, 4 son solteros, trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, uno de los solteros está estudiando por las noches el bachillerato. La casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María se dedica a la preparación y venta de hornado y fritada (Platos típicos de carne de cerdo), realiza esta actividad hace 19 años y vente ambulantemente los fines de semana, en las fiestas de pueblos o en el oriente ecuatoriano. En casa se dedica a la cría de  cerdos y cuyes. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ollas y en los ingredientes como carne de pollo, hojas de achira, harina, mantequilla, azúcar, queso, pasas, etc. para realizar tamales y quimbolitos (Platos típicos Ecuatorianos) y así variar la venta en su gastronomía.
 
Su meta es de tener otro negocio como una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Mujeres con Visión" community bank.  She lives in Llacao parish, in the north-east of the city of Cuenca.  This area has a number of tourist spots such as the Cave at Ripichala Hill, the Pachamama Plain, the Inca Cemetery and Apangora - Molle (the Cañaris ruins).  The locals make handicrafts such as Panama hats, baskets and decorative ceramics.

María is 50 years old and divorced.  She has seven children from her marriage.  Three of her children are married and live independently.  The other four are single.  They work and help her financially.  One of her single children is studying for his high school diploma at night.  María owns the house in which she lives.

María's business is preparing and selling oven-baked and fried food (typical pork dishes).  She has been in this business for 19 years and sells her food as a street vendor at weekends, at local festivals or in the eastern part of Ecuador.  She also raises pigs and guinea pigs at home.

This is María's first loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a neighbor.  She will invest her loan money in buying pans and ingredients such as chicken, achira leaves, flour, butter, sugar, cheese, raisins, etc. for making tamales and quimbolitos (typical Ecuadorian dishes) so that she can vary her menu. 

María's goal is to own another business such as a home-based store.

loans.use: to buy pans, chicken, achira leaves, flour, butter, sugar, cheese, raisins, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blankets, bed sheets and groceries

loans.name: Rina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Rina tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de cinco hijos, junto a su familia reside en la colonia Rivas Montes en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria.

Desde hace 18 años atras doña Rina cuenta con una pulperia que le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Inició vendiendo solamente refrescos, charamuscas y chocobananos, y poco a poco con lo que le quedaba de sus ventas diarias. Su inversion inicial fue de 3,500 lempiras y ahora cuenta con un inventario de productos valorado en 50,000 lempiras. Ella atiende su pulperia sola y cuando sus hijos tienen tiempo libre le ayudan. 

Doña Rina solicita este prestamo para la compra de embutidos, lacteos, carnes, maseca, arroz, pastas, escobas, shampoos, acondicionadores, desodorantes, refrescos, jugos, verduras, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su pulperia estará mejor surtida y sus clientes siempre encontraran lo que necesiten.

Su meta es tener un mini-mercadito y contratar a un empleado para que la ayude a atenderlo, y asi ella podra atender a su familia y en un futuro cercano tener otro negocio mas.

Este es su ciclo 8 en FAMA y por dos ocasiones ha sido premiada por ser una cliente puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Doña Rina is 45 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She lives with her family in Rivas Montes in the town of Juticalpa and she sells groceries.

For the last 18 years Doña Rina has had a store which allows her to help her husband support the family. She started off selling soft drinks, frozen fruit drinks and banana icecreams and little by little with what was left over from her daily sales she expanded. Her initial investment was 3,500 lempiras (HNL). She now has an inventory of products valued at 50,000 lempiras (HNL). She takes care of her store alone and when her children have free time they help her out.

Doña Rina is asking for this loan to buy cold meats, milk products, meat, maseca (instant corn dough), rice, noodles, brushes, shampoos, conditioners, deoderants, soft drinks, fruit juices, vegetables and other products. With the help of this loan, her store will be better stocked and her customers will always find what they need.

Her goal is to have a mini-mart and hire an employee to help her serve the customers. In this way she will be able to take care of her family and in the near future have another business.

This is her 8th loan cycle with FAMA and she has twice been awarded for being on time with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy groceries in general.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hardware items

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
Norma Betulia es una joven de 23 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos, es una persona amable y muy servicial, reside en el barrio Las Brisas en el municipio de Silca y se dedica a la venta de golosinas.

Hace cuatro años atras Norma recibió su titulo de educacion secundaria y al no encontrar trabajo decidió dedicarse a la venta de golosinas ya que su madre le enseñó a cocinar muy bien. Su horario de atencion inicia a las 6:00 pm y culmina a las 9:00 pm y los fines de semana termina un poco mas tarde, y mientras ella atiende su negocio le ayuda a cuidar a sus dos pequeños hijos. Su mayor reto era encontrar una institucion que la apoyara con un financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio pero por su edad y bajo perfil crediticio ninguna le otorgado un prestamo hasta FAMA creyó en ella y en el potencial de su negocio.

El prestamo que Norma solicita lo necesita para la compra de carnes, verduras, harina, salsas, condimentos, refrescos, frijoles, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella podra satisfacer la demanda de sus golosinas y eso le dara mayores ganancias.

Su meta en instalar una pequeña cafeteria porque actualmente vende al frente de su casa. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Norma Betulia is a young woman of 23.  She is married and has two children.  Norma is a kind and very helpful person.  She lives in Las Brisas neighborhood, in the town of Silca.  Her business is selling sweet treats.

Four years ago, Norma received her high school diploma and, as she couldn't find work, she decided to start selling sweet treats as her mother taught her how to cook very well.  She starts serving her customers at 6.00pm and finishes at 9.00pm.  On weekends she finishes a little later.  While she is serving in her business, she helps take care of her two young children.  Her biggest challenge was to find an institution who would support her with a loan to invest in her business.  Owing to her age and her low credit rating, no institution would give her a loan until FAMA believed in her and in the potential of her business.

Norma needs the loan that she has requested to buy meat, vegetables, flour, sauces, seasonings, soft drinks, beans and other products.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to satisfy demand for her sweet treats and this will make her more profits.

Norma's goal is to set up a small café because she currently sells her products in front of her home.  This is her first loan cycle with FAMA and she hopes to make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and soft drinks

loans.name: Clavel Group

texts.es:
Martha Carolina tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y progenitora de 3 hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Panuaya en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de pan.

Martha aprendió a elaborar pan desde que era una niña porque tenía que ayudar a su madre ya que ésta se dedicaba a esa actividad. Con el transcurso del tiempo Martha fue creciendo y se casó, y para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar decidió dedicarse a la venta de pan. Su producto es muy solicitado por los clientes ya que es ideal para el cafecito de la tarde y para enviarle a los familiares que se encuetran en el extranjero, ademas vende de forma ambulante. Martha reside en una comunidad no muy cercana y su mayor dificultad es transportarse hasta el centro del municipio para adquirir los insumos necesarios para poder elaborar el pan.

El prestamo que Martha esta solicita lo necesita para la compra de huevos, harina, levadura y azucar. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes mayor cantidad y variedad de panes. 

Su meta es llegar a tener una panaderia y asi poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Martha al igual que su compañera de grupo tienen varios ciclos en FAMA y han cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Martha Carolina is 30 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives together with her family in Panuaya community, in Juticalpa.  Her business is making and selling bread.

Martha learned to make bread when she was a young girl because she had to help her mother who worked in this business.  Over time, Martha grew up and got married.  In order to help her husband with their household expenses, she decided to start selling bread.  Her products are very much in demand with her customers as they are an ideal accompaniment to an afternoon cup of coffee and ideal for sending to family members living abroad.  She also sells her products as a street vendor.  Martha lives in a fairly isolated community and her biggest difficulty is travelling to the town center to buy the supplies she needs to make her bread.

Martha needs the loan that she is requesting to buy eggs, flour, yeast and sugar.  With the support of this loan, she will be able to offer her customers a larger quantity and variety of breads.  Her goal is to own a bakery so that she can provide her children with a better quality of life.  Martha and her fellow group member have been through several loan cycles with FAMA and have made all their loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour and baking soda

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and bags, and to pay laborers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries

loans.name: Coyutepe Group

texts.es:
Don Rosendo tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene nueve hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la aldea Coyutepe y se dedica a la agricultura y a la venta de achineria.

Don Rosendo aprendió del negocio de la achineria por uno de sus vecinos, y desde entonces esta es su segunda actividad economica. Su primer actividad es la agricultura, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano por las mañanas y se va al campo a trabajar la tierra y regresa al mediodia. Por las tardes saca su puesto y todo su achineria para la venta, y eso lo realiza desde hace 15 años atras. Su mayor preocupacion es que la Alcaldia lo desaloje ya que no cuenta con un permiso porque vende su achineria en un lugar publico.

Don Rosendo solicita este prestamo para la compra de achineria como radios, focos, fajas, entre otros productos y tambien fertilizantes. Con el apoyo de este prestamo podra surtir de mayor variedad de productos y con la compra del fertilizante podra enriquecer su tierra y eso favorecera el crecimiento de su cultivo.

Su sueño es tener un local propio. Este es su decimoquinto ciclo en FAMA y ha cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Rosendo is 57 years old, married, and has nine children.  He lives together with his family in the small village of Coyutepe.  His businesses are farming and selling general merchandise.

Rosendo learned his business selling general merchandise through one of his neighbors and, since then, it has become his secondary business activity.  His main business activity is farming.  Every day he gets up very early in the morning and goes to his fields to work the land.  He returns home at midday.  In the afternoons he gets out his stall and all the merchandise that he sells.  He has been doing this for 15 years.  His main worry is that the council might move him on as he doesn't have a permit but is selling his merchandise in a public place.

Rosendo is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as radios, headlamps, belts and other products.  He will also buy fertilizers.  With the support of this loan, he will be able to stock his business with a wider variety of products and, by purchasing fertilizer, he will be able to enrich his land which will help the growth of his crops.

Rosendo's dream is to own business premises.  This is his fifteenth loan from FAMA and he has made all his previous loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise and fertilizers

loans.name: Noris Jackeline

texts.es:
Noris es una joven de 24 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos, reside en la colonia Moncada-Lobo y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria.

Noris inició vendiendo golosinas y actualmente lo sigue haciendo, con las ganancias que fue obteniendo a traves del tiempo logró instalar una pequeña pulperia en una parte de su casa de habitacion y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien. Noris no cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos asi que todos los gastos de su casa corren por su propia cuenta por esa razon se esfuerza tanto en mantener activos sus negocios. Por las mañanas y tardes se dedica a atender su pulperia y por las tardes-noches se dedica a elaborar y vender las golosinas.

Noris solicita este prestamo para surtir su pulperia de corn flakes, cereales, lacteos, pollo, embutidos, carnes, salsas, pastas, refrescos, jugos, condimentos, manteca, papel higienico, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo tendra mas y variados productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y eso le generará mas ingresos.

Su meta es construir su casa ya que actualmente debe pagar alquiler, y convertir su pulperia en un mini-super. Este es su sexto ciclo en FAMA y ha cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas muy puntualmente.
texts.en:
Noris is a 24 year old young woman and a single mother of two children.  She lives in the Moncado-Lobo neighborhood and sells groceries for a living. 

Noris started selling sweets which she is still currently doing.  With the income she earned over time, she set up a small store in a part of her house and "she gives thanks to God" because things are going well.  Noris doesn't receive support from her children's father and she has to pay the household expenses on her own.  For this reason she works hard to maintain her businesses.   In the mornings and afternoons she tends her store and in the evenings she makes and sells her sweets.  

Noris is requesting a loan to stock her store with corn flakes, grains, dairy products, chicken, cold cuts, meats, salsas, pastas, soft drinks, juices, condiments, butter, toilet paper, and other products.  With the help of this loan she will have more and varied products to offer her customers and generate more income.  

Her goals are to build a house because currently she is renting and to convert her store into a mini- supermarket.  This is her sixth cycle with FAMA and she has made all of her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase merchandise such as corn flakes, grains, dairy products, chicken, cold cuts, meats, salsas, pastas, soft drinks, juices, condiments, butter, toilet paper, and other products for her general store.

loans.name: Diamante Group

texts.es:
El Grupo solidario esta integrado por tres socios, los cuales se dedican a diferentes actividades economicas y residen en la comunidad de Las Delicias en el municipio de Trojes.

Doña Santos Ancelma es la coordinadora del grupo, tiene 59 años de edad y progenitora de 10 hijos, es una persona comprometida y amable. Todos sus hijos son adultos y casados, ellos le ayudan economicamente pero a Doña Santos no le gusta sentir que es una carga y por eso desde hace varios años atras se dedica a la venta de abarroteria en general y eso le ha permitido sostenerse sin ningun problema. Ella sola atiende su pulperia y lo realiza desde las 6:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm, para obtener los productos algunos proveedores llegan hasta la puerta de su negocio y para adquirir otros tiene que ir al mercado. 

El prestamo que Doña Santos Ancelma solicita lo necesita para la comprar granos basicos, lacteos, carnes, pastas, verduras, frutas, refrescos, jugos, pan, churros, manteca, jabon, entre otros productos. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su pulperia estara mejor surtida y sus clientes tendran mayor oferta de productos para su eleccion.

Su meta es mantener activo su negocio. Sus compañeros de grupo se dedican a la venta de rosquillas y nacatamales y al destazo de cerdo.

Este es el su sexto ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three members who are dedicated to different economic activities.  They live in the Las Delicias community in the town of Trojes.  

Doña Santos Ancelma  is the coordinator of the group.  She is 59 years old and has 10 children.  She is a committed and friendly person.  All of her children are adults and married.  They help her financially, but Doña Santos doesn't like to feel like she is a burden.  For this reason, several years ago, she started selling general grocery products and this has allowed her to support herself without any problems.  She tends her store by herself and works from 6:00 am until 8:00 pm to receive deliveries for her business. To purchase other products she has to go to the market.  

Doña Santos Ancelma is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, meats, pastas, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, juices, bread, churros, butter, soap and other products.  With the help of this loan her store will be better stocked and her customers will have more products to choose from.  

Her goal is to keep her business going.  Her fellow group members are Iris Antonia, who sells donuts and nacatamales [Nicaraguan tamales] and Santos Tomas, who sells pork.   

This is her sixth loan with FAMA and she expects to make her payments on time.

loans.use: purchase  basic grains, dairy products, meats, pastas, vegetables, fruits, soft drinks, juices, bread, churros, butter, soap and other products.

loans.name: Sobresalientes Group

texts.es:
El comité Sobresalientes nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo D. otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar donD. residen las integrantes, que es la ciudad D. San Lorenzo. Las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
La Sra. Norma es una mujer casada, muy emprendedora e innovadora, durante todos este ciclo ha demostrado muchas ganas D. superación. Ella se dedica a la ventas varias, es decir D. todo tipo D. productos que trae D. muchos lugares, como ser prendas, sabanas, calzados y demás, gracias a su sacrificio diario ella pueD. mantener a toda su familia, como así también los gastos D. la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. sabanas, calzados, prendas y demás para su abastecimiento y posterior venta. Agradece por la oportunidad que Kiva y la Fundación le esta brindando.
texts.en:
The “Sobresalientes” committee was born thanks to the encouragement and support from another committee that was working in the same location where the members resiD.: the city of San Lorenzo. Each member's progress is the committee's main goal.  They are known in their location as very hardworking, enterprising women.

Norma is a married, very enterprising, innovative woman.  During the entire cycle she’s shown herself to be driven to succeed.  She sells assorted merchandise, that is, all sorts of products that she brings from many places.  They can be clothes, sheets, footwear and others.  Thanks to her daily sacrifice she’s able to support her entire family as well as cover household expenses.

She is asking for the loan to buy sheets, footwear, clothing and other items to stock up and later resell.  She is grateful for the opportunity Kiva and the Fundación are providing her.

loans.use: to buy sheets, footwear clothes and other things.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras ha decidido formar parte del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Este grupo es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, las integrantes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal.
Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras y unidas.
La Sra. Elizabeth, presidenta del grupo, esta domiciliada en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, está casada, con 3 hijos, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora. Su marido se dedica a la jardinería. Ella trabaja en 
la venta de bebidas, mediante el cual puede obtener las ganancias necesarias para poder cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen. Comenta que le va muy bien, por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cervezas, whiskys, energizantes y otros, con lo cual podrá abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” committee has decided to be part of Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras program.  This group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  Each member’s success, not just economic but also personal, is the main objective the group has set for itself.  They are known in the location for being very hardworking, unified women.

Elizabeth is group President.  She lives in the city of San Lorenzo.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s a very enterprising, innovative woman.  Her husband’s a gardener.  She works selling beverages to earn profits needed to cover daily expenses that arise.  She comments that she does very well so would like to stay in business.  She’s asking for the loan to buy beer, liquor, energy drinks and others to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy beer, liquor and energy drinks.

loans.name: El Cedro Group

texts.es:
La señora Hipolita tiene la edad de 41 años, estudio hasta la primaria, se encuentra casada con el señor Gerardo quien trabaja en el campo, ellos tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian en la preparatoria. Ella y su familia viven en una comunidad  que se caracteriza por que sus habitantes son personas amables y muy trabajadoras.

Ella  platica que desde hace un poco mas de 2 años y medio decidio hacer su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes porque queria sacar adelante a sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando y apoyar a sus esposo con los gastos de su hogar ademas nos dice que cada dia la situacion economica en nuestro pais es mas dificil.

Doña Hipolita nos dice que decidio rentar un local en un logar de su comunidad, en ese anaquel tiene unos  anacales donde acomoda sus abarrotes y desde ahi  ella realiza sus ventas  y que gracias a Dios dice que le va muy bien y que siempre sus clientes encuentran lo que buscan y se encuentra satisfecha por cada dia ve que tiene mas clientes.

Ella necesita esta inversion para la compra de aceite, jabon en polvo, jabon de baño, detergente, cloro, azucar, frijol, productos enlatados, refresco, jugos, dulces, sabritas, aceitunas, galletas y crema para su posterior venta.

Doña Hipolita espera que con este credito su negocio pospere y pueda salir adelante con su negocio pues quiere tener en un futuro su negocio sea aun mas grande y que su familia tenga un buen porvenir.

Este grupo esta integrado por:

Cenorina- Taller de Costura
Camerina- Ropa Interior
Maria Lucrecia- Ropa
Eva- Abarrotes
Yuridia- Club de Nutricion
Rosalba- Abarrotes
Geronimo-Ropa Interior
Eladia- Cosmetico
Dora- Ropa Interior
Maria del Carme- Taller de costura
Lindsey- Refrescos
Martha- Cocina economica
Guadalupe- Refrescos
Denisse- Reposteria
texts.en:
Hipólita, 41, completed elementary school.  She’s married to Gerardo who works in the fields.  They have two children who are going to high school.  She and her family live in a community noted for its kind and very hardworking residents.

She tells us that a little over 2 and a half years ago she decided to start her own grocery selling business because she wanted to move her children who were going to school ahead and help her husband with household expenses; she tells us that the economic situation our country is in is more difficult every day.

Hipólita tell us that she decided to rent a locale in her community where she’s set up two sets of shelving where she arranges her merchandise and that’s where she conducts her sales.  She says that, thanks to God, she does very well and that her customers always find what they are looking for.  She is satisfied because the number of her customers grows daily.

She needs this investment to buy oil, powdered detergent, bath soap, detergent, chlorine bleach, sugar, beans, canned goods, soft-drinks, juice, candy, Sabritas brand snacks, olives, cookies and cream to resell.

Hipólita hopes that with this loan her business will progress and that she’ll be able to succeed in business because she wants her business to be larger in the future and that her family has a good future.

The group’s members are:
Cenorina- tailors shop
Camerina- underwear
Maria Lucrecia- clothes
Eva- groceries
Yuridia- nutrition club
Rosalba- groceries
Geronimo-underwear
Eladia- Cosmetics
Dora- underwear
Maria del Carmen- tailors shop
Lindsey- soft-drinks
Martha- low-cost meals
Guadalupe- soft-drinks
Denisse- pastries

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
El comité San Luis es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y sacrificadas, por lo cual ya son reconocidas en la zona por su trabajo en pos del bienestar del grupo y de la comunidad. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas mismas y la de sus familiares que de ellas dependen, quieren que sus familias no tengan que pasar por todo los sacrificios que ellas enfrentaron.
Una de las miembros es la señora Agueda, ella hace tiempo que se dedica a la venta de verduras, trabajo mediante el cual ha podido salir adelante. Comenta que todos los días muy temprano se levanta para empezar su trabajo, dice que tiene una clientela bien formada, pues siempre compran de ella.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hortalizas de todo tipo, con lo cual tendrá mas variedad para atraer a mas clientes. Está contenta por la oportunidad que se le está ofreciendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank San Luis is located in the city of San Lorenzo.  They are a group of hard-working, sacrificing women who are known in their region for their work in pursuit of the well-being of their group and their community.  They meet with the goal of improving their quality of life and that of their families that depend on them.  They do not want their families to have to make all the sacrifices that they have had to make.  

One of the members is Señora Agueda.  For some time she has been selling vegetables which has allowed her to get ahead.  She says that she gets up very early everyday to start work.  She also says that she has a well-established clientele as they always buy from her.  She is requesting a loan to buy all types of vegetables so that she can offer a wider variety and attract more customers.  She is pleased about the opportunity that she is being offered.

loans.use: purchase vegetables.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de San Lorenzo se han unido con el propósito de generar mayores ingreso, todo esto, por el bien de ellas y el de sus familias. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas que gustosas se unieron al programa de mueres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Teresa, ella se dedica a la venta de joyas. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes y clientas que siempre compran de ella. Gracias a este trabajo ella logra cubrir los gastos de la casa y a la vez tener un poco de ahorros. Dice que tiene muchos pedidos con los cuales le gustaría poder cumplir, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de anillos, cadenas, pulseras y otras joyas, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the city of San Lorenzo have joined together aiming to generate higher income.  All of this is for the benefit of themselves and their families.  All of them are friends and neighbors who gladly joined Fundación Paraguaya’s Mujeres Emprendedoras Program.

One of the members is Teresa.  She sells jewelry.  She comments that she has many customers, both male and female, that always buy from her.  Thanks to this work she’s able to cover household expenses and also have some savings.  She says that she has many orders that she’d like to be able to fill and this is why she’s asking for the loan: to buy rings, chains, bracelets and other pieces of jewelry to be able to fill her pending orders.

loans.use: to buy chains, bracelets, rings and others.

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
La formación el presente comité inicio la Sra Fatima, quien organizó a sus amigas y vecinas, de donde surge el comité denominado Las Hermanas, actualmente se encuentra en el noveno ciclo con 15 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, las cuales se dedican diversas actividades. El comité lo conforman mujeres muy sacrificadas que han luchado toda su vida para llevar adelante a sus familiares a pesar de los obstáculos que siempre existen.
Se puede comentar el caso de la Sra Fatima  quien se dedica hace varios años a la venta de comida, ella se levanta muy temprano a preparar sus alimentos para salir a venderlos .La venta lo realiza de forma ambulante en lo cual la ayudan su hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo, y condimentos, con lo cual podrá prepara los alimentos que ella vende.
texts.en:
This committee was set up by Fatima who organized her friends and neighbors and created the committee called 'Las Hermanas' (Sisters).  The group are currently on their ninth loan cycle with 15 members.  This is a group of very responsible and hard-working ladies who are engaged in different business activities.  The committee's members are very selfless women who have fought hard their whole lives to get their families ahead in spite of the obstacles they find in their paths.

Here we will talk about Fatima who has been selling food for several years.  She gets up very early to prepare her food which she then goes out and sells.  She makes her sales as a street vendor and her children help her.

Fatima is requesting this loan to buy meat, chicken and seasonings so that she can prepare the food that she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Levan

texts.en:
Levan is from the village Breta, Khashuri District, East Georgia. He is 61 years old and lives with his wife Limer.  Levan and Limer are internally displaced persons from an area of conflict.  They receive a relevant pension from the Georgian government. 

Levan has two hectares of land, where wheat, cabbages, maize and tomato are grown.  Harvested vegetables are sold locally to retailers.  Their average income is 400 Laris, including their monthly pension.  His family also owns an electrical corn mill.  Their mill is out of the order at the moment.  Levan requests a loan to repair the mill.  After the mill is running, he can get orders from neighbor households and mill various types of corns.  

Levan will get additional income and work hard to expand his family's agricultural business.

loans.use: to repair his mill.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is from Kareli, Kartli region, East Georgia. He is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife Marina and family, consisting of two daughters (ages 20 and 15) and his parents.  Marina works as teacher.  Their oldest daughter is a high-school student and the youngest goes to school. Givi’s parents are retired. 

His main source of income comes from agricultural activities.  They have a milk cow and sell cheese at the local market.  The family also owns one pig and 10 piglets.  Piglets are sold in the village as well.  Givi grows tomatoes and cabbages on family owned and rented land. Harvested vegetables are sold locally to green grocery retailers. 

Total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris.  Givi is requesting a loan to cultivate land, buy wheat for sowing as well as feed for pigs. 

Givi will harvest the wheat and sell it locally.  After fattening his pig and piglets during the winter he will sell them for good prices in late winter or spring. 

The loan will help Givi increase his family's income and their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay to the tractor for land tilling service,  to purchase  wheat for seading as well as feed for pigs

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is from the village Bredza, East Georgia. She is 52 years old.  Ana lives with her family: husband Revaz and 35 years old son Grigol. 

All family members are involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows and sell cheese, in Khashuri (nearby town).  The family grows wheat, haricot and maize on two hectares of land that they own.  Ana has a greenhouse, where she grows tulips. Tulips are sold in Khashuri as well.  Their average monthly income is 600 Laris. 

Ana requests a loan to repair her greenhouse.  It is old and can’t maintain needed temperatures.  She will also buy tulip seeds.   Ana will sell the flowers in spring.   Ana plans to reinvest her profits and rent more land to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase materials for greenhouse renovation and tulip seeds.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is from the village Kumisi. She is 40 years old and lives with her family: husband Paata and 15 years old son who goes to school. 

Mzia and Paata own five milk cows and sell milk and yogurt in Tbilisi.  Their average monthly income is 1000 Laris. 

Mzia requests a loan to buy a computer for her son as well as household goods that will make their house more comfortable and improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a PC for son and household goods for the family.

loans.name: Malkhaz

texts.en:
Malkhaz is from the village Abanoskhevi, Dusheti District. He is 52 years old and lives with his family: wife – Zeinab, daughter-in-law, 24 years old son and 80 years old mother.  Zeinab works as a cook and their son serves in the Georgian Army. 

Malkhaz leads the family's agricultural business. They have a milk cow.  Zeinab produces cheese and yogurt and sells these products in the village's open market, once in a week and daily from their home.  Along with the dairy farm, the family grows maize on land they own (.5 hectare). Some of the maize is used to feed the cow and the rest is sold at the local market. 

Malkaz requested credit to purchass an additional milk cow.  He will feed the cow with maize, harvested from his cornfield.  The family will be able to double the amount of cheese and yogurt they sell.  It will have a positive impact on their family's income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik lives in the village of Shaumiani. He is 30 years old and lives with his wife, Shushanik, his 14-year-old son, his 13-year-old daughter, and his parents. Shushanik is a housewife. Valerik is leading the agricultural business of the family. He has ten pigs and cows. He sells piglets locally, as well as dairy products. Valerik and his father also work as tinsmiths, making tin ovens which are widely used in nearby villages in greenhouses during the fall and winter months. The total average monthly income of the family is 1500 laris. 

Valerik requested a loan to purchase feed for his pigs and cows for the fall and winter months. He will feed the domestic animals well during the fall and winter and get quality milk and piglets, which will be sold for a convenient price. The family will get a planned amount of income, part of which will be used for covering the loan and the remainder of which will be spent on improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for pigs and cows.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is from the village of Shaumiani, East Georgia. He is 51 years old. Levon is married and lives with his family: wife Violeta, 22-year-old daughter, and 20-year-old son. Levon is the only income provider in the family. He owns a poultry farm with 1600 chickens. Levon raises chickens and sells hens at the local market. The average monthly income of the family is 1500 GEL. 

Levon has more capacity (space and cages) on the farm which aren’t utilized at the moment. He requested credit to purchase additional chickens. He will raise more chickens and sell more hens, which will increase the income of the family. Levon plans to use the increased income for financing the high-school education of his son.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is 44 years old. He is from the village of Gantiadi, Tsalka District, South Georgia. Zaur is married and lives with his family: wife Gulnara, 17-year-old daughter, and 11-year-old son. His children go to school. Zaur leads the agricultural business of the family. In particular, they have three milk cows. They sell the milk to local dairy wholesalers. He also has five calves. Zaur cultivates a 0.7 hectare plot of family-owned land, where he grows potatoes. He sells harvested potatoes in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). The average monthly income of the family is 900 GEL (approximately 542 USD). 

Zaur requested credit for his farm. In particular, 200 GEL will be spent for harvesting potatoes (paying the workforce) and 800 GEL will be used to purchase hay for feeding cows and calves during the winter months. In the spring calves will be sold for a good price and provide income for the family. Harvested potatoes will be sold during the winter months.

loans.use: to purchase hay for feeding the cows and cover the costs of potato harvesting

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz is from the village of Gogasheni, South Georgia. He is 35 years old, married, and lives with his family: wife Nino, 9-year-old son, 7-year-old daughter, and mother (retired). His children go to school. Nino works as a teacher in the village. Revaz is leading the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of income for them. They have six milk cows. Revaz and Nino produce and sell on average 120 kg of cheese per month. It is sold locally to the dairy-products retailers. They also have 7.5 hectares of land, where they grow potatoes, barley, and wheat. They sell harvested vegetables and corn locally to the greengrocery retailers. The family's average monthly income is 1100 GEL, including Revaz's mother's pension. 

Revaz requested credit to purchase a tractor. He will provide tilling services to neighborhood farms to earn additional income. He will also significantly reduce the cost of cultivating his own lands by using his own tractor. Revaz plans to use the additional income for further development of his farm. The additional income will also allow the family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is from the village of Gantiadi in southern Georgia. He is 29 years old and lives with his wife, Nino, and their 2-year-old son.
 
The only source of income for the family is agricultural activity. They have 2 milk cows and sell milk locally to wholesalers of dairy products. Along with the dairy, the family grows potatoes on a family owned 0.4 hectare plot of land. They sell the harvested potatoes in Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. The average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris (GEL).
 
Gela requested a loan to purchase 2 calves. He will raise the calves and next year will get more milk and consequently more profit from selling the milk. It will have a positive impact on the income of the family. They will spend more on satisfying the family’s everyday needs and will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 2 calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is married and blessed with three children. For the last six years, he has been operating a carpentry business to support the family.  He also does farming to supplement his income. He has employed four people to help him to manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to become an employer. He is requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber for making furniture. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become more financially stable.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand his roasted maize business

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 26 years old and single.  For the last two years, he has been managing a retail shop to make a living. He also does farming to earn extra income. He has retained his business because of his good reputation with his customers. In the next 5 years, he wants to become successful in his business. With this loan for 20,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to buy sugar and wheat flour for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage his business through his previous loans.

loans.use: To buy sugar and wheat flour

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 38 years old.  She is married to David and they have four children who are all in school.

Beatrice has a retail shop that she runs.  She has applied for a loan of KES 80,000 to enable her buy more milk, bread, sugar, cooking fat, tea leaves, eggs, etc. to add to her stock.   She hopes to see her business expand into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy milk, bread, eggs, tea, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy charcoal, vegetables, maize meal, wheat flour and cereals

loans.name: Fanis

texts.en:
Fanis is 57 years old and is a widower with two children. Fanis has a retail shop that she has been running for many years.  

Fanis has a very good history with KADET LTD, she is applying for her sixth loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to buy more stock to the shop like sugar, soft drinks, sweets, salt for sale.  

She hopes to expand her business and to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: buy  more stock like sugar, soft drinks, sweets, and salt for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy cattle

loans.name: Jepkorir

texts.en:
Jepkorir is 41 years old and supports a family of five people.  She has applied for a loan of Kshs 25,000 to buy more cereals to increase her business stock.  She has been in this business for a period of ten years.  

Jepkorir earns an income of Kshs 10,000 per month.   She plans to pay school fees with the anticipated profit that she gets from her business.  This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she hopes to repay it well.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to educate her children to higher levels and ensure that her business is expanded.

loans.use: buy cereal grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: start a clothes selling business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 38-year-old married lady.  She is a charcoal dealer in Mariakani.  Joyce has been in this business for the last ten years and it has been a success. 

Joyce was recently introduced to KADET LTD and this marks her first borrowing to finance her business. With this loan, she plans to add more stock of charcoal to her business. 

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back into her business and repayment of the loan. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 56 years old. She is from the village Brili in the Kartli Region of East Georgia. Mariam is married and lives with her family: her husband Jemal, their 27-year-old son, and her 86-year-old mother-in-law. All family members are involved in the family agricultural business. 

They own dairy farm with 3 milk cows and 2 calves. Mariam's family farm produces cheese and sells on average 50 kg of it in the local market. The family also owns 2 pigs and sells on average 20 piglets per year. Along with the above-mentioned activities, Mariam and Jemal grow maize, beans, potatoes and wheat to sell in the local market.  The harvested vegetables are sold locally to greengrocery retailers.  The total average income for the family is 700 Laris (approximately 420 USD) per month, including the pension for Mariam’s mother-in-law. 

Mariam requested credit to pay for cultivating the land and purchasing wheat seeds for sowing.  In the spring, she will harvest the wheat and sell it. The family will get the expected income, which will be used to cover family daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and wheat seeds

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 28 years old and married to Johana. She supports a family of three people with the help of her husband. She runs a tailoring shop. 

She has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES which she intends to use to buy more cloth materials to increase her stock. She has been in her business for a period of two years. She earns an income of 5,000 KES per month.

The anticipated profit from her business will be used to buy land for construction. This is her first loan and so she hopes to pay it back well. Her hopes and dreams for the future of her business and family is to become a better person.

loans.use: to buy more cloth materials for making dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three washing machines and raw materials and ingredients for fast food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy footwear that people have ordered from her and which the catalog is offering with special discounts

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 56 años de edad tiene en el sur  occidente de la ciudad un negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos;  allí fabrica bollos, (amasijos de maíz con queso) hayacas una especie de arroz con verduras, y tres tipos de carne envueltos en hojas de bijao y   deliciosos postres. En su condición de separada y con una hija,  que nació cuando Sonia tenía  14 años,  se residenció con ella en un país fronterizo y trabajó fuertemente durante 22 años,  para obtener un capital y emprender su propia aventura de negocios.  Inicialmente fue empleada y negociaba alimentos, hasta que finalmente decidió dedicarse únicamente a su actividad productiva. En la actualidad su mercado lo conforman tiendas, amas de casa entre otros y con ellos ha logrado relaciones de fidelidad, aprovechadas para darle curso a su otro negocio, que es la venta de mercancías. Su sueño más adelante es comprar una casa y continuar creciendo en su negocio. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas en mayor volumen y un surtido de mercancía variada que tiene encargada y con las que planea hacer crecer su inversión y su clientela
texts.en:
Sonia, 56, has a food preparation business in the southwest part of the city.  She makes “bollos” (corn dough stuffed with cheese), “hayacas” (a type of rice with vegetables and three kinds of meat wrapped in bijao leaves) and delicious desserts.  

She is separated and has a daughter who was born when Sonia was 14 years old.  She went to a foreign country to live with her and worked hard for 22 years to amass capital to start her own business.  Initially, she worked as an employee and would sell food on the side until she decided to go into this productive activity full time.  Her current market consists of stores and housewives, among others.  She has managed to establish steady relationships with them and has taken advantage of this to start another business selling merchandise.  Her dream for later on is to buy a house and to continue growing in business.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy raw materials in large volumes and an assortment of varied merchandise she has pending orders for and that she plans to use to make her clientele and her investment grow.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in larger volume and an assortment or merchandise.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, muy cerca al mar, con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 32 a 40 años. Desde muy joven fue fotógrafo en las playas y como aparecieron nuevas tecnologías y todo el mundo tenía su propia cámara, dejó este negocio y hace 6 años emprendió una actividad de comercialización de ranchos, víveres, enlatados refrescos embutidos, en su vivienda observando que en este sector no contaba una tienda. Al principio sus ventas fueron muy bajas, pero fue persistente y ha logrado paulatinamente crecer y sostenerse. Su mercado está compuesto por una clientela de pensionados de una empresa portuaria, a quienes Hugo le acredita víveres y le pagan mensualmente, así mismo amas de casa que le compran de contado y diariamente. Su trato amable y los precios que ofrece hacen que sus clientes sostengan relaciones de fidelidad. En la actualidad está aplicando para su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con comprará mercancías al por mayor, para mejorar el surtido. Su meta es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un autoservicio. Hugo tiene un gran desafío y es que su local es muy pequeño y requiere ampliarlo para mejorar el servicio
texts.en:
Hugo lives in the Puerto Colombia municipality, which is very close to the sea, with his wife and three children ranging in age from 32 to 40.  Ever since he was very young he was a photographer at the beaches.  As new technologies appeared, everyone in the world had their own camera.  

He left this business and six years ago he started selling foodstuffs, snacks, canned goods, soft drinks, and sausages at his house.  He observed that his area did not have a store.  At first his sales were very low.  However, he was persistent, and he managed to gradually grow and support himself.

His market is comprised of customers who are pensioners from the Port Authority.  Hugo gives them credit for provisions, and they pay him monthly.  At the same time, housewives buy from him daily and pay cash.  His kind treatment and the prices he offers make his customers sustain a loyal relationship.

He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to buy wholesale merchandise to improve his stock.  His goal is to expand his business until it is converted into a self-serve.  Hugo has a big challenge.  His place is very small, and he needs to expand it in order to improve his service.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Donaldo

texts.es:
Donaldo de 59 años de edad tiene un taller de herrería en el municipio de Malambo; con sus 30 años de experiencia ha logrado sostener su núcleo familiar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos.  Aprendió a trabajar en una empresa como soldador y con el apoyo de un ingeniero emprendió  su taller  en la ciudad de Barranquilla y le fue bien.  Donaldo se independizó cuando se mudó al municipio de  Malambo y allí se encuentra desde hace 16 años, en un local en su propia casa. Su negocio es fabricar cerramientos de hierro, y los costos dependen del tipo de varilla que requiera su cliente, la más económica es la de barra milimétrica de ½ y la más costosa la de 1/8. 
En su negocio para dar inició a los trabajos que sus clientes solicitan, pide un anticipo  del 40% .  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará materiales para ganar descuentos con los precios que ofrecen al por mayor y de contado y con esto su margen de ganancia aumenta.  Su meta mas adelante es mejorar su infraestructura de negocio y lograr formalizar su actividad. Mientras esto ocurre maneja un margen no menor del 30,6%
texts.en:
Donaldo is 59 years old and operates a blacksmith shop in the town of Malambo. With his 30 years of experience, he has been able to sustain his family which consists of his wife and two children. He learned this trade by working at a company as a welder. With the help of an engineer, he established a workshop in the city of Barranquilla and has done well. Donaldo became independent when he moved to the town of Malambo 16 years ago and set up a shop in his house. His business involves manufacturing iron enclosures. The cost depends on the types of rods that are requested by the customers. The cheapest one is only ½ millimeter in width and the most expensive is 1/8.

In order to start the jobs requested by his customers, Donaldo asks for a down payment of 40%. His Kiva loan is the first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy materials in bulk and with cash so that he can obtain discounted prices and increase his profit margin. His goal moving forward is to improve the infrastructure of his facilities and formalize his business. In the meantime, he manages a margin of no less than 30.6%

loans.use: to buy materials for making iron enclosures.

loans.name: César

texts.es:
César de 34 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia,la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla César es la agricultura desde hace algunos años, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, producto como el limón que puede cosecharse semanalmente, además de la gran demanda del mismo en los distintos mercados y en el consumo diario de los pobladores, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicas.  César es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia tenga más comodidades, como un mejor futuro académico para su hijo.
texts.en:
César, 34, lives with his family in his own home, which doesn't have basic services, located in the district of Tambogrande in the department of Piura.  The area is known for agriculture, cattle, and crafts.

César has worked in agriculture for several years.  He has his own croplands where he grows lemons and mangos.  A crop like lemons he can harvest weekly, in addition to the great demand for it in the different markets and in the residents' daily consumption.  He will be able to cover his family obligations with the earnings he makes.

He has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizers to improve both his land and his crops, with the goal of selling the fruit to the merchants at a better price, and in this way have economic improvement.

César is a father who is concerned that his family have more advantages, such as a better academic future for his son.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
