Aracely de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Aracely desde hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada,  pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para seguir engordando a sus animales y seguir ofertándolos a sus clientes, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Aracely es una persona trabajadora, responsable y con muchas ganas de que su familia se supere cada día más.
texts.en:
Aracely, 24 years old, lives with her husband and children in their own home. They have electricity but no running water, since their home is located in a rural area of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura. This area is known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For four years Aracely has been raising and selling sheep and barnyard fowl. Her pens, which are spacious and functional, are behind her house. She gives her animals balanced feed, grains, and grasses so they'll grow quickly and she can sell them in the regional markets. The profits she makes from selling the animals allow her to cover her family obligations.

She has requested a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed to keep fattening her animals and selling them to her customers. She will use her earnings to pay off the loan and improve her family's life. Aracely is a hard-working, responsible person who wants to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
Jorge  de 60 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace unos años aproximadamente Jorge se ha dedicado a la venta de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún y de bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería como productos de primera necesidad, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Jorge es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para brindarle a su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is 60 years old and lives with his family in their own home, which has only water and electricity services. It is located in the Paijan District in the department of La Libertad in Peru. This area is characterized by agriculture and livestock.

For several years, Jorge has sold items used daily, such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna and beverages.  His business is located in his home for convenience and security reasons. He tries to cover his expenses and improve his family's quality of life with earnings from product sales.

Through Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa, Jorge has requested a loan of 1500 soles ($550) to expand his store.  He wants to buy more merchandise including products that are basic necessities, with the idea that his business will grow and he will have more items to offer his clients.  Earnings will cover his loan and domestic financial obligations.  Jorge is a responsible, dedicated and hard-working person who would like to be able to provide his family with more comforts.

loans.use: to buy products for daily use to stock his store.

loans.name: Telmo

texts.es:
Telmo de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Telmo  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 3 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en la misma zona donde vive, a pesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, él trata en lo posible, desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y cambio de repuestos que necesita su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Telmo es una persona responsable y trabajador  que lo único que desea es que sus hijos tengan un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Telmo, 41, lives with his wife and children in their own house in the rural area of Tambogrande, Piura department.  The house has basic services.  The people of this area work in farming, cattle raising, and handicrafts.
Telmo drives a mototaxi (a method of transportation that is used to move a maximum of 3 people short distances).  He drives in the same area where he lives despite the great number of people who do the same work.  He tries, whenever possible, to begin work very early so as to drive many people to their different destinations and thus get the largest income so that he can cover household expenses and necessities of his house.

He will use the loan of 1000 new sols that he is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa for the maintenance of his mototaxi and to change the parts that it needs so that he can continue offering good service to his customers and to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to have maintenance and to change the parts needed on his mototaxi.

loans.name: Ybet

texts.es:
Ybet de 25 años, es soltera, vive en casa de unos familiares, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace un año Ybet se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y de aves de corral, su negocio lo tiene en casa de sus familiares, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y solventar sus gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza y alimento balanceado para sus animales y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir su crédito y mejorar económicamente.  Ybet es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada que con su esfuerzo a sabido salir adelante, para seguir ayudando a sus familiares con los que vive.
texts.en:
Ybet, 25, is single.  She lives with some relatives in a house without basic services in a rural area of the Tambogrande district in the department of Piura, an area known for agriculture, cattle, and crafts.  

Ybet has sold beauty products and poultry for a year.  She has her business in her relatives' house.  She has her own clientele, and with the earnings from both activities she will be able to have a better quality of life and pay her personal expenses.

She has requested a loan of 800 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products and balanced animal feed, so she will be able to get better profits to cover her loan and improve economically.

Ybet is a hard-working and dedicated woman who, through her efforts, has been able to get ahead to continue helping the relatives with whom she lives.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José de 32 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura,  ganadería y artesanía.

José desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y aves de corral), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra de más animales y de mejoramiento de su corral, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.  José es una persona que con esfuerzo y trabajo saca a sus hijos adelante junto con su esposa.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in his own house, which has only electricity, located in the Tambogrande district of the department of Piura.  The area is known for agriculture, cattle, and crafts.

José has raised and sold farm animals (sheep and poultry) for several years.  His corral is a suitable and extensive area behind his house.  He feeds them balanced feed so they will reach an optimum growth to be able to sell them in different markets in the area, and so get good profits to pay for his family expenses.

He has requested a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and improve his corral.  With the profits he will make selling his animals, he will be able to cover his loan as well as give his family a better quality of life.

José is a person who, with effort and work, gets his children ahead together with his wife.

loans.use: to buy more animals of different types and to improve his corral.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria D. 54 años D. edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio D. agua y luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.

Gregoria desD. hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (cerdos y aves D. corral), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos D. su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1000 nuevos soles  para la compra D. más animales y alimento balanceado, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida para su familia.  Gregoria es una mujer que con esfuerzo y dedicación trata D. brindarles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
54-year-old Gregoria lives with her family in her own home which has piped water and electricity.  It is located in Cayaltí district, in Chiclayo province.  The people in this area farm and raise livestock.

For eight years, Gregoria has been raising and selling farmyard animals (pigs and poultry).  Her pens are located behind her home and they are suitable and spacious.  She feeds her animals with nutritionally-balanced animal feed so that they reach an optimal level of growth and she is able to sell them in the different markets in her area.  This makes her good profits with which she covers her household expenses.

Gregoria has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and nutritionally-balanced feed for them.  She will use the profits that she makes from selling her animals to repay her loan and proviD. her family with a better quality of life.  Gregoria is a woman who, through her efforts and commitment, tries to proviD. her family with the best.

loans.use: to buy more animals of different species and feed for them

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel  D. 37 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo el servicio D. luz, ubicada en el distrito D. Paijan que pertenece al departamento D. La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

DesD. hace 5 años aproximadamente Maribel se ha dedicado a la venta D. abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, golosinas), frutas y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta D. sus productos  trata D. cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías (comestibles), con el único ideal D. que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones D. su hogar.  Maribel es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades que ofrecerles a su esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Maribel, age 37, lives with her husband and children in her own house.  The only service they have is electricity.  They live in the Paijan district in the La Libertad department.  This zone is known for its farming and livestock activities.

For about five years Maribel has been selling groceries (products that are used every day like milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, sweets, fruit, and drinks).  Her business is located in her own house for her comfort and safety.  With her earnings from selling her products she tries to cover all of her expenses and improve her family’s standard of living.

In order to be able to expand her business she has requested a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise (food).  Her only aspirations are for her business to grow, to have more products to offer her customers, and to cover her loan and her household obligations.

Maribel is a responsible, dedicated, and hard-working person.  She worries about having more comforts to offer her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock her store.

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es:
María de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

María desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un peso y talla ideal para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar animales y alimento balanceado para los mismos, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  María es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  mejore económicamente para tener otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old.  She lives with her spouse and children in her own house without basic services in the rural area of the Olmos district, which is in the department of Lambayeque, known for agriculture and cattle.

For three years María has raised and sold goats.  Her corral is behind her house, a suitable and extensive area.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grass so they will reach an ideal weight and size to sell them in different markets in the area.  In this way she has good profits to pay for her family's daily expenses.

She has requested a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy animals and balanced animal feed for them.  With the sales earnings she can cover her loan and improve her family's quality of life. 

María is a hard-working and very responsible person who only wants her family to better themselves and improve economically to have other opportunities.

loans.use: to buy other types of animals and balanced animal feed for them.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
María  de 34 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algunos años aproximadamente María se ha dedicado a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas, útiles de escritorio y otros artículos, su negocio lo ha colocado en un local propio pequeño con el que cuenta a unos minutos de su vivienda, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 800 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería como productos de primera necesidad, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  María es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarle algunas mejoras económicas  a su familia.
texts.en:
34-year-old María lives with her family in her own home.  The only basic service her house receives is electricity.  Her home is located in Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  The people in this area farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

For some years, María has been selling candies, soda, stationery supplies and other products.  Her business is located in a small sales location that she owns, a few minutes from her home.  She uses the profits that she makes from selling her products to try and cover her expenses and improve her quality of life.

In order to expand her business, María has requested a loan for 800 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more merchandise such as basic household products, with the aim of growing her business, having more products to offer her customers, repaying her loan and meeting her household responsibilities.  María is a responsible, committed and hard-working person who works hard to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as candies, soda and stationery supplies to stock her business

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio de 43 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia,  la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Julio desde hace algunos años es a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (ovejas y cerdos), su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa y los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales. También cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón, en ambas actividades recibe ingresos con losque podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicas.  Julio es un padre de familia que se preocupa por que su familia tenga más comodidades, como el brindarle un mejor futuro académico a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio is 43 years old and lives with his family in his own home.  The only basic service their home has is lighting.  They live in the Tambogrande District, which belongs to Piura Department.  The area is known for it's agriculture, livestock economy and handicrafts.

Julio's business, which he has worked at for some years, is raising and selling farmyard animals (sheep and pigs).  His corral is in the back part of his house.  He feeds his livestock animal feed and natural grasses.  He also has some of his own land on which he grows lemon trees.  He generates income from both businesses and with it is able to cover his family's expenses.

Julio has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles (USD $550) in order to purchase feed for his animals and fertilizer to improve the product from his land.  His goal is to offer a better price to the traders and improve his financial situation.  Julio is a father who is concerned with his family having more comforts and with offering his children a better academic future.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals and fertilizer to improve the product from his lands.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha  de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace dos años aproximadamente Bertha se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (todo tipo de productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos) frutas,v erduras y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos familiares.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías para abastecer su negocio, con el único ideal de que su negocio se amplie y tenga más productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes;  con el dinero que gane podrá cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones de su casa.  Bertha es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades en su hogar para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha is 34 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and children. The only service they receive is electricity. Bertha resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande in the Department of Piura. This area is known for having businesses involving farming, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For approximately two years, Bertha has been selling groceries of all types that are used on a daily basis such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, and eggs. She also sells fruits, vegetables, and beverages. Her business is located in her home for her own safety. The income from selling her products is used to cover all of the family expenses.

To keep her business in operation, Bertha is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN in order to buy more merchandise to restock her business. Her only ideal is to see her business grow and have more products to offer to her customers. The money she earns will cover her loan and her household obligations. Bertha is a dedicated and hardworking woman who is concerned about having a more comfortable home for her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to restock her business.

loans.name: Mariéme

texts.fr: Elle est une vendeuse de charbon, habitant dans une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Elle s'active dans la vente de charbons depuis son plus jeune âge,elle a hérité ce métier de sa grand mère. Ce crédit lui permet de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d'acheter du bois pour faire du charbon. Ce prêt lui permet aussi d'être autonome financièrement et d'aider son mari pour les besoins de la maison.
texts.en: She is a charcoal seller, living in a town near the capital of Senegal. She has worked at selling charcoal since she was very young. She inherited this trade from her grandmother. This loan will allow her to bolster her working capital and buy wood to make charcoal. This loan will also permit her to be financially independent and to help her husband with household needs.

loans.use: to buy wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
Amanda D. 47 años D. edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura. Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Amanda desD. hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. animales D. corral (cerdos y aves D. corral), su corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares. También cuenta con tierras D. cultivo donD. siembra limón y una vez que cosecha, tiene otro ingreso económico.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 1500 nuevos soles  para la compra D. alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizante para brindar mantenimiento a sus tierras, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta D. sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad D. vida.  Amanda es una mujer que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Amanda is 47 years old and lives in her own home with her family.  They do not receive basic services.  Amanda resides in the District of TambogranD., which is part of the Department of Piura.  This area is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.  

Amanda has been raising and selling domesticates animals, such as pigs and chickens, for a few years.  Her animal pens are located behind her house and are spacious and of the appropriate size.  Their diet consists of balanced feed.  When the animals reach the optimal level of growth, they are offered for sale at different markets in the area.  Amanda earns a good income to cover the family expenses.  She also has farmland on which she grows lemons, which generate another source of income once they are harvested.

Amanda is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN in order to buy balanced feed for her animals and fertilizers for maintaining her land.  With the revenue she generates from selling her animals, she will be able to repay her loan and have a better quality of life.  Amanda is a woman who strives to move forward with great effort and determination.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha  de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en el distrito Las Lomas que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde hace 5 años Martha se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder  implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos comestibles para abastecer su tienda, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga productos más surtidos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.  Martha es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarles otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Martha, 41, lives with her husband and children in her own house that does not have basic utilities and is located in Las Lomas District belonging to Piura Department.  This zone is characterized by farming and raising livestock.

Martha has been selling basic need items (rice, milk, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) for the last five years; she also sells beverages.  Her store is located in her house for security and comfort.  With profits she earns from the sale of her products she tries to cover all of her expenses and improve her standard of living.

To set up her business she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more groceries to stock her store.  Her only goal is that the business grows and to have a wider variety of items available for her customers.  Martha is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who strives to provide other opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Segundo Pedro

texts.es:
Segundo de 53 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con serviciosbásicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.   Esta zona se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Segundo desde hace muchos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (aves y ovejas), sus corrales se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un óptimo crecimiento para poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimento balanceado, con las ganancias que obtenga con la venta de sus animales podrá cubrir su crédito como tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Segundo es una persona que con esfuerzo y mucho empeño a sabido sacar adelante a su familia para que logren su objetivo propuesto.
texts.en:
Segundo, 53, lives with his family in his own house that does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Tambogrande District that belongs to Piura Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts.

Segundo has been raising small farm animals (barnyard fowl and sheep) to sell for many years.  His corrals, which are appropriate, are located in his back yard.  He feeds his animals nutritionally balanced feed, grasses and natural grains so that they will attain optimal growth and can be sold at various local markets producing good profits to cover his household expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed.  Profits from the sale of his animals will allow him to repay the loan and improve his quality of life.  Segundo is a person who has known how to move his family forward through his efforts and with much dedication to reach their goals.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Isoel

texts.es: Isoel vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge, quien trabaja  con él  y sus dos hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 7 y 9 años respectivamente. Allí tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas, refrescos etc, a una clientela, como las amas de casa de su sector,  que compran diariamente en muy pequeñas cantidades, que van desde 1 onza hasta 1 libra.   En este negocio Isoel tiene 4 años de funcionamiento y 1 de estar en ese lugar. Sus compras las realiza de contado en un mercado de abastos en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a 25 minutos de su municipio. En la actualidad el microempresario está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual  comprará mercancías para surtir adecuadamente la tienda.  Su negocio presenta buena rentabilidad y maneja una buena capacidad de pago. Su meta más adelante es mejorar las condiciones del local  para brindar un ambiente más comercial a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isoel lives in the town of Soledad with his spouse who works with him and with his two children who are 7 and 9 years old respectively.  He has a store there where he sells snacks, foodstuffs, beverages, soft-drinks, etc. to a clientele consisting of local housewives who daily buy in small quantities ranging from one ounce up to one pound.  Isoel’s store has been in operation for four years and has been in its present location for one year.  He pays cash for the supplies he buys in the central supply market in Barranquilla twenty-five minutes away.  

At present, this micro entrepreneur is asking for his first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan which he’ll use to buy merchandise to properly stock his store.  His store earns good profits and he has good capacity to repay the loan.  His goal for later on is to make improvements to the locale to provide a more commercial environment for his customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Carmen Lucy

texts.es:
Carmen  de 52 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural de la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y comercial.

Desde hace varios años aproximadamente Carmen se ha dedicado a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y sanguches, su negocio es ambulante, sus productos lo ofrece por las calles de la zona donde vive, con las ganancias que adquiera por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Para poder  mejorar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercadería e insumos para seguir elaborando sus sanguches, con el único ideal de que su negocio tenga mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones familiares.  Carmen es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarle algunas mejoras económicas  a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen, 52, lives with her family in her own house that only has electricity and is located in the rural part of Chiclayo Province.  This zone is noted for farming and commerce.

Carmen has sold snacks, soft-drinks and sandwiches for several years now.  She’s a street vendor and she sells her products throughout the streets where she lives.  With profits she earns through her product sales she tries to cover all her expenses and daily household needs.

In order to be able to improve her business she’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more merchandise and ingredients to continue making her sandwiches.  Her sole goal is that the business has more products to offer customers, to repay the loan and her family obligations.  Carmen is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who strives to provide some economic improvement for her family.

loans.use: to buy products she sells and to buy ingredients to continue making sandwiches to sell.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es:
Nestor es un padre de familia de 64 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de La Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Nestor desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para compra de más animales y su respectivo alimento, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Nestor es un hombre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es que sus hijos se superen y  tener mejoras económicas para brindarles estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Néstor, 64, is a father living with his wife and children in his own house that only has electricity and is located in Olmos District belonging to Lambayeque Department.  This zone is noted for farming and animal husbandry.

Néstor has been raising sheep to sell for several years now.  His corral, which is ample and appropriate, is located in his back yard.   He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grasses and once they reach optimal growth he sells them in the various local markets thus earning good profits to cover his household’s daily expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more animals and their respective feed.  With income obtained he will be able to repay the loan and improve his family’s quality of life.  Néstor is a hardworking, responsible man whose only goal is that his children prosper and that he has economic improvements so that he can provide them with higher education.

loans.use: to buy animals of other species and their respective feed.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto de 38 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su familia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Vista Alegre que pertenece al departamento de Amazonas. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Alberto es la comercializacion de café y elaboracion de aguadiente (bebida que se extrae de la caña de azúcar), negocio que tiene en la misma zona donde vive, cuenta con su propia clientela para comercializar el café, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá solventar sus necesidades diarias de su hogar 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más café e insumos para elaborar aguardiente con la finalidad de seguir comercializandolo, con la finalidad de tener ganancias parapoder cubrirsu crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida. Alberto es una persona que se preocupa por que su negocio crezca para que tenga algunas comodidades y seguir apoyando a su familia a superarse.
texts.en:
Alberto, aged 38, lives with his family in their own home, which doesn't have electricity or running water.  Their home is in the rural area of the Vista Alegre district, which belongs to the Amazonas department.  The area is characterized by its agriculture, livestock and tourism.

The business that Alberto is working to develop is selling coffee and making aguadiente (a drink made from sugar cane extract).  His business is located in the same area where he lives, and he has his own customer base to whom he sells the coffee.  With the income he earns from both activities, he is able to cover the daily necessities for his household.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa through "Capital Semilla" ("Seed Money") of 2,000 New Soles, to buy more coffee and ingredients for making aguardiente, with the goal of being able to continue selling these products.  His ultimate goal is is to have sufficient earnings to pay back his loan and to improve his quality of life. 

Alberto is a person who is focused on growing his business so that he can have some comforts and can continue helping his family to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and ingredients for making aguardiente (a drink made from sugar cane), with the goal of continuing to sell these products to his customers.

location.town: Vista Alegre - Rodriguez de Mendoza - Amazonas

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid es casada  y vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 18 años en el municipio de Soledad. Allí se dedican al comercio de artesanías, como mochilas, manillas, aretes, pulsos, sandalias mallas, hamacas, y accesorios femeninos. Ingrid oriunda de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar, cuando se vino al departamento del Atlántico, no quiso perder la conexión con la raíz artesanal de su pueblo y por eso decidió vender las artesanías producidas por su coterráneos. Con sus ingresos producto del negocio, contribuye con los gastos de su hogar y espera ofrecer cada día más bienestar a su familia. Su meta es lograr una educación universitaria de calidad para sus hijos y por eso trabaja fuertemente,  para lograr ahorros con los cuales pueda alcanzar este sueño. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará productos artesanales como mochilas, accesorios femeninos y calzado, para responder a encargos hechos por sus clientes,  a quienes está interesada en complacer pues ha logrado relaciones de fidelidad con ellos.
texts.en:
Ingrid is married and lives with her husband and three children, aged between 10 and 18, in the municipality of Soledad.  This is also where she works selling handicrafts such as backpacks, earrings, different kinds of bracelets, mesh sandals, hammocks and women's accessories.  Ingrid is originally from San Jacinto, in the Bolívar department.  When she came to the Atlántico department she didn't want to lose her connection with the artisanal background of her village, and so decided to sell the handcrafted products of her countrymen.

With her income from the business, she contributes to household expenses and hopes each day to improve her family's well-being.  Her goal is to achieve a quality university education for her children, and for this reason, she works extremely hard so as to be able to save money to achieve this dream.

Her Kiva loan is her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will buy hand-crafted products such as backpacks, women's accessories, and shoes, to meet her customers' orders.  She wants to please her customers as she has achieved a relationship with them based on trust.

loans.use: to buy hand-crafted products such as backpacks, women's accessories, and shoes.

loans.name: Takku Ligguey 6 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement a pour activité principale le commerce dans une localité située a quelque kilomètre d'une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Ndeye qui est La présidente a pour activité principale le commerce. Elle a hérité ce métier de ses parents parce qu'elle les accompagnait dans leur lieu de commerce. Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 30 ans. Ce crédit est destiné a l'achat de marchandises comme des habits prêt à porté et des fruits (mangues, mandarines, bananes, pommes) qu'elle va revendre au marché. Et lui permettra d'augmenter son  fonds de roulement en renforçant son stock de marchandises. Ce crédit lui permet d’être autonome financièrement. Avec ce prêt elle compte faire évoluer son commerce dans la région.
texts.en:
This group's main business activity is trading in an area located a few kilometers from a city near the capital of Senegal. The president inherited this profession from her parents because she would go with them to their selling place. She has been a trader for the past 30 years. This loan will be used to buy merchandise such as ready-made clothes and fruits (mangoes, mandarins, bananas, apples), which she will resell in the market.  

This loan will allow her to increase her working capital. This loan will allow her to be financially independent. With this loan, she intends to develop her trade in the region.

loans.use: to purchase stock for resale, such as fruit and ready-made clothes

loans.name: Las Reynas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucy de 35 años de edad, madre soltera, empeñosa alentadora y luchadora es madre  de 4 hijos menores  de edad  en etapa escolar .Lucy es una de las socias que conforman nueva   alcancía comunal Las Reynas.
La  socia se dedica actualmente  a su tienda de abarrotes  en general, ubicado en su misa casa, Solcita el préstamo para poder incrementar mas mercadería para así generara más ingresos .Desearía  para el futuro tener una tienda mas para así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus menores hijos .Lucy  en la foto viste una casaca color rojo, se encuentra ubicada a lado izquierdo de la  socia que viste una casaca color marrón  y buzo rosado 
.
texts.en:
Lucy, 35, is a single mother of four minor, school age children.  She’s enterprising, encouraging and tenacious.  Lucy’s one of the members of a new communal bank called “Las Reynas.”  She’s currently dedicated to her grocery store that’s located in her home.  She is asking for the loan to be able to increase her merchandise and generate higher income.  She’d like in the future to have another store to improve the quality of life of her minor children that way.  In the photo, Lucy is wearing a red jacket and she’s located to the left of the member wearing a brown jacket and pink sweatshirt.

.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es: Carmen está muy contenta, porque con su credikiva anterior compró todo lo que necesitaba para responder a su clientela:   materias primas como telas e insumos quirúrgicos y con ello aumentó su producción. Ahora está aplicando a su segundo credikiva para continuar ampliando su horizonte, pues ha ampliado el númeo D. su clientela y debe dedicarse a fabricar accesorios elegantes para vestir la silletería D. eventos festivos, que le han solicitado y este es un buen mercado. En la actualidad la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo la está postulando, el premio Citi-Acción Micrompresario Colombiano y está muy satisfecha por esta oportunidad .
texts.en: Carmen is very happy because she was able to use her previous Kiva loan to buy everything she needed to respond to her clientele: materials like fabric and surgical supplies that she used to increase production.  She’s now applying for her second Kiva loan to continue expanding her horizons because her clientele has increased and now she’s going to start making elegant accessories to cover chairs for festive events that she has pending orders for; this is a good market.  At present, Fundación Mario Santo Domingo has nominated her for the Colombian Citi-Action Micro Entrepreneur award and she is very proud of this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase materials & supplies to make seat covers.

loans.name: Takku Ligguey 2 Group

texts.fr: Aissatou est la présidente de ce groupement a pour activité le commerce, elle se trouve dans une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Aissatou est la présidente de ce groupement son activité principale repose sur le commerce, elle veut acheté des produits comme des tissus, des parfums et des chaussures qu'elle va revendre sur le marché local. Elle fait ce commerce depuis son plus jeune âge. Avec son activité elle arrive a satisfaire ses besoins. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et prétend avoir une boutique qu'elle veut renforcer en marchandises. Aussi elle pourra appuyer son mari sur la scolarité de ses enfants avec les bénéfices qu'elle aura.
texts.en: Aissatou is the president of this group and is a trader. She lives in a city near the capital of Senegal. Aissatou is the president of this group and her primary activity is trading, she'd like to purchase products such as fabric, perfumes and shoes, which she will resell in the local market. She has been a trader since she was very young. With this business, she is able to meet her needs. This loan will allow her to expand her working capital and eventually own a shop where she can stock her goods. Also, she can help her husband to educate her children with the profits she will make.

loans.use: acheté des marchandises

loans.name: Takku Ligguey 1 Group

texts.fr: Yacine habite dans une ville qui se trouve prés de la capitale du Sénégal, son activité principale est le commerce. Elle est le chef de ce groupement qui s'active dans le domaine du commerce et elle fait aussi du commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. L'usage de ce prêt est destiné à l'achat  de marchandises pour renforcer son stocks en achetant des produits comme (des tissus, des chaussures et d'autres marchandises). Ce crédit a pour but aussi de renforcer son activité et d'augmentation de sa marge bénéficiaire. Parce qu'elle souhaite dans le future acheté un magasin qui sera à sa propriété, de même elle veut aider son mari qui habite dans le milieu rural aux taches ménagères.
texts.en: Yacine lives in a town near the capital of Senegal, and her primary business is trading. She is the leader of this group, whose members all work as traders, and she has been a trader for the past 10 years. The purpose of this loan is to buy products to reinforce her stocks of fabric, shoes, and other merchandise. This loan is also meant to increase her profit margin because she would like to buy her own store in the future. At the same time, she would like to help her husband, who lives in a rural area, with household tasks.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes and other products for resale

loans.name: Antonio Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio Ignacio es casado, tiene 40 años de edad, no tuvo oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos 2 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la alfarería la elaboración de jarros, sartenes, comales todos de barro, inició este trabajo como operario y lleva 20 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica al mismo oficio.

Solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de producción ya que va a comprar barro y plomo para producir mas y mejorar sus ingresos, espera en el futuro ver un negocio grande y productivo.
texts.en:
Antonio Ignacio is married.  He’s 40 years old and never had the opportunity to go to school.  He has four children two of which go to school.  He’s a potter.  He makes jugs, pans, griddles out of clay.  He started this work as an employee and has 20 years’ experience.  His wife, who is in the same occupation, helps him.

He is asking for a loan to increase production since he will buy clay and lead to produce more and improve income.  He hopes in future to have a large, productive business.

loans.use: to buy clay and lead.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años de edad, es casada, y tiene dos hijos.

Ella se dedica a prestar sus servios como empleada domestica desde hace 11 años. Su esposo tiene una panadería, y ella le ayuda cuando sale de su trabajo. Ambos trabajan para llevar el sustento a su familia.

La señora Maria esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo, para comprar los materiales necesarios para construir un espacio al lado de su casa donde su esposo pueda tener su pequeña panadería. Los materiales que necesitan incluyen cemento y láminas de aluminio.  En la actualidad ellos alquilan un local donde su esposo hace el pan que vende en distintas comunidades. Teniendo la panadería en su casa Maria y su esposo pueden ahorrar al no tener que pagar el alquiler. De esta manera ellos tendrán mayor comodidad para elaborar el pan, y así poder obtener mejores ganancias. Con el préstamo Maria y su esposo podrán comprar todos los materiales al mismo tiempo, en vez de tener que hacer varios viajes a la ciudad. Así mismo, podrán realizar la construcción más rápidamente.

Maria espera en un futuro obtener mejores ingresos y así proporcionar una mejor vida para su familia. También desea ahorrar para asegurar la educación de sus hijos. Además ella desea hacer mejoras a su casa, ya que ciertas partes están en mal estado. La mayor parte de su casa esta construida de láminas de aluminio, y cuando llega el invierno el agua entra a su casa.
texts.en:
María, 30, is married and has two children.  She’s been working as a domestic employee for the last 11 years.  Her husband has a bakery and she helps him when she gets home from work.  They both work to support the family.

María is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy building materials and supplies needed to build a space on the side of her house where her husband can have his small bakery.  The materials they need include cement and aluminum sheets.  They currently rent the space her husband uses to bake the bread they sell in various communities.  Having a bakery at home will allow María and her husband to save since they won’t have to pay rent.  This way baking the bread will be more comfortable and profits will be better.  With the loan, María and her husband will be able to buy all the needed building materials at once instead of having to make several trips to the city.  At the same time, they will be able to complete the construction more quickly.

María hopes in future to earn better income to provide a better life for her family.  She also hopes to be able to save up to insure her children’s education.  She also wants to do some home improvements since some parts of it are in bad shape.  Most of her house is built with aluminum sheets and when winter comes water gets into the house.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a space for a bakery.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria de 59 años, vive en Soledad, municipio a 15 minutos de Barranquilla con su esposo y tiene un hijo en la edad de 34 años. Allí se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos, actividad que desarrolla de lunes a domingo, apoyada por una empleada que trabaja con ella. A Maria siempre le ha gustado el negocio, ha tenido tienda, restaurante etc, pero no se detiene. Dese hace 29 años llegaron a la ciudad y a base de negocios lograron construir su casa y últimamente adquirieron otra.  Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y consolidarlo, porque quiere hacer su casa de dos plantas para generar un ambiente más confortable a su clientela. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen e implementos de trabajo para modernizar su menaje.
texts.en:
María, 59, lives in Soledad, a town fifteen minutes from Barranquilla, with her husband.  She has a 34-year-old son.  She sells breakfasts and lunches there, an activity she carries out Monday through Sunday; she has an employee that works with her. 

María has always liked business; she’s had a store, a restaurant, etc. but she doesn’t sit still.  They arrived in the city 29 years ago and based on businesses were able to build their house and subsequently acquired another one.  

Her dream is to expand and consolidate her business because she wants to make her house into a two story house so that she can have a more comfortable environment for her customers.  Her Kiva loan is the first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy raw materials and ingredients in larger amounts and work tools to modernize her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients in larger amounts and work tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fruits

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia es una joven mujer negociante que se dedica al comercio y a la venta de alimentos, actividades  que surgieron para apoyar a su numerosa familia fortaleciendo su ingreso. En su casa hay varios negocios, su padre tiene una tienda arrendada, mientras  su madre y ella se dedican a la preparación y venta de alimentos alimentos, trabajan diariamente y desde la 6 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde. A su edad de 21 años, tiene como meta principal terminar sus estudios universitarios y por eso todos los días se esmera en el crecimiento de su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará materias primas e insuos para las comidas   y  hará adecuaciones a su cocina y a la sala, pues  desea organizar la venta de sus alimentos en la sala de su casa,  ya que funciona en la terraza donde la lluvia muchas veces baja la venta y esto es uno de los más grandes desafíos que enfrenta.
texts.en:
Claudia is a young businesswoman who works in the retail trade and sells food. Through these businesses, she has been able to push forward in order to help her large family with their income. There are several businesses that operate in her home. Her father has a rented store while she and her mother prepare and sell food. They work every day from 6am to 3pm.

At 21 years of age, Claudia’s main goal is to finish her university studies which is why she strives to grow her business every day. She is currently applying for her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Doming and will use the money to buy ingredients and supplies for her dishes. Claudia will also make renovations to her kitchen and living room because she wants to have an organized space in her house for selling food. Her business is currently located on the terrace where it rains. Many times this has resulted in low sales, which is one of the greatest challenges that she must face.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for her dishes and to make renovations to her kitchen and living area.

loans.name: Hermenegildo

texts.es:
El señor Hermenegildo es casado, tiene 50 años de edad, cursó el segundo años de educación primaria, tiene 9 hijos 3 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra y cosecha de maíz y a la crianza de animales domésticos, a la crianza de cerdos, lleva 5 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales.

Solicita un créditos para la compra de de cerdos y así mejorar su condición de vida con la crianza de animales para venderlos cuando crezcan. Espera en el futuro contar con un negocio nuevo.
texts.en:
Sr. Hermenegildo is 50 years old, married, and finished two years of his elementary school education. He has nine children, three of whom are in school. Hermenegildo is a farmer who grows and harvests corn, but he also raises domesticated animals such as pigs. He has five years of experience raising animals.

Hermenegildo is requesting a loan in order to buy pigs and to improve the living conditions of the animals he raises so that he can sell them once they reach the proper growth. He hopes to have a new business in the future.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make larger quantities of bread.

loans.name: Selvin Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Selvin Antonio  es soltero, tiene 23 años de edad, esta graduado en nivel medio como bachiller industrial,  se dedica a la tapicería de muebles, inicia este trabajo como operario y hasta el momento lleva 2 años de experiencia.

solicita un préstamo para ampliar su capital de trabajo, para la copa de materiales para tapizar mas muebles y mejorar sus ganancias, espera en el futuro contar con una fabrica de muebles.
texts.en: Selvin Antonio is single, 23 years old and has a degree from an industrial school. He makes a living doing furniture upholstery. He started out as a operator and at the moment has two years of experience. He is requesting the loan to increase his capital so he can purchase materials to upholster more furniture and increase his revenue. In the future he wants to have a furniture factory.

loans.use: to purchase upholstery materials.

loans.name: Juana Bentura

texts.es:
La señora Juana Bentura es casada, tiene 55 años D. edad, estudio un año en primaria, tiene 7 hijos y ningunos D. los cuales estudia, se dedica a la tejeduría D. telas típicas, servilletas, sabanas, etc, lleva 5 años D. experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar hilos D. diferentes clases y colores y poder producir mas tejidos, espera en el futuro su sea negocio sea granD..
texts.en: Juana is married, 55 years old and had one year of school. She has seven children, none of whom are currently in school. She makes a living weaving typical items, such as handkerchiefs, sheets, etc., and has five years of experience. She is requesting the loan to purchase different styles and colors of threads to produce more items. She hopes her business gets bigger in the future.

loans.use: to purchase thread.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Edith D. 24 años, soltera, es una joven  muy empeñosa, luchadora, alentadora por salir adelante frente a las dificultades que se les presente  en el camino. Edith es una D. las socias D. la alcancía comunal Rosa Mística. Edith actualmente se dedica a la venta D. ropas en variedad, este negocio ya viene funcionando 03 años, lo venD. repartiendo a sus amistades, familiares, vecinos. Solicita este préstamo para poder  alquilar un local  para su negocio con novedosas prendas y así pueda mostrar sus prendas D. vestir. Desearía para el futuro poder vender ropa importada en las galerías D. Huancayo y así poder generas más ingresos.En la foto Edith viste una casaca color negro y polo color marron,se encuentra ubicada al medio ,parada  ,a lado derecho D. la socia que viste una chompa color verD..
Todos los miembros D. la alcancía comunal están muy contentos por el préstamo brindado.
texts.en: Edith is 24 and single. She is a very hard-working young woman who is encouraged about making headway despite the difficulties that arise on the path. Edith is a member of the Rosa Mística community bank and has maD. a living selling a variety of clothing for the past three years. She sells to her friends, relatives and neighbors. She is requesting the loan so she can rent a space for her business with new outfits, and in this way she can display her garments. She would like in the future to be able to sell imported clothes in the Huancayo mall and to earn more revenue. In the photo, Edith is in the middle with the black jacket and brown shirt, next to the woman in the green sweater. All of the members of the community bank are very content with the loan.

loans.use: to rent a space for a clothing store.

loans.name: Green Farm Group

texts.en:
Peter is the facilitator of the Green Farm group. Peter and his group joined One Acre Fund in the 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Peter takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a very good maize yield, harvesting 8 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Peter was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Peter will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Green Farm group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

In the photograph above, Peter is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mwangaza Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Western Kenya, and the members of Mwangaze SHG group! Peter is the facilitator of the Mwangaza SHG group. As with the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, Peter and his group members are smallholder maize farmers. 

Peter takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest four bags of maize that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Peter will pay for school fees. 

In 2012, the members of Mwangaza SHG group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

In the photograph above, Peter is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Bora Bidii Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Bora Bidii Group in Western Kenya! Robai is the facilitator of Bora Bidii group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Robai takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Robai had an excellent maize yield harvesting 35 bags on two acres of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Robai was only able to harvest 18 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Robai and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Robai will educate her children and ensure food security for the family. 

In 2012, the members of Bora Bidii group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

In the picture the field officer is seen standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Jiinue Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jiinue Group in Western Kenya! Ann is the facilitator of the Jiinue group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Ann takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access high quality inputs at affordable prices. In the recent 2011 season, Ann had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Ann was only able to harvest 10 bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ann and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

In 2012, the members of Jiinue group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

On the picture the field officer of this group can be seen standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Jitegemee Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Jitegemee Group in Western Kenya! Fredrick is the facilitator of the Jitegemee group. The members of Jitegemee group are maize farmers, like most farmers in this area of Kenya. 

Fredrick takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Fredrick had a very good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Fredrick was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Fredrick will feed his family and pay school fees. 

In 2012, the members of Jitegemee group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize. 

In the picture, the facilitator can be seen standing on the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Buyanji Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Buyanji Group! Perez is the facilitator of the Buyanji group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. Like the majority of farmers in Western Kenya, the members of Buyanji group are maize farmers. 

Perez takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Perez had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Perez was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Perez and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Perez will educate his children and invest in cows and goats. 

In 2012, the members of Buyanji group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Kweselala A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Khweselala Group in Western Kenya!  Bilia is the facilitator of the Khweselala A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bilia takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Bilia had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bilia was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bilia and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Bilia will feed her family throughout the year, and invest in other assets such as cows and goats.

In 2012, the members of Khwesalala A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Stela

texts.en:
Stela is 24 years old and single with one child. Stela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as noodles, shampoo, and canned goods.

Stela has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from fish vending and pig fattening. Stela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 25 years of age, married and blessed with one child. Her husband worked as a driver.

She has been running her sari-sari (variety) store for one year. From this business she is able to earn about 500 PHP daily. She is grateful that her income allows her to help sustain the financial needs of her child and their daily needs. 

She would like to increase her income because the profit she generates from her store is not enough. For this reason, she is requesting a loan amount of 6,000 PHP in order to allow her to purchase stock groceries for her retail business such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk and sugar. 

She is hoping to send her child to a higher level of education and to improve the family's standard of living through her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock groceries for her retail business such as soft drinks, assorted biscuits, canned goods, milk and sugar

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 48 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She has been managing her hog raising business for three years. She describes herself as a patient and industrious mother.

Her business serves as a source of income for the family that helps her provide their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed and vaccine for raising her piglets. She wants to develop her business to earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies in her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for raising her piglets

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar is 43 year old and lives with his wife and four children. He works at Military Force as a guard in Dornod, a province of Mongolia. His oldest son is working as well and helping their parents.

They live all together in a small house which is in quite bad condition. His wife rents a place to sell meat. She has been doing this business for 8 years. Currently there is a need to increase the working capital of his wife's business as it is important for expanding the business in the future. And he has a plan to make adjustments to his house because it has been becoming quite old and uncomfortable to live in. Therefore, Ankhbayar is requesting a loan to purchase a large amount of meat from wholesalers for his wife’s business and also to repair their old house.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat from wholesalers for his wife’s business and to repair their old house

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is married and has five school-aged children. He is 53 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Alfredo is engaged in palay (unmilled rice) production to earn a living. He has planted several types of palay. Being in the business for quite some time, he has encountered both failures and successes. Palay production is the leading means of livelihood in this area. Alfredo earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. He has borrowed 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers needed to sustain the plants' growth. 

In the future, Alfredo hopes to have a good harvest in this harvesting period. He plans to take care and finance additional farms to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife and 9-year-old daughter. They live in a small barn. He is a crane man for a private construction company and was awarded as an employee of the company. Gantulga is a very diligent and helpful person. His wife is a janitress at a pharmacy.

With their low income they couldn’t fix their barn and it became hard for them to live in their barn during winter. In order to have better living conditions, he has asked for a loan to purchase the building materials to fix his house barn.

loans.use: to purchase the building materials to fix his house barn

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Some women get married early, but Vilma just married at the age of 36. With her desire to help her parents financially, she went abroad and worked as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) for almost three years. She came back to the Philippines and decided to start a business to serve as her source of income.

Vilma started her business when she was still single. She had only one pig until the business became established and she has expanded it by adding more piglets to raise. Vilma has been in the business for almost 30 years. Vilma now has six pigs to raise for fattening. With the high cost of feed, Vilma is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She believes that the loan will be a big contribution to maintain her business and continue it as her source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 29 years old, is married and has two children. The family lives in the peaceful village of Pinopoc, Alcala, Cagayan. Marilyn's spouse works as a farmer and Marilyn sells fruits and vegetables to boost their income. She has been selling eggplants, carrots, cabbages and tomatoes to the people in her village for almost a year, and it occupies her daily schedule. 

Marilyn is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy eggplants, tomatoes, cabbages and bananas to sell. This would help increase her sales and boost her profit. In the future, Marilyn wants to improve her sales and continue to educate her children. She wants them to have a degree and seek good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, tomatoes, cabbages and bananas to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita works hard to generate income for her family. She is widowed and has four children to sustain. Despite the family's difficulties, Nenita still thinks of positive ways to lift her family out of poverty. She sells fruits and vegetables to generate income, usually earning an income of PHP 5,000. 

Nenita is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to improve her sales by buying additional fruits and vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, string beans, bananas and eggplants, In the future, she wants to achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes, string beans, bananas and eggplants to sell.

loans.name: Cheun

texts.en:
Cheun is a widow with two daughters - one is married and the other is a garment worker. Cheun lives along National Road No. 5, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Cheun is a rice farmer. She also sells boiled peanuts when she is not farming. Cheun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help with her farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, pipes and a water pumping machine to spray her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, pipes and a water pumping machine

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is single. She lives with her sister and widowed mother in a suburb about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Chanthy sells bread. She buys it from a bakery in Phnom Penh and resells it in her village. She has received one Kiva loan and is now asking for a second one, in the amount of $250, to construct a concrete path leading to her house.

loans.use: To construct a concrete path leading to her house.

loans.name: Mat

texts.en:
Mat and his wife, Mary (pictured above), live along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have four sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married, two are fishermen, and the other two attend school. 

Mat and his wife fish for a living. Mat hopes to continue his business because it’s the family's main source of income. He is therefore requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets

loans.name: Auy

texts.en:
Auy and her husband, Chhung, are farmers. They have been married since 1972 and have five children - two sons and three daughters. Two of the children are married and live outside the family home, one sells cosmetics and perfumes, one is a driver and one assists his parents with the farming business. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Auy is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm. She will also use a part of the loan to provide capital for her daughter to purchase additional cosmetics and perfumes to sell.
