loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm and to provide capital for her daughter to buy cosmetics and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Loeng is a widow with two children - one son and one daughter. She lives in a small village across the Mekong River and about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Loeng sells fruits, vegetables, grocery items and sugar cane juice in the village market. She is asking for a loan of $550 to buy weaving materials to help her sister’s weaving business. She will also buy additional vegetables for sale.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her sister’s weaving business and to buy vegetables to sell at the market

loans.name: Neda

texts.en:
Neda is 47 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Neda runs a convenience store in the Philippines and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her convenience store.

Neda has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her convenience store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling charcoal and rice.

Neda aspires to repair and renovate her family home and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her convenience store.

loans.name: Chamnap

texts.en:
Chamnap (pictured above) is a weaver. She also buys finished silk products from other weavers in her village to resell in Phnom Penh market. 

She has been married since 2001 and has two sons - one who is in school and the other who is too young for school. She lives in a village across the Mekong River, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband has full-time employment at a company in Phnom Penh.

Chamnap is in the process of building her new house, but she lacks the money to finish it. Hence, she has decided to ask for another loan in the amount of $1,200 to finish building her house.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Tuvshinbat

texts.en:
Tuvshinbat is 26 years old and lives with his daugther and wife in a house in Govisumber province in Mongolia. His wife sells goods at the local market. 

Tuvshinbat started his business in 1991 by selling Russian ice cream at the local train station. He followed his mother who was also selling ice cream. He buys Russian ice cream that costs between 100,000 MNT and 120,000 MNT from Ulaanbaatar City and sells it on the train and in the train station. He is well-acquainted with the railway staff members. 

Tuvshinbat bought a 6,000,000 MNT house by paying 500,000 MNT each month. He has already paid 4,000,000 MNT for the house. He would like to expand his business. He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to grow his business and rent a sales stall.

loans.use: To rent a new sales stall for his business.

loans.name: Suth

texts.en:
Suth (in the photo), 51, is single. She has one adopted son who is in his last year of university studying Information Technology. Suth lives with her parents in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from City. 

Suth is a farmer. She is asking for her first loan of 1,000 USD to pay school fees for her son. It’s his last year of university, so he also needs some money to spend on research documents and other materials for writing his thesis.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son.

loans.name: Naroeun

texts.en:
Naroeun (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver, while her husband, Ra, is a motor taxi driver. They have been married since 1996 and have one young daughter. They live in a village across Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Nareoun hopes to continue her weaving business, so she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase silk materials.

loans.use: To buy silk material for her weaving business.

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Somaly is 39 years old and her husband, Vet, is 45 years old.  They live along National Road five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1990 and have four children – three sons and one daughter. One is a garment worker and the others are in school.

Somaly sells Khmer noodles; she buys them from her village and transports to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband is a motor taxi driver; he hopes to switch from the motor taxi to a Tuk-Tuk, because it could carry more goods and people than a motor taxi.  Somaly wants to help her husband’s business by purchasing him a Tuk-Tuk, so she is asking for her first loan in the amount of $800.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk-Tuk for her husband.

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar is 24 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger – a Mongolian yurt – in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed, while he drives a taxi in his hometown.  He started his business in June, 2011, and has been able to sustain it enough so that it has become the main source of income for his family. He is planning to expand his business in the near future. He is a diligent and hard-working man who says "I bought my taxi car by taking loans. I want to finish this loan." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay off his car loan.

loans.use: To pay off his car loan

loans.name: Regzen

texts.en: Regzen is 32 years old and lives with his wife and children in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife helps him to manage the family business as a shopkeeper. He started his business in 2005 by selling foods and other products, and subsequently gained five years of work and business experience. Then in 2010, he opened a grocery store. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a family oriented and diligent man who says: "I want to expand my business and bring in products from Ulaanbaatar city." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more grocery products and to increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en: Azamat is 24 years old and lives with his wife and children in a ger in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed at the moment. Azamat started his business in 2006 by selling vegetables, which he had previously done with his parents. His turnover capital has reached 1,000,000 MNT. In addition, he has received a truck from his parents and now transports vegetables for others. In the future, he plans to expand his business. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says: "I have many plans for my family and business. The most important plan is to build a house." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes had been managing her sari-sari (variety) store for almost five years. In this business, her daily income of about P200 serves as revolving capital and stock commodities to continuously operate the store.  She spends most of her time in monitoring sales from her store.

She is now 57 years old and was separated from her spouse five years ago. She has one child who is now presently working in a factory and sometimes helps her in times of need.

She is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee and instant noodles to sell in her sari-sari store. These additional commodities would help increase her sales. 

Lourdes would like to keep making better sales to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, milk, sugar, coffee and instant noodles to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 56 years old and widowed for almost 10 years. She has six children and only one of them had the opportunity to enter into college due to lack of financial assets to sustain all of them. Three of her children are already married and live on their own.

To generate income, she manages her sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products, such as canned goods, biscuits, soap, shampoo and toothpaste, to the people in her village. She also raises hogs to fatten and sell in the future for an additional income.

She is now asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, coffee, milk, instant noodles and detergents to sell in her store. She wants to continuously generate income to provide sustenance for her family. 

In the future, Herminia would like to enhance her variety store and her hog raising business in order to achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, coffee, milk, instant noodles and detergents to sell in her store.

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 57 years old and is married with three children. She raises hogs to fatten and for future sale to butchers who come into their village. She has been in this business for almost 20 years and she proudly says that she was able to support her children's  studies. According to Precila, raising hogs needs patience and proper maintenance to make a profitable net income when they are ready for disposal.

She is now asking for a loan of P25,000 to have additional capital to buy vitamins, medicines and feed for her hogs. She also wants to buy additional hogs to raise.

In the future, she wants to improve her hog raising business and keep growing as an entrepreneur, and someday make herself financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise, plus vitamins, medicines and feed for them.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
At her age of 58, Milagros still works hard to generate an income. She has been a widow for 23 years now. She had four children. Unfortunately, all her children finished only their secondary education and were not given an opportunity to enter into college due to the financial burden. They are now working as farmers and sometimes help her financially. 

Milagros raises hogs to fatten. She has been doing it for almost five years. She is now borrowing a loan of P8,000 to buy hog feed and vaccines in order to make her business more profitable.

In the future, Milagros would like to construct a more convenient pigpen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice used her previous loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add more stock of clothes.  With the increased stock, she was able to attract more customers to her business, hence more profit generation. Alice managed to raise her living standards with the increased income.

She has requested another 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes for her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel used his previous loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy charcoal. He generated a lot of income from his business. With the increased income, he was able to raise his living standard.

Now, Samuel wants to open a salon and a barber shop, so he has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings.

loans.use: To open a barber shop and a salon

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a hardworking man who owns an internet cafe in town. He is thankful for the previous loan because he was able to buy a photocopying machine and a scanner which has boosted his business. He intends to use this loan to buy land so that he can build his own residential house since it has always been his family dream.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, who is 27 years old, is a housewife. Her husband is a cleaner who earns $6 per day. They have two children, a one-year-old and a five-year-old. One of their children is in school.  

Every month, Phalla has to spend $40 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy wood to build a grocery store in front of her house. She used to work in a restaurant, but she decided to quit because she needed to take care of her children. She expects that her new career will bring in additional income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy wood to build a grocery store.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 44 years old, is doing farming and earns $3 per day. Her husband is also a farmer and earns $3 per day. They have five children, four are studying and one more is a farmer and earns $3 per day. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $15 on electricity, $60 on school fees, and $30 on transportation.

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy cell cards from the mobile phone company to resell so that she can make some profit from it. She plans to sell grocery goods in front of her house after she rests from doing farming. She hopes to be able to send her children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy cell cards from the mobile phone company to resell

loans.name: Re

texts.en:
Re, 48 years old, is a fish seller earns $6 per day. Her husband is a fisher and earns $4 per day. They reside with one child and he is working as a construction worker earning $4 per day. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $7 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy a boat and fishing equipment for fishing. This family did not want to change their career because they have been doing it for long time and can make a good income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy a boat and fishing equipment

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is works hard to improve his family's living situation. He is 36 years old, married and thankful because the couple have been blessed with two children, now school-aged. To make a living, he is engaged in a retail store, operating for three years and based in their home. He earns about 300 (Philippine peso) daily.

He is aiming to increase his profits due to expensive basic commodities and high electric bills. So, for this reason, he is asking for financial assistance in the amount of P20,000 to purchase additional groceries such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, ingredients, instant noodles and biscuits for his grocery store. He believes that he can improve his store through the loan amount he has requested.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, instant noodles and biscuits to sell in his grocery store

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Ros, 36 years old, sells clothes and drums and earns $10 per day. Her husband is a policeman and earns $3 per day. They have two children, 5 and 3 years old and one is studying. Every month, she has to spend $45 on food, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy clothes and drums to sell. She has plans to buy other souvenir products to sell in her store so that she can make more money. For her children, she hopes to send them to study in the university.

loans.use: To buy clothes and drums to sell

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 34 years old, married, and mother of one child. She is a poultry farmer. She has been in the business for the past three years.

This is her second loan from KADET. She repaid her previous loan successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase chicks and chicken feed. Anticipated profits will be used for repayment of her loan and to plough back into the business. Her dream is to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 35 years old, a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling ground nuts paste in Kator branch in south sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase more ground nuts paste to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help  to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more ground nut paste to sell.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy, 38 years old, is doing manual work from coconut, earning $7 per day. Her husband is a policeman, earning $3.5 per day. They have five children, three are studying, one is doing manual work, earning $3 per day. The youngest one is still too young to be in school. 

Every month, Thy has to spend $83 on food, $15 on school fee, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy a generator for her business. She wants to extend her career to have a big place that can produce more coconut products to sell.

loans.use: to buy a generator for her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa Vergara is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 27 years old and married, with one school-aged child.

Marissa owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 200 PHP a day.

Marissa is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Torn

texts.en:
Torn, 51 years old, resides in Siem Reap province which is known as a province that is full of ancient temples and is a popular tourist spot. Torn is a vegetable and fruit seller, earning $10 per day. 

Torn is a single mother with three children: two are studying and one more is working in a bus station, earning $5 per day. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $20 on school fees, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her child to travel to work in the town. She wants to extend her career to buy and sell more fruit and vegetables. She would also like to  sell groceries when she has enough money. For her children, she wants to support them to get highly educated in English so that they can find jobs in Siem Reap easily.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her child to travel to work.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy onions for planting.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is 28 years old and married and is engaged in a piggery business as a source of income. He was blessed with one child. Despite the difficulty of caring for his pigs, he is patiently working hard to achieve greater income soon. His wife also helps him to improve their living conditions through selling vegetables in their market every market day.

Elmer is requesting a loan amount of P15,000 to buy feed for his hogs to avoid food deficiencies. He hopes to earn a higher income for security purposes in times of emergencies as well as for the future studies of his child.

loans.use: to buy feed for his hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 30 years old and married to a farmer in the village where they are living. The couple is blessed with three school-aged children. To increase her family's household income, Marites has been engaged in her retail store business for almost two years and earns about 500 PHP daily.

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional stock items to sell, such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of the family and save money for the future. She believes that through her patience in managing her business she will be able to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional stock items to sell, such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles and other ingredients.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 40 years old and has been operating his piggery business for two years. During these years, he has encountered the lack of feed for his pigs. He wants to have bigger and better nourished pigs, so in order to attain this wish, he is requesting a loan amount P12,000 to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs. He hopes this will make his pigs healthier so he can sell them at a greater price soon, at disposal time. 

George was blessed with two children who are currently studying. This causes him to strive more to uplift their living conditions and to give a comfortable life to his family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar is 55 years old and is engaged in a hog fattening business as a source of income. He is married and has three adult-aged children. He has been managing his hog raising business for five years. He is a patient and industrious father and husband. He operates a farming business as well as his hog fattening business. It is difficult to operate two businesses at a time, but his willingness to lift his family out of poor living conditions causes him to take on such a difficult responsibility.

Now, he is requesting a loan of P15,000 to buy feed and vaccine for his hogs. He wants to develop his hog fattening business more and earn a higher income in order to save for unexpected circumstances such as sickness.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccine for his hogs.

loans.name: Samoun

texts.en: Samoun, 31 years old, resides in Siem Reap, which is known as a province that is full of ancient temples and tourism. She is a food seller and earns about $5 per day. She is a single mother with one child, 5 years old, and he is studying in school. Every month, she has to spend $60 on food, $5 on school fees, and $10 for other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy grocery goods to sell at a food shop. She wants to extend her career to sell groceries when she can get more income.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell at a food shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, snack foods, beverages, candies and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
With his determination to improve his family's poor living condition, Joseph is patiently suffering hardship in operating his piggery business as a source of income. He said that this occupation isn't that easy as it needs hard work and patience to provide better nourishment to his pigs. Because of this, this 36-year-old man is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

He usually earns about 5,000 PHP every selling time, but sometimes it is inadequate to sustain all their expenses, so his wife also helps him in providing the needs of his family. He let his wife build a store in front of their house. With the help of his loan, he would improve his piggery business. He hopes to achieve success in the future in order to have a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs

loans.name: Rogylyn

texts.en:
Rogylyn is 32 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She is a very industrious mother. She is sending her two children to school through her hard work. She has been operating her hog-fattening business for nine years and earns an average net income of 10,000 PHP each selling season.

She just finished her high school and never entered tertiary education due to poverty. She wants to avoid this happening to her children, so she is being patient in her work as she stated the fruit of hard work is success. She is asking for a loan amount of 7,000 PHP to buy feed and two hogs to raise in order to earn more income for the betterment of their lives. 

She wants to improve her business in order to provide their educational needs. She is hoping that her children will become respected people someday and then help her to provide financial stability.

loans.use: to buy feed and two hogs to raise

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy, 36 years old, resides in Siem Reap province, which is known as a province that is full of ancient temples and tourism. She is an animal seller and earns $6 per day. Her husband is a bread seller and earns $10 per day. This couple has four children and all of them are studying in school. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $20 on school fees and $15 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a tok-tok (a motorcycle-based taxi) for doing a tok-tok service when her husband is free from selling bread. This loan will help her family to have a new career that will make more income. She wants to have a shop in the market to sell bread when she has enough money. For her children, she will support them to study in the university.

loans.use: to buy a tok-tok for doing a tok-tok service

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is from the province of Isabela. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She has been engaged in a direct selling business for over six years now.

Her business serves as a source of income for her family and helps her provide their daily needs. Now she is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy additional stock of items for her direct selling business such as apparels, clothing and some cosmetics. She wanted to develop her business to earn a higher income and save some of it for any future emergencies for her family security.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items for her direct selling business such as apparels, clothing and some cosmetics.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: Nary, 31 years old, resides in Siem Reap, Cambodia, which is a province known for ancient temples and tourism. She is working for the government and earns $4 per day. Her husband, who is also working for the government, earns $5 per day. They have two children, 12 and 8 years old, who are studying. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a plot of land for doing farming. This loan will help her family because she won’t have to buy rice from the market. She plans to buy pigs to feed and sell when she has enough money. She wants to send her children to study at the university and she hopes they can get jobs in a bank.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land for doing farming.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in the Kator district of Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Hawa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to help her purchase more charcoal to sell. She says that she will use the extra income from this loan for building a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 24 years of age and is newly married. He is in the hog raising business, primarily raising pigs for breeding. He has been in this business for almost two years and earns an average income of P5,000 monthly. Jerry’s wife is a housekeeper and his partner in managing his business.

Jerry dreams of maintaining and developing his business to earn higher income. He plans to improve his strategies in managing his business. He is asking for a loan of P30,000 to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs. Jerry believes that this loan will help him to attain his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Jenny Ann

texts.en:
Jenny Ann is 26 years of age and is married to a tricycle driver in the local community. She usually buys piglets, then raises and fattens them and resells them for a profitable price in the market in town. She has four years of experience in this field.

She would like to acquire more livestock for the future. For this purpose she applied for 10,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa is 26 years old and lives with her husband and children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She was married this year. She started her business in May, 2011 after buying 2 milking cows. She sells yogurt and milk. She milks 10 liters of milk from each cow. 

She participates in the School Lunch Program and supplies 100 liters of yogurt per week to the local high school. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I have a plan to expand my business and buy more milking cows." She is requesting a 630,000 MNT loan to buy hay and grass for her cows.

loans.use: to buy hay and grass for her cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock and food for her family.

loans.name: Ter

texts.en:
Ter, 49 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province known for its ancient temples and tourism. Ter buys and resells recycled items, earning $3.50 per day. Her husband works for the government, earning $5 per day. The couple has six children: five are studying and one is a construction worker, earning $4 per day. Each month, Ter spends $80 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses.

Ter would like to request a loan of $500 to buy recycled items for resale. She can earn a good income with this job and therefore wants to extend it when she has enough money. Ter hopes to support her children to study and to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy recycled items for resale

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 35 years old and has been engaged in the piggery business for five years. She says that this occupation is not easy; however, because of the determination and inspiration that her children provide, she does everything for the benefit of their underprivileged lifestyle.

Ofelia is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to provide for the needs of her pigs by giving them better feed and vitamins. She is patiently growing her business into a bigger venture. She hopes that someday she will achieve her dream and lift her family from poverty.

loans.use: to buy better pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Rizzalynne

texts.en:
Rizzalynne is 34 years old and married. She is thankful because our Creator blessed her hardware business which provides all the expenses needed for the family's everyday living. With her laborious personality, Rizzalynne is soaring high. But there are times that she pities herself because her children and her husband are slowly getting away from her. Due to working hard every day, she stays at her business just to monitor her income. 

Rizzalynne has asked for a loan of PHP 25,000 from Alalay sa Kaunlaran Inc./Kiva to enable her to add an employee and to buy additional products such as galvanized steel posts, clothespins and air hose couplers. She hopes this may lead to the development of her business to provide a better income. Then she can leave her hardware business to her confidante with confidence for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to add an employee and to buy additional products

loans.name: Meni

texts.en:
Meni is a 34-year-old lady who is married to Melki, a 43-year-old man. They are blessed with four children: Yulmen, 18, and Sani, 16; both are at Senior High School and currently living with their grandmother in another village; Jesica, 8, at the fourth grade of Primary School and Alda, 1, not at school yet. 

Meni’s husband supports their family by selling fish from door to door, but the profit generated is often insufficient to fully cover their daily needs. Meni then decided to run her own business, a kiosk, to support her husband in generating more income. Meni has been running the business for three years. She initiated the business by using her own small capital. 

Meni and her husband are a hard-working couple. They are thinking about running another business such raising livestock: cattle and pigs. Meni is optimistic that the business will help them generate more income for their family. Therefore, she would like to request a loan of IDR 10,000,000 to purchase young cattle and piglets to be raised and to purchase more stock such as instant noodles, shampoo, snacks, etc. for her kiosk business. Meni is hoping that TLM will approve her loan application soon.

loans.use: to purchase young cattle and piglets to be raised and to purchase more stock such as instant noodles, shampoo, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 58 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province known for its ancient temples and tourism. She is a cleaner, earning $3 per day. Her husband works for an organization, earning $3 per day. The couple has two children, who both work in a hotel, each earning $5 per day. Every month, Mary spends $99 on food, $10 on electricity, $5 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $650 to buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to travel to work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda, a 53-year-old mother of seven children, is the operator of a motorcycle service that has been in operation for seven years. Working hard every day just to meet the needs of her family, she also sells frozen food in the village for additional income.

Yolanda has requested a loan of P7,000 (Philippine pesos) to buy paint for her motorcycle and frozen food to sell. She hopes to increase her profits so that she can sustain the financial needs of her family, improve their standard of living, and save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy paint for motorcycle maintenance and frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Milo

texts.en:
Milo is 48 and has two school-age children. They live happily in a village planting rice and vegetables and raising livestock for sale. As a responsible father, he aimed to earn more income to satisfy the family's needs and to support the education of the children. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, he aimed to improve his hog-raising business to increase his income.

To accomplish this, he is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He believes that this loan will help a lot to make his business grow and become a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Dany

texts.en: Dany, 28 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province that is known for ancient temples and tourism. She and her husband are construction workers, and they earn $8 per day. Dany has two children, one in school. Every month, she has to spend $50 on food, $5 on school fees, $10 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a motorbike for her family to travel to work. She has a plan to buy pigs to feed at home when she has enough money. She wants to support her children in studying at the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to travel to work

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur is 46 years old and lives with his children and wife in a house in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife sews clothes and plants vegetables. His daughters are college and high school students. 

Gantumur has been working as a truck driver at the grain field since 1999. He also provides a land-removal service to people and organizations. His wife makes deels -- traditional Mongolian coats -- at home and is well recognized in the local area. His family plants several types of vegetables and sells them. Gantumur is a hard-working and open-minded man who says "I want to expand my business and have new equipment." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy spare parts for his tractor.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ever

texts.en:
Ever is 29 years old and married, with six children, four of whom are in school.  She has a charcoal-selling business in Kator branch in South Sudan.  She has been in this business for three years.

Ever requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to allow her to purchase more charcoal to sell.  She will use the extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea, 32 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province that is known for ancient temples and tourism. She is a gas exchanger and earns $7 per day. Her husband is a food seller who earns $10 per day. She has three children, two are studying and one is too young to attend school. Every month, she has to spend $80 on food, $7 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy gas cans for exchange with her customers. Before, she helped her husband selling food, but she wants to have another career that can make additional income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy gas cans for exchange with her customers

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
With her desire to improve her family's standard of living, Leticia, a 59-year-old married mother of six, spends most of her time in her retail store business. In operation for five years, she earns approximately PHP 6,000 a month.

In order to expand the business, Leticia is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional groceries, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and rice to sell. She hopes to grow her general store to secure her family's future. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries, canned goods, shampoo, soap, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 33 years old and lives in the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is married and has four school-aged children. Marilyn has a retail store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. 

Marily has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell to support the needs of her family. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en: Adiya, 51 years old, lives with her husband in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. All of her children live on their own. Adiya and her husband started their business in 2001 by selling meat at the local market and other places. They go to the countryside and buy livestock, which they then transport to Ulaanbaatar and sell to traders. They have been doing this business for many years and have profound business and work experience. They also have many regular clients and purchasers. Adiya is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I want to expand my business and buy a truck. Having a truck will help me a lot to manage things." Adiya is requesting a 650,000 MNT loan to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is engaged in the piggery business as her primary source of income. She has been unable to find a better job because she just finished high school and belonged to a poor family, and therefore could not pursue her education.
 
At the age of 61, Dominga still needs to work hard to provide for her family's needs. She dreams of lifting her family from poverty. She also wants to provide the necessities for her pigs and has therefore asked for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy pig feed and vitamins. She hopes this will make the pigs fit and nourished to provide higher sales at disposal time.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Neing

texts.en:
Neing, 27 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province known for its ancient temples and tourism. She sells drinks, earning $4 per day. Her husband is a driver in a company, earning $3 per day. The couple has three children: two are studying and one is too young for school. Each month, Neing spends $50 on food, $10 on school fees, and $15 on other expenses. 

Neing would like to request a loan of $300 to buy clothes and drinks to sell. She previously sold postcards, and other things with some drinks but now she wants to sell clothes and more kinds of drinks so that she can make more income. She plans to sell food for the tourists when she has enough money.

loans.use: To buy clothes and drinks to sell

loans.name: Arn

texts.en: Arn, 35 years old, resides in Siem Reap, a province known for its ancient temples and tourism. She is a basket maker and she also feeds chickens to sell, earning $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning $5 per day. The couple has four children: three are studying and one is too young for school. Each month, Arn spends $50 on food, $18 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $300 to buy chickens to feed. If she can earn a good income from feeding chickens, she will buy more chickens to feed and sell.

loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Nejowa

texts.en: Nejowa, a married woman with seven children, all of whom are in school, has operated a business for the past four years selling clothes in Kator branch in South Sudan. Nejowa has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more clothes to sell, and  will use the extra income resulting from the loan to pay for her children to continue going to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Kann, 31 years old, resides in Siem Reap, Cambodia, which is a province known for ancient temples and tourism. She is an animal seller and earns $7 per day. Her husband transports dirt to sell and earns $10 per day. She has three children, all of whom are studying. Every month she has to spend $50 on food, $20 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy pigs to feed and then sell. Before, she was a farmer, but found that if she fed a few pigs at home, she could make a good income.  So she decided to feed more pigs at home for more income.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and then sell.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is engaged in a hog-raising business to generate additional income and help her husband to increase their income. She is 47 years old and has one school-age child. She aims to improve their standard of living and to give their child a better future. Elma and her husband work hard and strive harder to earn income and satisfy their basic necessities. 

Due to financial difficulty, she is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that through this loan, she will improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable of source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 52 years old, married, with two school-aged children. Her family is her motivation for improving her business. She works hard because she wants to have a better quality of life by doing something that brings in additional income and allows her to support her children in their studies.

Corazon owns and operates a business managing food production and sales. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling "shang hai" for food. Aside from that, she also engages in direct selling to businesses. She has been engaged in her businesses for more than four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Due to the high cost of basic commodities, she wants to request a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase ingredients needed to make more products to sell. She would like to increase her income because the profit she generates from her business is not enough. She hopes that she can get the amount she requests to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make more products to sell.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school, while the others are grown up. Her husband is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family’s basic needs. She has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

She has operated a vegetable grocery for the past ten years; in addition she practices farming. Her potential clients are her neighbors and passers by. She faces a major challenge of market price fluctuation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With a Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase vegetables for her business. She decided to join Yehu because it is responsible for its clients.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for her business.
